story:
The Letter is a short film in the coming-of-age/comedy-drama genre. 

Upon receiving a letter that would reveal her future,  a normally decisive young dreamer’s decision whether or not to open it is coloured by the loss of her mother, the choices that lead to it, and the reality of a world built to benefit the fortunate.

Our film will explore a world where the United States Postal Service has risen to near mythical levels of influence, every citizen receives a letter on their 18th birthday that reveals to them their future. We follow Robin McKinley, who, upon receiving her letter, must navigate the hopes and fears of her family, a falling out with her best friend Jamie, and her trust in the fairness of the letters. 

The Keys for The Letter all have prior experience working with one another. We have all recently graduated from the same program and are looking to create something we can call our own and show the industry what we are capable of. 

Our Cinematographers Demo Reel: https://vimeo.com/502436440?fbclid=IwAR0gO90blZ...

Our Directors Demo Reel: https://vimeo.com/507103042

 

When I was twelve years old, I had my palm read by a psychic. She predicted that I would have 4 children and that I would live half a life. As a child, it can be traumatizing to hear an adult tell you, you won't live a full life. I had no reason not to believe her, so the constant thought that I won’t grow old stuck in the back of my mind. Even if I wasn’t vocal about it to my parents or friends, it was something that I thought about constantly. How could someone tell a twelve-year-old boy that they weren’t going to live a full life? Did she not like my shirt or my haircut? As I grew up my beliefs changed, and I realized that it is impossible to determine somebody’s life for them and that the only outcomes that are decided are the ones that you make on your own.

 I still think about the psychic’s words to this day and the idea of prophecies. That anxiousness as a child traveled from me into “The Letter”. When I initially had the idea of a letter arriving at your front door that holds your future, I thought it was crazy. There were so many complications with the actual premise, that you couldn’t possibly turn it into something that people would find meaningful. The question I constantly had to keep asking myself was that if I were in Robin’s (our protagonist) position, would I open it? Would others?

I’ve asked this question to friends and family and everyone had different answers. For me, I don’t think I would. There is a lot of pressure on children to grow up and I think everyone is affected by this in one way or another. I remember being 18 years old like Robin is and being in that position, minus the fortune-telling letter. I had to make a decision that would lead me on a path I would have to follow for the rest of my life. I can feel her anxiety as I read the script and I know how hard it is to make a decision so big, especially as a decisive person. I now know what I would go back and tell myself, to take a breath and to trust my heart, which is something that I always saw Robin doing in every version of this story that has been written or worked.

I see a lot of similarities between Robin and me. Both of us have a lot of dreams and aspirations. We have high expectations of our lives and I think that we share some of the same problems that I had growing up. I think it made the entire writing process easy to be able to relate it to James and I's experiences. Hopefully with that, the audience will be able to connect to this wild and dark world that we’ve created. 

We have calculated our budget in order to create and maintain the best/safest standard of production. With your kind donations, you will help fund: 

Location: Renting a house that embodies our main character, and a studio. 

Catering: Keeping our cast and crew well fed with healthy indivually packed meals.

Production Design: Props and Set Dressing items that will help bring the story and characters surroundings to life. 

Equipment Rentals: Camera and Lighting equipment to create our Director and Cinematographers vision. 

Costumes: Clothing styles that fit our time period and characters personalities. 

Safety: Safety equipment to ensure as safe a set as possible ie. hand sanitizers, regulated face masks, face shields.

The cast and crew will be tested for COVID-19.

There will be daily temperature checks.

There will be daily safety assessments.

Mask requirement for the crew at all times.

Mask requirement for the cast when not on set. 

Individually wrapped/pre-packaged craft and meals.

Distanced areas for cast and crew to wait when not needed on set.

story:
NOW I LAY ME
WRITTEN BY TAIONI MICAELA
After losing her husband and sanity, a woman has to figure a way to get rid of the demon that attacks her while she sleeps. 

This story is one loosely based on an event that I experienced. I want to get this story out because I was traumatized by this but I’m taking that fear back by making it into something people can enjoy watching. After doing some research I’ve learned that I am not the only one who has experienced an event like this and I want to share what worked for me in a dramatic fashion. This will be inspiring for some and entertaining for others.

 

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL DO


I’m raising money for the welfare of my cast & crew. I believe that people must be paid for their work, and since we’re in a pandemic, protection is also equally important. Your donation will also allow me to provide my crew with meals and snacks, to keep them happy and healthy on set!

Once that is covered, your donation will cover the equipment and location costs needed to make this short film as beautiful as possible. 

 

THE PERKS YOU WILL RECEIVE

Want your name in the credits? Want to find your name on IMDb? Based on your contribution you will receive a credit in the film along with an official poster card sent right to your door! You can pin it, frame it, or add it to a memory scrapbook!

 

THE IMPACT

This film begs the question “Who or what do you give authority to over your life?” We all are guilty of giving someone or something too much power to dictate how we live and what we do. I’m hoping this film gives people clarity on how they can take that power back. This is just a dramatized example of how I got back control.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute, that’s fine. The fact that you’re reading this means that you care! If you’d like to help in other ways:

  • You can help get the word out! Share this link anywhere there’s people! 
  • You can contribute your time! If you’d like to help out on set, or offer other talents, that’s one other way to get your name in the credits!

 

LAST THOUGHTS


If you contribute to this short film, I just want you to know how grateful I am. Storytelling is my passion and not a lot of people even make it this far. This industry is a hard nut to crack and I know I can break through it with your help. Thank you so much for reading this. I CAN’T WAIT TO SHOW YOU THIS FILM!
story_txt:
NOW I LAY MEWRITTEN BY TAIONI MICAELAAfter losing her husband and sanity, a woman has to figure a way to get rid of the demon that attacks her while she sleeps. 

This story is one loosely based on an event that I experienced. I want to get this story out because I was traumatized by this but I’m taking that fear back by making it into something people can enjoy watching. After doing some research I’ve learned that I am not the only one who has experienced an event like this and I want to share what worked for me in a dramatic fashion. This will be inspiring for some and entertaining for others.
 

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL DO
I’m raising money for the welfare of my cast & crew. I believe that people must be paid for their work, and since we’re in a pandemic, protection is also equally important. Your donation will also allow me to provide my crew with meals and snacks, to keep them happy and healthy on set!Once that is covered, your donation will cover the equipment and location costs needed to make this short film as beautiful as possible. 
 
THE PERKS YOU WILL RECEIVE
Want your name in the credits? Want to find your name on IMDb? Based on your contribution you will receive a credit in the film along with an official poster card sent right to your door! You can pin it, frame it, or add it to a memory scrapbook!

 
THE IMPACT
This film begs the question “Who or what do you give authority to over your life?” We all are guilty of giving someone or something too much power to dictate how we live and what we do. I’m hoping this film gives people clarity on how they can take that power back. This is just a dramatized example of how I got back control.

 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can't contribute, that’s fine. The fact that you’re reading this means that you care! If you’d like to help in other ways:

You can help get the word out! Share this link anywhere there’s people! 
You can contribute your time! If you’d like to help out on set, or offer other talents, that’s one other way to get your name in the credits!

 LAST THOUGHTSIf you contribute to this short film, I just want you to know how grateful I am. Storytelling is my passion and not a lot of people even make it this far. This industry is a hard nut to crack and I know I can break through it with your help. Thank you so much for reading this. I CAN’T WAIT TO SHOW YOU THIS FILM!

story:
Short Summary

Ever been in love? That real spark that makes you feel all warm and inside and spend pretty much all your time around someone? Eventually when you're both done sexing eachother's brains out, you want to get to know them a little more. That's what this story is.

Pillow Talk is a short film (and proof of concept for a miniseries) about a completely normal guy who just happens to occasionally eat people. We've all got our quirks.

In this peek in to Max' life, we get a chance to see how he'll handle a game of trading secrets with his girlfriend who at least for now thinks she wants to know him better.

During a time when jobs have been so low for actors and so many projects have been halted

Be part of the solution in contributing to a micro budget short that aims to stimulate the indie scene and pay/feed actors and crew!

 

Formerly there was a perk that accidentally violated the policies of IndieGogo Trust and safety, and has since been removed as an option. Anyone who claimed those parks has been contacted directly to offer a refund should they wish one.

 

Why 3500??

Well that's the bare minimum of what we need to make this work! We're still hoping that we can make more, the more funding we have the better it'll be, but that's the minimum.

Let's be honest, getting people and especially locations on board with a dark comedy about a cannibal... well it's a hard sell.

With funds from this campaign, more resources become available for our rag tag group of crew workers to make something that'll be a fun little bit of nonsense in a time that we could all use some.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've already spent all your stimulus checks, can't afford to contribute that's okay! There are still ways you can help - mainly by sharing this campaign and spreading the word!

That's it. The end. :)

story:
Our Film

Our film is about Kyle and Jodie. Two people who after meeting online organize a hook-up where they hope to explore some sexual boundaries through BDSM sex. This does not according to Plan as Kyles has lied about his experience and him not telling Jodie how little he knows puts her in an unfortunate situation as he causes an accident taking them to A&E.

Together in the waiting room, Kyle and Jodie have a heart to heart as they discuss what this means for the future of their relationship and the importance of consent and communicating with your partner.

The film has many influences including the film Skeleton Twins (2014), where the image above is from, and which inspired some visual cues for the final film. Other influences include Good Dick (2005) by Mariana Palka and In the Mood for Love (2000) by Wong Kar-Wei. Both films have a raw and unflinching honesty and intimacy about relationships that have helped to inspire the stories approach to sensitive topics such as sex, consent, and trauma.

We hope to explore these topics in a way without judgment and which helps to educate people on how mistakes that seem small and spiral out of control. Making things worse for both parties and how we can only move past them once they are confronted head-on. 

 

Our Characters

 

Kyle

A young and insecure man wanting to explore his sexuality but is worried he can't live up to his fantasies. He pretends to be more experienced than he is and puts his desires ahead of others. Over the film, he learns humility and the importance of consent after his selfish actions hurt someone he has feelings for.

 

Jodie

A young woman who is confident in herself but not always others. She wants a relationship but struggles to trust those she cares for and has built a wall of confidence to hide her insecurities. She enjoys teasing and flirting with others but refuses to bend to the will of others if she doesn't want to. With more experience than Kyle, she educates him on the importance of consent 

 

Who are We

Collectively we are the team that is hoping to make "Dolore é Amore" a reality. A collection of young actors and filmmakers from all over Scotland,  that have gathered behind this project as the first step in what we hope will be long and fruitful careers in the arts. This short student film will not just help some of us to pass our film course, but will also be a calling card. A major project that by going to various short film festivals can help us to bring us to the attention of others and get our foot in the door of the industry we want to work in so badly.

 

Meet the Crew

 

Anthony Marshall - Writer/Director

Anthony Marshall has been directing short films and music videos for 6 years. He’s been passionate about cinema for as long as he can remember and has worked on short films like Hedgehog and You Taste Like Mozart.

“I’m excited to be collaborating on getting the visuals out of my head and onto the screen with a great team of people” - Anthony

 

Alex Cormack - Cinematographer 

Alex Cormack has been making films since he was 10 years old. He has worked as a cinematographer on various short films such as Piano Man and The Treasurer. He always tries to push himself creatively and enjoys a good challenge.

“I'm looking forward to working with Anthony on his new film. I think it will be entertaining while also touching on some deeper topics and should provide lots of room to be creative” - Alex

 

Josh Martin Bates - Sound Designer

Josh Martin Bates has been studying film in Edinburgh for the last few years; more recently has been focusing on Sound Editing and Engineering. He feels very strongly that both the arts, sound and film, work in hand with one another. 

“A films ability to uncover deep-rooted emotions in a viewer is what makes me so passionate about cinema and what I hope to achieve on this film” - Josh

 

Matthew Lukowski - Editor

 

Matthew Lukowski is a video editor. Film and video editing is something he’s been passionate about and studied since 2014.  Working professionally for many years editing student short films and wedding videos.

“I'm very excited to team up with a talented crew and lead the post-production process for this film.” - Matthew

 

Meet the Cast

 

Adi Suri as "Kyle"

Adi Suri is an Edinburgh-based actor who has starred in a variety of projects including the award-nominated short film "Platonic’" a virtual pantomime, a radio program about Faslane peace and has worked on PSA projects that tackle topics from covid safety regulations to domestic violence charities. Outside of his work, he is also a proud uncle and true crime enthusiast 

“I'm excited to start work on this new project because it tackles the taboos of modern love in both a bold and earnest way.” - Adi

 

Molly Ridley as "Jodie"

Molly Ridley has been acting for seven years across stage and screen with a background in scare acting. Credits include Batman: Lockdown by Arrowkid Films and The York Dungeons.  She loves Labyrinth and any film by Guillermo Del Toro.

“I'm excited to work on this film because we need more positive sex/relationship representation and this film opens up the opportunity for some brilliant conversations on the subject” - Molly

 

Funding

We are hoping to fund a total of £1501 for our film. This goes toward everything needed for the film such as location space, props, and equipment. As well as external costs such as film festival entrance and supplies to protect everyone and make sure our shoot is done entirely within COVID conditions.

It might seem like a small donation would mean very little on a production of this cost, but that would be wrong. Every little helps to not just make this a great film but also to make sure that everyone has a great time on set.

  • £5 donation helps go toward a meal for a member of the cast and crew that day
  • £10 guarantees a face mask and hand gel to protect from COVID 19 and making sure that everyone is healthy on the shoot
  • £20 covers a piece of the set, a prop and even helps pay for costumes
  • £30 pays for entrance into various film festival around the world
  • £50 helps to get us great locations and pay for the equipment and professionals to make the film

Every donation goes a long way and if you are able to give that is fantastic and helps us in ways that we will never truly be able to finish thanking you for.

We completely understand if you can't give anything. You can still help however by sending this to as many people as you can and help spread the word about this project

 

Thanks from the team here on Dolore é Amore

story:
Short Summary

Hi, this is Charles D. Lincoln, the producer and writer of Theresa and Allison, a feature-length independent horror film, directed by the great Jeremiah Kipp (The Minions, The Sadist, The Day God Slept, Drool, and countless other short horror films) and starring Sarah Schoofs (Gut, Phobia, Meme) and Arielle Hope. Theresa and Allison is the story of Theresa (Hope) who, after a one night stand that turns disastrous, finds herself drawn into a downward spiral of savagery and brutality, all the while tempted by the beautiful and immortal Allison (Schoofs). It's a supernatural horror story with a modern twist. Uncompromising but intelligent. Bloody but character-driven. And above all, a tribute to the darker films that helped shape our creativity while, at the same time, aiming to do new things within old genres.

Inspired by films like Martyrs, the Hunger, Let the Right One In, and Hellraiser, our main  goal is to create a feature-length film on an indie budget that does not look like it was made on an indie budget. We have a great crew, talented actors and actresses, and a director with a strong vision. We want to show that an inexpensive film does not need to look like it was put together with safety scissors and scotch tape and that if the people behind the film truly believe in what they are doing, they can make something that looks like it costs ten times the amount it really does. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have shot three days of footage, and one day of reshoots, at a cost of $5,000, compiled by all of my personal savings and additional contributions from friends and family. To finish the rest of the film, we need $25,000. We are setting the goal here at $5,000 for several reasons. First, because we want to be able to use as large a percentage of the money as possible. If we go for $25k and don't make that, we still have to give them 9% of what we made. If we go for a smaller number, that will still help, like $5,000, then we only have to give them 4%. Second, while it does not give us everything we need, it gives us enough to start reshooting within the next few weeks. We won't be able to finish the film on $5,000, but it'll get us another three or four days in the can.

  • It will cost us, roughly $750 a day for our crew, which is small  and consists of people willing to work for much less than they are worth, just because they love the project. On days where we need special effects, that's an additional $200 per day for our special effects artist, with costs of materials extra. We estimate we'd need an additional 10 days of shooting to finish the film. That brings us up to $7,500 for just for the crew, plus about $3,000 in special effects (there is a party scene at the end of the film that will require quite a lot of special effects). We also have to pay for locations; the cast, which consists of not just the talented Arielle and Sarah, but several wonderful actresses from the worlds of New York independent film and stage, like Amy Jo Jackson (Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson) and Pooya Mohseni; and for feeding everyone, which comes out to about a $100 a day, even more during the two days where our big party climax scene is being shot; and we also need an additional $1,500 for supplies and non-prosthetic props.
  • The last $5,000 is so we can pay off the initial investors and go into this completely debt free. 
  • If we end up not getting what we need, then I guess we will do as much as we can afford and then rethink things from there. This film means a whole lot to a lot of people and to let it just end for lack of funding would be tragic.

The Impact

The fact is that the studio system that exists in Hollywood today does not support this type of film. The days of the classic horror of the 70's and even, to a lesser extent, the 80's, is done for the current days of PG-13, sanitized fare. We want to offer an alternative to that, at the same time, not flinching from any of the more "unsavory" aspects of horror. We are not afraid of blood or gore or nudity or uncomfortable subject matter. Why must one choose between a well-written, well- acted story and the primal thrill that comes with seeing our worst fears come to life, onscreen? Theresa and Allison was written to give both, but we cannot do it without you.

  • Films like this are not being made by a studio system that is too afraid of offending people or working above the lowest common denominator. By supporting us, you show that you want better than what it currently out there
  • To do something like this, you cannot have people who do not know what they're doing. Our cast and crew are professional artists of the highest order.  Foremost of this crew, Jeremiah Kipp's directing credits include THE SADIST starring Tom Savini, MASTERMIND starring Chris Sarandon, EDWARD ALBEE:THE TRANSFORMATIVE MOMENT starring Mercedes Ruehl, THE POD starring Larry Fessenden, BAGGAGE (Audience Award - Macabre Faire), CONTACT (commissioned by Sinister Six annual screening series), THE DAYS GOD SLEPT (Best Director -Horror Hound 2014), CRESTFALLEN, THE CHRISTMAS PARTY (Cannes and Clermont-Ferrand), EASY PREY (commissioned by NYC's annual VisionFest), DROOL (commissioned by Mandragoras Art Space), SNAPSHOT and THE APARTMENT (commissioned by Canon to premiere their XL2 at DV Expo 2004). Producing credits include the feature films SATAN HATES YOU (created by Glass Eye Pix, starring Angus Scrimm, Michael Berryman and Reggie Bannister), GOD'S LAND, LET'S PLAY, IN MONTAUK, THE JONESTOWN DEFENSE and THE BED-THING (directed by Pulitzer Prize-nominated Matt Zoller Seitz). Assistant director credits include I SELL THE DEAD starring Dominic Monaghan, SOMEWHERE TONIGHT starring John Turturro, ONE NIGHT starring Melissa Leo, and the Sundance Award-winning MAN (dir: Myna Joseph).

  • Some of Jeremiah's accolades: "This haunting and experimental film is full of vivid imagery and fantastic music. Jeremiah Kipp shows some real talent in juxtaposing the beautiful with the morose, barraging the viewer with imagery both gorgeous and nightmarish. Kipp relies on weird images and amazing music to force your mind to put together what’s going on. The results are pretty moving." - Ain't It Cool News

    "It's a beautifully made film -- I loved the mouth tunnel!  In fact, I think I did that drug once upon a time. Excellent.  Keep makin' em!" 

    - Frank Henenlotter, director of BASKET CASE and BAD BIOLOGY

    “While it has a running time of only 11 minutes, CONTACT feels much more substantial because of its message and depth…Absolutely intense! Amazing on all levels: sound design, camera, lighting, acting – this one is going to win a ton of awards.” – Marla Newborn, Fangoria

    “A jolting, intriguing work that is blessed with great style and original substance—one of the most satisfying shorts to come around in a long time. 5 stars (out of 5)” – Phil Hall, Film Threat

  • As part of our way of saying thank you for helping us to finish this film, we're offering several items that will, no doubt, be sought after collector's items once this film gets out there. Those will include free copies of the DVD when we release it (estimated to be by May 2016), posters with blood-stained handprints from our lead actresses, and most importantly, actual props used in the making of Theresa & Allison, including an arm that has had all manner of unpleasantness inflicted upon it (it'd be a spoiler to tell you exactly what happens to it), the filthy and injured stomach of a pregnant woman, and 17 extracted human teeth. As we said above, this is a character-driven story, but we are not afraid to go to the deep end of the pool, when it comes to the more horrific elements of this film. We want to reward those of you who help out. Whether it's $10 or in the hundreds, we want to say thank you because we cannot do this without you.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is money.  Everyone assembled for this project knows what they're doing and how to do it well. We get the money, the movie gets made, it's as simple as that. We don't, there's no completed film, and the footage we have already shot just kinda floats around in the ether. Everybody loses.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, so...

  • If you can't help, at all, financially, then use the share tools on here and tell your friends who can help to do so. We want to make something that you'll enjoy seeing and we'll be proud of having been part of. Spread the word, share this campaign, share the videos, let people know we're doing this, and that they can make a difference, that they can speak out against PG-13 horror, without having to sacrifice story or acting. Let them know that they can help Theresa & Allison become something great. All we need is a helping hand.
Thank you for reading this and thank you, in advance, for helping us out.

Films like this are not being made by a studio system that is too afraid of offending people or working above the lowest common denominator. By supporting us, you show that you want better than what it currently out there To do something like this, you cannot have people who do not know what they're doing. Our cast and crew are professional artists of the highest order.  Foremost of this crew, Jeremiah Kipp's directing credits include THE SADIST starring Tom Savini, MASTERMIND starring Chris Sarandon, EDWARD ALBEE:THE TRANSFORMATIVE MOMENT starring Mercedes Ruehl, THE POD starring Larry Fessenden, BAGGAGE (Audience Award - Macabre Faire), CONTACT (commissioned by Sinister Six annual screening series), THE DAYS GOD SLEPT (Best Director -Horror Hound 2014), CRESTFALLEN, THE CHRISTMAS PARTY (Cannes and Clermont-Ferrand), EASY PREY (commissioned by NYC's annual VisionFest), DROOL (commissioned by Mandragoras Art Space), SNAPSHOT and THE APARTMENT (commissioned by Canon to premiere their XL2 at DV Expo 2004). Producing credits include the feature films SATAN HATES YOU (created by Glass Eye Pix, starring Angus Scrimm, Michael Berryman and Reggie Bannister), GOD'S LAND, LET'S PLAY, IN MONTAUK, THE JONESTOWN DEFENSE and THE BED-THING (directed by Pulitzer Prize-nominated Matt Zoller Seitz). Assistant director credits include I SELL THE DEAD starring Dominic Monaghan, SOMEWHERE TONIGHT starring John Turturro, ONE NIGHT starring Melissa Leo, and the Sundance Award-winning MAN (dir: Myna Joseph).




Some of Jeremiah's accolades: "This haunting and experimental film is full of vivid imagery and fantastic music. Jeremiah Kipp shows some real talent in juxtaposing the beautiful with the morose, barraging the viewer with imagery both gorgeous and nightmarish. Kipp relies on weird images and amazing music to force your mind to put together what’s going on. The results are pretty moving." - Ain't It Cool News

"It's a beautifully made film -- I loved the mouth tunnel!  In fact, I think I did that drug once upon a time. Excellent.  Keep makin' em!" 
- Frank Henenlotter, director of BASKET CASE and BAD BIOLOGY
“While it has a running time of only 11 minutes, CONTACT feels much more substantial because of its message and depth…Absolutely intense! Amazing on all levels: sound design, camera, lighting, acting – this one is going to win a ton of awards.” – Marla Newborn, Fangoria

“A jolting, intriguing work that is blessed with great style and original substance—one of the most satisfying shorts to come around in a long time. 5 stars (out of 5)” – Phil Hall, Film Threat

 As part of our way of saying thank you for helping us to finish this film, we're offering several items that will, no doubt, be sought after collector's items once this film gets out there. Those will include free copies of the DVD when we release it (estimated to be by May 2016), posters with blood-stained handprints from our lead actresses, and most importantly, actual props used in the making of Theresa & Allison, including an arm that has had all manner of unpleasantness inflicted upon it (it'd be a spoiler to tell you exactly what happens to it), the filthy and injured stomach of a pregnant woman, and 17 extracted human teeth. As we said above, this is a character-driven story, but we are not afraid to go to the deep end of the pool, when it comes to the more horrific elements of this film. We want to reward those of you who help out. Whether it's $10 or in the hundreds, we want to say thank you because we cannot do this without you.    Risks & Challenges  Our biggest challenge is money.  Everyone assembled for this project knows what they're doing and how to do it well. We get the money, the movie gets made, it's as simple as that. We don't, there's no completed film, and the footage we have already shot just kinda floats around in the ether. Everybody loses.   Other Ways You Can Help We know not everyone can contribute, so...  If you can't help, at all, financially, then use the share tools on here and tell your friends who can help to do so. We want to make something that you'll enjoy seeing and we'll be proud of having been part of. Spread the word, share this campaign, share the videos, let people know we're doing this, and that they can make a difference, that they can speak out against PG-13 horror, without having to sacrifice story or acting. Let them know that they can help Theresa & Allison become something great. All we need is a helping hand. 
Thank you for reading this and thank you, in advance, for helping us out.

story:
Hi, I'm Veronica Castro. 

Last summer I worked 22 hours a day. Yes, that's not a typo. Twenty-two hours a day for four months. It was crazy--loco--and perhaps I am too, but I have been planting, building, and sustaining three businesses since I found myself single, sola, and the sole support of my three young children seven years ago. One day I was home with my children and a working husband. The next, I was alone with no means of support.

Now, seven years later, I have three businesses.

I clean houses, I cater Central Oregon's many festivals and concerts as well as private parties, and I recently opened Loco Place where the sales of my loco combinations of fresh tropical fruits, candies and spices, a la mexicana, have soared. If you've drooled over the fresh fruits in a pineapple boat in Cancun or Mazatlan, you know what I mean.


Now, I am a strong, determined fighter who is trying to build a better life, greater opportunity, and more choices for my three children: Alberto, Fernando, and Aglaen. We were alone in this country without family, but...

Now, I have a community. Those who believed in me, those who had tasted my Tres Leches cake or found my Mole Poblano to their gusto jumped in to fill the void. They urged me to teach cooking classes and to cater their parties, to clean their homes or provide cakes for their family's birthdays. They helped me to believe in myself.


But I need you!

I need you so I can stop working at night to wrap my tamales, so I can combine my storage unit, store space, and prep space into one location and one rental payment, so I can stop driving all over Central Oregon to link those locales with my events and places of business.

I need you so I can use my increased income to pay my employees better and build a name, a brand, and a clientele who can always find me.

I need you so I can feed my children, send them to college and get more sleep. :)

And I only need $7999! (For now. As my business grows I'd like to buy a food truck and a vehicle to haul my imported products without a distributor who doesn't arrive regularly, on-time, and sometimes not at all. No wonder I'm loca!)

The $7999 will change my life. Really, it will.

I will:

  • rent and remodel a space to house my Loco Place. You can come buy my frutas locas whenever you want,
  • cook BY DAY in a large, certified kitchen where my twelve employees and I can assemble our GIANT tamales, ready for your toppings of fresh salsas, guacamole, sweet tomatoes, jalapeños, cheeses and crema,
  • prepare, cook, sell, and store all my supplies and equipment in one place,
  • further build a community among Anglos and Latinos who love great flavors and healthy foods: gluten-free, lard-free, vegetarian and meat options
  • purchase an i-Pad so you can pay with credit or a debit card. What business doesn't need one these days?


Why should you believe in me and part with your hard earned money?

YEAR ONE of my events catering I provided fruit, lemonade, and tamales at 13 events.

YEAR THREE I did 30.

YEAR FOUR I'm planning on 40. The invitations keep pouring in, but I'm already loca--I can't do them all.

From 2013 to 2014 my sales doubled. The year before they increased by 50%.

IN 2015: I'm projecting 150% growth.

Why?

I have paid off all the equipment I need for the events and Loco Place (tents, tables, coolers, sinks, refrigerators, signage, and non-fresh merchandise, etc.) and I was able to pay half of an earlier loan last summer.

My overhead will be much lower because of:

  • lower rent
  • lower fuel costs (less running around)
  • greater efficiency in preparation
  • better market familiarity

I work hard. I am motivated. I seize new opportunities. I know my clientele and they will HUNT ME DOWN in my new location.

So click on that donation button now. Any amount would help. You can use Pay Pal or a credit card, though the first is better. And tell your friends, families, and associates about me. Post me to your social media.

I will continue to work like a loca to realize my American dream, but I need your help.

Thank you. Mil gracias.

Veronica Castro

story:
About Dweeb Darlings 

Dweeb Darlings is a production company founded by Heidi Cox and Megan Green. It seeks to give opportunities to female creators and female fronted story lines through original content and social outreach. The Double D's (as they like to call themselves) mission is to empower women and girls by showing them that being a dweeb, geek, and/or nerd can not only mean being intelligent but also, powerful, creative, feminine, sexy, and fun!


Stalking LeVar 

This comedic scripted series is about life, love, liberty, and the pursuit of ultimate friendship with LeVar Burton. It stars Heidi Cox (Creator of the series) as Heidi and features producer Stephanie Pressman (Host of Geek 360 and Fashionably Nerdy) as Susan her somewhat misplaced sidekick after Heidi's partner (played by Co-Creator Megan Green) disappears down under. 

Outreach & Awareness


Outreach is really important to Dweeb Darlings and part of that includes not only casting diverse actors but also bringing awareness to social issues. Season 2 will have even more emphasis on this. We have an exciting roster of diverse characters joining the Double D's. This season we are also introducing accomplished and talented female directors to our team. Part of the Dweeb Darlings outreach program includes their touring panel #SPARK Your Creativity: A Call To Action. Ladies Unite to Create More Female Driven Content (Appearing at San Diego Comic Con July 11, 2015). While Stalking LeVar is the crown jewel of Dweeb Darlings we are constantly working with emerging talent to help cultivate their projects under the umbrella of our production company.


Where Your Contribution Will Be Spent

Creating a series is difficult, it requires a lot of people to help. When you watch the finished project you may not be able to see how your contribution is spent. So, Let us break it down for you.

We have 10 episodes in Season 2, $10,000 breaks down to $1000 an episode. 

$100 a day is for food (The most important thing we can provide our actors and crew with is healthy fuel so that we can work hard and provide great content)

$100 locations (Where we shoot is really important to how the episode turns out, while we can get locations donated for free, we still have security to use the space)

$300 equipment rental (Microphones, cameras and lights are not cheap to buy, it's easier to rent them but it's also an expense)

$500 crew & post production (Our crew is wonderful and hard working we would love to be able to show the dozens of amazing people that are making Stalking LeVar that their work is valuable by paying them for their time)

While our perks are really exciting the best perk is knowing that your donation is making a real difference in our production. Your $100 donation is providing meals for the people on set or your $300 donation is ensuring we have great sound. 

If our goal is not met we can still proceed in making some episodes of Season 2. 
We produced the first season with a lot of hugs and high fives. 

Perks!

Signed postcard. Just a little "Thank You" note from the ladies along with some sticker swag.


Custom Double D Tees (Double D for Dweeb Darlings and D20) Pictured here is the women's design.


Extra Special Weekly Perks

In addition to the perks listed Every Monday During Our Campaign we will announce a special perk of the week on our Facebook page & Twitter Account for Dweeb Darlings. This includes giveaways for cool products from special Dweeb Darling Partners and digital perks like having Heidi & Susan serenade you, with your favorite song! Your weekly perks will be fulfilled and announced live on periscope the following Sunday. For those that qualify for this perk - they are only eligible for the perk the week they contribute. However, you will re-qualify if you contribute again. 

Risks & Challenges

We hate asking for money especially in an age when we are all bombarded with invites for crowdfunding campaigns. We realize we may not reach our goal though we are asking for a small production budget, $10,000 is a lot of real world money. We can make this series on pennies, we already have for Season 1. However, given the tools we can do even better.

  • We have created 4 episodes and 2 mini-sodes previously proving we have the creativity and ability to get this done.
  • By offering special weekly goals we hope to attract you to visit this page and contribute multiple times.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Get the word out, tell your friends, watch the show, share an episode on your social media!
  • There are buttons on this page to click and share this campaign with everyone you know!
  • If you want to help out in anyway and have production skills let us know!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Childhood television is arguably the most impactful entity throughout a child's developmental stages. What better way to make a difference in a child's life than to expose them to meaningful and nurturing entertainment in such a critical stage. It is with great pride and enthusiasm that the creative team of "Simon Knows Best," asks for your help to make this dream a reality! 

You may be asking Who and what "Simon Knows Best" is all about. It's simple! The idea is a unique take on timeless themes such as selflessness and responsibility. By following the adventures of Simon, the wise owl who lives in the world's coolest treehouse, children will learn essential lessons pertinent to everyday life.  With the help of Mr. Crow and Simon's "Owl Pals", learning is both fun and easy! 

Creating a show has been a dream of ours from the time we first started here at Hofstra. All of us looked forward to the amazing opportunity of bringing our idea to life. Now that time is finally upon us, Simon has become our dream and we need your support to bring him and our show to life!

A little goes a long way. With a goal of $1,000, we can build our dream from the ground up. Donate today and help make a fresh splash in children's television! 

With a donation of $25 or more, we will send you a DVD of our first episode of "Simon Knows Best" and enter for a chance to win an autographed Simon poster! A donation of $50 or more secures two seats at our live show on March 23, with a photo with Simon and friends included, in addition to the DVD!  

Thank you for all of your support, we can't make this happen without you! Don't forget to follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter for exclusive updates! We think it will be a hoot!! 


Facebook: SimonKnowsBest

Instagram: SimonKnowsBest

Twitter: Simon_KnowsBest and MrCrow_

story:
Harry Sutherland is an award winning filmmaker who is returning to his roots in the seventies to bring to the screen his passion project - the history of same sex love from ancient times to the present.

  • FYI The picture over the video was taken of me when I started researching this project in 1978 so you can see what I have given to this project so far!

"A film about gay people and their activities in the hundred years before the Stonewall riots should be fascinating. I hope Harry Sutherland's film goes ahead. There would be nothing like it."

Sir Ian McKellen

“… the time is right to uncover the events and people that have contributed to our present-day LGBT community and to ensure we don’t lose what we have fought so hard to achieve.”

XTRA! Vancouver, August 28, 2014



Out of History is a documentary that will chart the explosive impact on the world of the invention of the word ‘homosexuality’ in 1869 by Karl Maria Kertbeny.

This seemingly insignificant fluttering of the butterfly’s wings would send shockwaves through the political and social fabric of Western culture. Millions would be affected and tragically unknown thousands would perish in the Gulag, the concentration camps and by their own hand under threat of blackmail.

Eventually, 100 years later, the power of his word would erupt in rage in a seedy bar in Greenwich Village. The Stonewall Rebellion would usher in a new lexicon and start the process of creating a new political force, our modern LGBTQ community. This time, lets not take our progress or our history for granted.

My Commitment

As an award-winning filmmaker, I have a long history of working with the community. My first film Truxx followed the impact of the ‘76 Olympics on the gay and lesbian community in Montreal and premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in 1978 as a short in front of Wolfgang Petersen’s Die Konsequenz. My first feature doc was shot during the infamous bathhouse raids by the Toronto Police Department in1981. Track Two was released at the Berlin International Film Festival and played in theatres across Canada. I also produced We’re Funny That Way for HBO and CityTV in Toronto in 1995, documenting the contribution that stand-up comics make to the LGBT community. My first feature drama film, Eighteen, had cameos with gay icons Ian McKellen and Alan Cumming.

My actual research on Out of History began during a fateful trip to Amsterdam in 1979 where I first encountered, among other things, stories about our history from 1730 that shocked and intrigued me. Over the years I explored further and was amazed at the depth and variety of our past and the untold contributions that we have made to the world over all this time. Out of History is truly the greatest story that has never been told!

Your Support

Your contribution will be crucial in getting Out of History off the ground. As a successful producer in documentaries over many years I understand how crucial it will be for me to demonstrate that the LGBT community and our friends are behind the project. This support will allow me to finish the development of this film that I have been researching for many years on my own. Any additional funds raised will go directly into the production that will start in the spring of 2015. I hope to have the film completed one year from now.

The Legacy

Out of History is an ambitious project that will bring to life over 2,800 years of our history. Using documentary film and a digital online portal or ‘time tunnel’. Over the next few years we will be producing a series of documentary films (The Politics of Sex is the first) on our history and then re-editing the films to be inserted into the Time Tunnel to create an online experience. This experience will allow us to travel through our history by centauries or by themes.

While the production of the film will provide the unique material for Out of History, the true legacy of the project will be the self-perpetuating digital presence of the historical Time Tunnel. Focusing on entertainment, politics, travel and health, Out of History will provide an ever-changing canvas for creating identity within the community. The project will become a focal point for young people struggling to find their place in the world as well as travellers looking for an added dimension on their next adventure. The Time Tunnel will also allow individuals to add their personal histories as well as their reviews of books, movies, music and TV shows.

My actual research on Out of History began during a fateful trip
to Amsterdam in 1979 where I first encountered, among other things, stories
about our history from 1730 that shocked and intrigued me. Over the years I
explored further and was amazed at the depth and variety of our past and the
untold contributions that we have made to the world over all this time. Out
of History is truly the greatest story that has never been told!
Your Support
Your contribution will be crucial in getting Out of History off
the ground. As a successful producer in documentaries over many years I
understand how crucial it will be for me to demonstrate that the LGBT community
and our friends are behind the project. This support will allow me to finish
the development of this film that I have been researching for many years on my
own. Any additional funds raised will go directly into the production that will
start in the spring of 2015. I hope to have the film completed one year from
now.
The Legacy

Out of History is an ambitious
project that will bring to life over 2,800 years of our history. Using
documentary film and a digital online portal or ‘time tunnel’. Over the next
few years we will be producing a series of documentary films (The Politics of
Sex is the first) on our history and then re-editing the films to be inserted
into the Time Tunnel to create an online experience. This experience will allow
us to travel through our history by centauries or by themes.
While the production of the film will provide the unique
material for Out of History, the true legacy of the project will be the
self-perpetuating digital presence of the historical Time Tunnel. Focusing on
entertainment, politics, travel and health, Out of History will provide
an ever-changing canvas for creating identity within the community. The project
will become a focal point for young people struggling to find their place in
the world as well as travellers looking for an added dimension on their next
adventure. The Time Tunnel will also allow individuals to add their personal
histories as well as their reviews of books, movies, music and TV shows.

story:
The Who...

The team that brought you a Top20 film at last year's Louisiana Film Prize is proud to bring you its 2015 Louisiana Film Prize entry called, RISE. They are:

Laura Prissy Scott - Executive Producer and Miracle-Worker, RISE

Arma Fitzgerald - Writer, Actress, Director, Producer, RISE

Anthony A. Kung - Writer, Actor, Director, Producer, RISE


The What...

"RISE is a story of choices. It entails life of a female immigrant who moved to the land of opportunities to find herself trapped in a golden cage of fear and domestic abuse. She uses music and dance to reinvent herself and regain her confidence to make an important choice in her life, which consequently inspires her abuser to choose a different life path as well.

The story is intended to bring attention to the important issue of domestic abuse that faces many women and men daily and help them realize they have a choice to either give in and live in fear or stand up and rise above it.

Domestic abuse is happening around us.  Victims usually stay quiet and keep it a secret due to either fear or lack of confidence that is mostly created by the abuser. We are not born abusive so every abuser has a story to tell. The fear and lack of confidence is not a plague haunting only the victims but in reality it is the abuser who experiences them first and tries to reflect that on his/her victim.

RISE is a story of both sides of this ugly coin. Hopefully this story, which is based on real events, will shed a light on this subject matter and will help free many victims and abusers."

Arma Fitzgerald - Writer, Actress, Director, Producer, RISE


The Why...

Domestic Violence is a pattern of behavior used to establish power and control over another person through fear and intimidation, often including the threat or use of violence. The statistics are startling. 

 – Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

- National Coalition for the Homelessness

Domestic Violence is closer to us than we may realize when we consider this statistic:  1 in 3 women and 1 in 4 men experience violence from their partners in their lifetimes - The National Intimate Partner and Sexual Violence Survey (2010).

RISE is based on a true story, so it hits close to home and it makes this project a very personal journey for many involved. The ultimate objective of our film is to increase the conversations against domestic violence so that there will be more focus to bring about an end to it.

Your Financial Support

This is where you can help us help your friends, your family, your neighbors, and yes, even ourselves. Your financial contribution ($30, $100, or whatever amount) allows us to obtain the equipment, services, and talent to make a quality film, with a powerful message. The cost breakdown is shown in the pie chart below with bullet point highlights for each of the areas covered. 

Additionally, instead of the material perks associated with fund raising campaign, the RISE team has decided instead to donate 10% of all your proceeds directly to a national movement against domestic violence. (This is shown under Indiegogo Fulfillment in the pie chart.) 

This national movement, at NOMORE.org, is "supported by hundreds of national and local groups and by thousands of individuals, organizations, universities, and communities ... to increase visibility for domestic violence ..." NOMORE.org will help facilitate your donations to local and national charities working to end domestic abuse (nomore.org/donations).


Breakdown details:
  • Pre-Production - Labor and material costs associated with script writing and planning, including script writing/editing software subscription services.
  • Art Department - Costume-related accessories, props, sets, etc. to give the right look and feel to the film.
  • Cast - Includes speaking roles, background extras, and non-speaking roles.
  • Crew - Pay for all members associated with production such as DP, gaffe, grip, lighting, sound, makeup/hair, etc. The directors will not take payment so that money can go to other areas that need it.
  • Food - Craft services, and meals for cast&crew over the scheduled shoot dates, and location scout and planning dates.
  • Location fees - Payments associated with the use of shoot locations, and, if applicable, rental location fees.
  • Camera - Camera-related equipment rentals - dollies, slider, lights, etc. Already on hand are the following cameras: Blackmagic Cinema Camera (2k version), Sony FS100, and Canon 5D MkII.
  • Post-Production - Everything done in post such as editing, sound mixing and design, music score composition, color correction, hard drive purchases, and editing equipment rentals.
  • Transportation - The cost of gas to move people and equipment from Dallas and New Orleans to Shreveport, and to various shoot locations once inside the Shreveport area - for the duration of actual shoot dates, location scout and planning dates, and crowd-funding video shoot.
  • Production Office - Includes making copies of scripts, call sheets, and other paperwork, and shipping/packaging costs for LaFilmPrize submissions, office supplies, the design/printing/distribution costs of marketing the film, etc.
  • Indiegogo Fulfillment - Instead of spending on the fulfillment of material perks to our donors, the producers decided to make a direct donation to a group of pre-selected domestic violence non-profit centers around the country that support survivors in terms of clothing, shelter, and living essentials like food, rent and legal costs.
  • Festival Expenses - The cost associated with festival submission fees, travel and accommodation expenses for the producers to help better spread the word to business and film community leaders who can influence the increase support of domestic violence non-profit centers.


Your Generosity

Thank you for your generous gift and support. Your support whether financial or just sharing our link helps us to get our message to people so we all can RISE above domestic violence. This crowd funding campaign runs from April 1-30, 2015, after which time we will start filming. The first version of the film is slated for July 14, 2015.

story:
UPDATE!

                               Look at the perks to your right  to see the details of this challenge!                                                                                                                                                               

                                                                                                                                                                 


Vivica A Fox delivers a stunning love or hate her performance as Mayor Morgan Hardaway a 1st term Mayor in Atlanta that believes her purpose in life is to change the perspective of the female role in society by influencing women to separate what they need from what they have been socialized to expect. Starring Vivica A Fox (Set It Off, Independence Day, Kill Bill), Tommy Ford (Martin, Harlem Nights), Roy Jones Jr. (Grudge Match, The Matrix Reloaded), Geffri Maya (Private Practice),  Rodney Perry (The Monique Show, Madea's Big Happy Family), Erica Dixon (Love & Hip Hop Atlanta), Karon Riley (Neccessary Roughness, Marry Us For Christmas), Jeff Trink, April Bogenschutz, Chris "Set If Off" Jones, Donald "Baby D" Jenkins and many more, Blaq Gold is a raw multicultural TV series drama characterized by complex, multiple stories that demonstrates how institutions like politics, the entertainment industry, the media, and the urban street elements are built from a complex web of relationships and how men and women treat and view each other in its core of the most heightened of circumstances exposing the drama and stupidity of some, but also highlighting the loyalty and resilience of others.. Unlike the black and white worlds of television, Blaq Gold is all grey. 


Blaq Gold The Series addresses a variety topics including, Politics, Crime, Racism, Domestic Violence, Bullying, Homophobia, Loyalty, Sexism, Love, Hate, etc. This controversial series will have your coffee break chat and social media on fire! This episodic drama will take you on a journey that reveals the weaknesses and resilience of the individuals that run this city, and highlight the rewards and consequences of the choices they make! 

Here's a quick look at some of the amazing actors and the characters they portray on the show! "I know!" probably should have shown this one before the trailer but now it gives you a reason to watch the trailer again!

      



Marcello Nine is a true visionary that believes there's an actor in everyone!  That's why he creates his characters through the actors and actresses, and challenges them to identify with the titles, rather it be a blue collar worker, housewife, or politician. This technique is designed to allow any experienced or aspiring actor/actress to have a fair chance to capture a winning role without having to deal with the drawbacks that many have to face in this industry. "In this episodic drama I want to challenge (racial) stereotypical perceptions and boundaries, I want to show how 2 people can look at the same thing and see something totally different, and sometimes it takes real people to set that example"...

     


If you like the music in the Blaq Gold official trailer, you'll love this guy! We Do!

Recently named "One of the Best Beat Makers" by Rolling Stone Magazine, Grammy award winning & multi platinum selling producer DJ Toomp has teamed up with Day 9 Films to create a music score that defines pop culture as heard in the trailer.  As a producer his resume includes Mariah Carey, TI, Jay Z, Rick Ross and Kayne West to name a few.

Hear from our cast!  Each interview has a sneak peek at some of the scenes. The videos has been downsized to thumbnail view, to watch in full screen double-click the video and don't forget to adjust the quality to HD!

                                       
                               

      





Your contribution will help with what is arguably the most important part of creating this show; the production, crew, cast, promotions, etc.  So to be politically correct, that means your donation makes you more than just a contributor, it makes you a member of team Blaq Gold!


We want to create a show that digs deep into the fabric of our society.  And when we say society I mean more than one nationality, more than just one culture, more than one class of people.  There are a lot of things that we see on social media and television that is disturbing to us, and we find ourselves asking the question, "What would make them do that?"  "Where are their parents?" This show tells a story of corruption, drug, physical and mental abuse, crime, and poverty, while also telling a story of intelligence, resilience, the good responsible teenager and adults that go on to be productive members of society. But most importantly, this series tells the story of how we have the freedom to choose which direction we take.  And with your support we can make a quality series and a powerful story!




Delivered April 2015

Delivered June 2015 (Womens polo shirt also available)

Delivered June 2015

            
    

This campaign is about making the 3 part mini series Blaq Gold, and with your support we can prove that independent film making can be a sustainable and comparative alternative to what is considered the norm when it comes to entertainment. Our ultimate goal is to become part of a great network that can expand our show to a bigger platform. All perks will be delivered as promised, no excuses! So let's become a part of history together! 


WHEN DO I GET MY PERKS OR REWARDS? 

  • If you have the digital computer or screensaver you will receive a email with instructions to download product within 3 days.
  • Rewards such as t-shirts, polo shirts, Erica Dixon's book, and Roy Jones Jr boxing gloves, your items will be shipped the first week in June. You will receive a email updating you on shipping and estimated time of arrival.
  • Rewards surrounding premiere, you will receive a email by May 1, 2015 with exact dates and times.  Your ticket(s) and or VIP passes and instructions etc. will be mailed to you or will be available for pickup at the premiere.  There will also be a direct contact number sent to you regarding any questions or concerns you might have. 
  • Once you become part of the team your IMDb credits will be added at:  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4513792/?ref_=fn_al...
  • All Rewards are guaranteed! If you have any questions you can email us at:
  • Day9films@gmail.com

If you have the digital computer or screensaver you will receive a email with instructions to download product within 3 days.
Rewards such as t-shirts, polo shirts, Erica Dixon's book, and Roy Jones Jr boxing gloves, your items will be shipped the first week in June. You will receive a email updating you on shipping and estimated time of arrival.
Rewards surrounding premiere, you will receive a email by May 1, 2015 with exact dates and times.  Your ticket(s) and or VIP passes and instructions etc. will be mailed to you or will be available for pickup at the premiere.  There will also be a direct contact number sent to you regarding any questions or concerns you might have. 
Once you become part of the team your IMDb credits will be added at:  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4513792/?ref_=fn_al...

All Rewards are guaranteed! If you have any questions you can email us at:
Day9films@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

When the excessive desire to accomplish an ambition generates carelessness towards the potential successes of the present events. Jordan, a 22-year-old self-absorbed film student, deceives a famous producer in order to organize a meeting with him. 

The latter, after discovering the truth, chooses to meet the protagonist’s needs by deciding to visit the set of her Grad Film. Jordan accepts his terms although being concerned about the awful way the short film is progressing and the great confusion reigning among the members of her crew. 

Things get even more complicated when she attempts to make a good impression by solving the unsolvable. Jordan finally comes to terms with herself when she realizes that the real problem lied within her inability of communicating with her course friends and underestimation of the multiple opportunities offered by what closely surrounded her. As well as telling a controversial and purely fictional story, the script somehow reflects the true difficulties that many film students encounter during the process of making a graduation film.


Why We Need You.

Our crew is working towards achieving a highly ambitious project which requires a lot of effort and, of course, money. 
You will be involved in something original and highly entertaining as well as contributing in bringing to light the script's unique voice. 


The Impact

50% Location:  A professional TV studio would confer an exclusive and stylized look to the film. The cost of this, as most of us are aware of, is more than a bohemian student can afford.

25% Production Design: The script has a very clear vision and like in Wes Anderson's movies, it is essential to obtain the right materials in order to convey the comic and characteristic aspect of the film. 

15%Catering: We will be providing food for at least 16 people considering extras. 

10%Transport: A van is of fundamental importance in view of the multiple transfers that will need to be made for both props and film equipment from one location to another.


Risks & Challenges

Bringing a theatrical environment into a filmic world is always challenging: not only it will take us time and patience to choreograph the scenes, but also it will take a lot of effort in tactically planning and rehearsing the single shot sequence with the camera. Having time is paramount, but time costs and everything would be much easier if money was on our side.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! The more people talk about the project, the better!

story:
What Is Lakeside Reborn?

What started as simply a nostalgic group of friends has quickly turned into a real and viable dream.

  • We are in the early stages of our planning and exploratory committee
  • We are raising the funds that we need to pay filing fees associated with non-profit status.
  • Donations made to this campaign are, unfortunately, not tax deductible, however that is the goal of this campaign.
  • Once the campaign is completed, the donations used here will be used ONLY for these purposes, and we will maintain clear and transparent records to ensure this.

We're not just trying to win you over with dreams and memories, though. We have real, ready, and able community sponsors, who simply need proof that the money they invest would be met with the support of a welcoming community. it's one thing to have a thousand fans on Facebook, it's another to have real members of your community ready to put their own money out there to make something happen. Nothing shows potential investors and vendors their potential revenue like showing them how badly the people want it.

What We Need & What You Get:

In order to become a non-profit organization, Lakeside Reborn must be a registered business in the city and state where we are headquartered, as well as file a form 1023 with the Internal Revenue Service in order to obtain 501(c)3 status.

  • We are helping foot the bill for much of the licensing and registration procedure, however the filing fee for this form alone is $850
  • This is the first major step we are able to take in the right direction, and without this, we can't move forward
  • If we fail to reach our goal, NO money will be used from this campaign for anything other than the licenses and applications needed to maintain non-profit status. We will simply run other campaigns, and obtain funding from other sources, in order to bridge the gap so that we can obtain the things we need.

We are in the early stages of our planning and exploratory committee We are raising the funds that we need to pay filing fees associated with non-profit status. Donations made to this campaign are, unfortunately, not tax deductible, however that is the goal of this campaign.

Once the campaign is completed, the donations used here will be used ONLY for these purposes, and we will maintain clear and transparent records to ensure this.  We're not just trying to win you over with dreams and memories, though. We have real, ready, and able community sponsors, who simply need proof that the money they invest would be met with the support of a welcoming community. it's one thing to have a thousand fans on Facebook, it's another to have real members of your community ready to put their own money out there to make something happen. Nothing shows potential investors and vendors their potential revenue like showing them how badly the people want it.   What We Need & What You Get: In order to become a non-profit organization, Lakeside Reborn must be a registered business in the city and state where we are headquartered, as well as file a form 1023 with the Internal Revenue Service in order to obtain 501(c)3 status.  We are helping foot the bill for much of the licensing and registration procedure, however the filing fee for this form alone is $850 This is the first major step we are able to take in the right direction, and without this, we can't move forward If we fail to reach our goal, NO money will be used from this campaign for anything other than the licenses and applications needed to maintain non-profit status. We will simply run other campaigns, and obtain funding from other sources, in order to bridge the gap so that we can obtain the things we need.

story:
About Me

I'm Matthew, a hard working 18 year old Broadcast Media Production student at The University of Sunderland. I have a true passion for television and radio which has led me to working on many different projects - and Nerd Off is almost like my own child...my own creation. I work as a presenter on Spark FM as well, also producing and doing other work behind the scenes. I really love what I do, and I don't know what I would do without it.

What We Need and How You'll Help

Way back at the start of October last year (okay, not that long ago) director Matthew along with fellow students Adam and Sophie came up with the idea of a topical quiz show. The basic idea of the show was to be about films and TV shows, and bring people together to test their knowledge. It's such a basic format for a show that we couldn't really understand why it hadn't already been done. At the time, we never really thought we'd do it...just one of those things you think of, but never actually do - well this did happen! We planned and put together the very first episode of the new student made web show "Nerd Off"!

We have a very talented production team made up of university students that use the excellent studio facilities on offer to us. So, if we have all this, why do we need money? Well - we want to be BETTER.

Your money would help us have better props and more 'decoration' of the set. It would also help us to provide better prizes for our talentedly nerdy contestants! We'd also use it to cover some initial advertising costs in things like magazines, online etc. Your money will ultimately give us the chance to make the show better!

Risks & Challenges

The only thing that will potentially affect the delivery of the project is the recording time. We sometimes struggle to record in our busy studio - and sometimes technical issues mean we can't make the show for a week or two. But, we work our hardest to deliver episodes on time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you could share this campaign, that'd be awesome! You can also stay in touch with us on our social media:

  • Facebook: SunNerdOff
  • Twitter: @NerdOffTV
