story:
Synopsys

(la version française suit l'anglais)

In 2013, Canadian citizens and residents sponsoring their spouses to become permanent residents had a very clear path of two stages to follow. Processing times for Stage 1 of the Canada Inland Spousal Sponsorship program were 6 months, plus 8 months for the second stage. In 2014, times for the first stage doubled to 12 moths. In 2015 they almost tripled to 17 months, and times for the second stage also increased to 10 months, for a total of 27 months of wait.


During that time, the family goes through financial hardships, since the sponsored person:

  • Is not allowed to work.
  • Can't access health care.
  • Can't study.
  • Can't travel abroad.

Thousands of families have to survive on a single income, and many are on the verge of bankruptcy. This documentary follows their struggles as they try to start a family in Canada, and tries to answer the question that the Government has dodged for years: why does this backlog take place to begin with?


What We Need & What You Get

These families can't keep waiting, and neither do their stories. To be able to shoot in May, we need to gather enough funding to cover 10 days of shooting and post production:



  • We need to pay for the honorariums for the cameramen, the sound recording, equipment rental and post production facilities.
  • If you fund us you will have access to awesome perks like access to early screenings and owning the documentary when it's released on Vimeo On Demand.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will do some adjustments (like using one camera instead of two) and minimize the costs even more than we are doing now.
  • If we surpass our goal, we will use this income to help the affected families' fund, which is currently raised by themselves and used to finance demonstrations and other resources to inform Canadians of their current situation and what they can do to help.


Why this documentary is important

We need to raise awareness of this issue because it's not getting the attention it deserves. Even with the hard facts presented above, the Government still refuses to acknowledge that there is something wrong, with Minister Chris Alexander even declaring to the House of Commons that he has reduced the waiting time for all categories.

We need the general public to know that these half-Canadian families are facing enormous struggles because of senseless bureaucracy. We need these families to know that all of their struggle and frustration will be heard, and their stories will be told. 


I, myself, am facing the consequences of this problem, since my common law partner has not been able to work for years. We also had to cancel our wedding, scheduled for 2013, because Foreign Service diplomats decided to strike and our families were not able to come to Canada in time. We were hurt both morally and financially.

Almost two years have passed and our situation does not seem to improve due to the increasing backlog. After joining a Facebook group and listening to the stories of those affected, I realized that we're not alone. Thousands of other families are going through similar hardship, and much worse.

Instead of falling into depression, I decided to put my film-making background to good use and share these stories. My first short film ended up in the Cannes Film Festival and gained some notoriety, I hope this one too makes some noise so these stories are heard and this cause supported. 


Can We Count on You?

We really hope you can help us make this documentary, in any way you can. If you can't contribute with money, you can share this Indiegogo Campaign with your network, so others may do it.

You can also join us on Twitter or Facebook and help us gain visibility. Share the articles. Help us shed light into this growing issue that affects more than 10 thousand Canadians and their families.


--

En Français

Synopsis

En 2013, les citoyens et résidents Canadiens qui parrainaient leur conjoint(e)s afin qu’ils/elles deviennent résident(e)s permanent(e)s avait une idée très nette des 2 étapes à suivre. Les délais pour l’étape 1 du programme de parrainage intérieur du Canada étaient de 6 mois, suivis d’un 8 mois additionnel pour la 2e étape. En 2014, les délais pour la première étape ont doublés à 12 mois. En 2015 ils ont presque triplés à 17 mois, et les délais pour la deuxième étape ont été augmentés à 10 mois, pour un total de 27 mois d’attente.



Pendant ce temps, les familles font face à des difficultés financières, puisque la personne parrainée :

  • N’est pas autorisée à travailler
  • N’a pas accès aux soins de santé
  • Ne peut pas étudier
  • Ne peut pas voyager outremer


Des milliers de familles doivent survivre avec un seul salaire, et plusieurs d’entre elles sont près de la faillite. Ce documentaire démontre leurs difficultés alors qu’ils essaient de fonder une famille au Canada, et essaie de répondre à la question que le Gouvernement du Canada évite depuis des années : pourquoi ces délais existent-ils?


Ce dont nous avons besoin & ce que vous obtenez

Ces familles ne peuvent plus attendre, et leurs histoires non plus. Afin de pouvoir tourner le documentaire en mai, nous devons amasser assez de fonds pour couvrir 10 jours de tournage et de post-production :


  • Nous devons payer les honoraires du caméraman, l’enregistrement du son, la location de l’équipement et les équipements post-production.
  • Si vous faites une donation, vous aurez accès à de fantastiques avantages tel qu’un accès à l’avant-première ainsi que posséder le documentaire lorsqu’il sera en ligne sur Vimeo Sur Demande.
  • Si nous n’atteignons pas notre but visé, nous procéderons à des ajustements (tels qu’utiliser une seule caméra au lieu de deux) et minimiserons les coûts encore plus que nous le faisons présentement.
  • Si nous dépassons notre but, nous utiliserons le surplus afin d’aider les fonds des familles affectées, qui paient présentement de leur poche afin de financer des manifestations et autres ressources afin d’informer les Canadiens de leur situation présente et de leur indiquer comment ils peuvent aider.


Pourquoi ce documentaire est important

Nous devons sensibiliser le public au sujet de cette situation parce qu’elle ne reçoit pas l’attention qu’elle mérite. Même avec les faits présentés ci-haut, le Gouvernement refuse toujours de reconnaître la problématique et le Ministre Chris Alexander a même déclaré à la Chambre des Communes qu’il a réduit le temps d’attente pour toutes les catégories d’immigration.

Le public général doit savoir que ces familles à demi-Canadiennes font face à d’énormes difficultés à cause de bureaucratie insensée. Ces familles doivent savoir que tous leurs problèmes et leurs frustrations seront entendus, et leurs histoires seront racontées.

Moi-même, je fais face aux conséquences de ce problème, puisque ma conjointe de fait n’est pas en mesure de travailler depuis des années. Nous avons également dû annuler notre mariage, prévu en 2013, puisque les diplomates des Services Étrangers ont décidé de faire la grève et nos familles n’ont pas pu venir au Canada à temps. Nous avons tous les deux eu mal, émotionnellement et financièrement.

Près de deux années ont passées et notre situation ne semble pas s’améliorer face aux délais qui augmentent. Après avoir rejoint un groupe Facebook et avoir écouté les histoires de ceux qui sont affectés par la situation, j’ai réalisé que nous n’étions pas seuls. Des milliers d’autres familles traversent des difficultés similaires, et pires encore.

Au lieu de sombrer dans la dépression, j’ai décidé de faire bon usage de mon expérience en création de films afin de partager ces histoires. Mon premier court-métrage a été présenté au Festival de Cannes et a reçu une certaine notoriété, j’espère donc que celui-ci attirera l’attention afin que ces histoires soient entendues et cette cause supportées.

Pouvons-nous compter sur vous?

Nous espérons sincèrement que vous pourrez nous aider à monter ce documentaire, de quelque façon que ce soit. Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer monétairement, vous pouvez partager cette campagne Indiegogo avec votre entourage, et l’encourager à faire de même.

Vous pouvez aussi nous rejoindre sur Twitter ou Facebook et nous aider à obtenir plus de visibilité. Aidez-nous à faire la lumière sur cette issue grandissante qui affecte plus de 10 000 Canadiens et leurs familles.

--

Read more in the press / Lisez en plus sur la presse

In English:

Long immigration process 'tearing us apart', Ottawa couple says. Ottawa Citizen

Permanent residency spouse sponsorship delays leave new dad unable to support family. CBC News

Couples in limbo demand audit of spousal sponsorship program. Toronto Star

Foreign spouses trapped in Canada due to sponsorship backlog. Metro

Oshawa couple among thousands in limbo who demand audit of spousal sponsorship program. Durham Region

En Français:

Immigrer: Un cauchemar bureaucratique. Journal de Montréal

Des couples excédés par les délais d’immigration exigent une enquête. Journal Métro

En Español:

La protesta ante el retraso de los apadrinamientos desde Canadá en cinco preguntas. Noticias Montreal

Documental prevé exponer la realidad de la inmigración familiar en Canadá. Noticias Montreal

story:
Who We Are

We are Penny Drop Pictures. We are proud to be a group of young ambitious film-makers situated in the North of England. 'Trepidation' is our final university production and the first major step towards a career in cinema. 


The Story

Trepidation follows the story of a woman who is slowly beginning to lose her rationality as she suspects her husband of murder. Upon discovering evidence she begins to fear for her life and confronts him in a desperate plea to save her sanity.

We need your help to produce the greatest quality film and set our goals for the future. With your help we can make this a reality. We won't forget your contribution.


Why We Need Your Help

Already we have at our disposal a super 35mm 4k Black Magic production camera, various prime lenses and basic lighting and grip equipment that has been generously supplied to us from Sunderland University.

What we really need is funding in order to secure the desirable location and preferable talent. The most important aspect of a film is how the story is told and the location and performances are key to this. We also need to cover other production costs such as transportation and food so any conrtibution at all will be a massive help to us.

Can't Contribute Directly?

That's no problem! Spread the word instead.

We would merely appreciate a simple word across the interwebs; facebook, twitter or any social media you may use.

Thanks so much for even taking the time to read this and have a lovely day!

story:
THE FILM.

Mafia Dad is a dark comedy that parodies and pays homage to the gangster movie genre. This short film follows a group of kids who stage an intervention for their friend, Michael, because they think his Dad is in the Mafia. To back up their claims, they tell their own visceral stories which parody scenes from famous Mafia movies in different, hilarious, modern settings.

WHY ARE WE MAKING THIS MOVIE?

Is there anybody out there who doesn’t appreciate a good gangster-mafia movie? If there is, give us their address and we’ll pay them a little visit. In all seriousness, we’re making this short film because it’s a fun, modern twist on a classically troubling and sticky family dynamic. From a directorial perspective, this concept is a creative playground. We’ve been watching classic films such as The Godfather franchise, Goodfellas, The Sopranos, The Untouchables and Scarface to better prepare for Mafia Dad’s characters, settings and situations. Underneath the hilarious situations and parodies, mass confusion and rush of adrenaline, we hope that people will ultimately walk from this story with a smile on their faces. This film represents us, as artists, and the kind of comedic work we want to create going forward in our careers. Mafia Dad will also be submitted to a variety of film festivals to showcase its hilarious take on the classic theme of Perception vs Reality.

WHAT WE NEED:

Unfortunately we do not have REAL Mafia Dads to fund this through a family “businesses,” so the majority of our fantastic cast and crew members are working for free. We need $4,000 to cover production and post-production costs. This money will go towards:

  • Equipment: We need top-of-the-line camera, lighting and sound equipment so this film can look its best!

  • Locations: We have the perfect places to shoot this movie, but we have to pay the owners for our production team to take over their space!

  • Special Effects Hair & Makeup: Our lead actor (Chet Gole) will be playing Mafia Dad… as well as his son Michael. We need extensive hair & makeup to make that believable.

  • Production Design: We need authentic props and set design to bring this to life!

  • Transportation: We need to get our cast, crew and equipment from location to location!

  • Craft Services: We need meals for our cast and crew to get them through production!

  • Post Production: We need to secure editing labs, color correction and music rights, oh my!

  • Festival Submissions: We need to cover the cost of festival submissions... those things are expensive!

WHO WE ARE:

We are a team of young, passionate storytellers who can’t wait to tell this tale:

CHET GOLE - WRITER/ LEAD ACTOR

Chet Gole is an actor/comedian from Kentucky and a graduate of Arizona State University's Walter Cronkite School. His passion for sketch comedy led him to New York City where he gained a vast knowledge in late night comedy by interning and assisting production for the Late Show with David Letterman, Late Night with Jimmy Fallon and The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Chet's credits include acting in various web series, appearing on MTV's Girl Code and performing  in multiple  sketches on The Late Show with David Letterman. (Chet's Acting Reel)

HAYLEY KOSAN - DIRECTOR

In between late-night binges of The Sopranos, Hayley Kosan is an associate producer at The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore. Hayley has directed many short films, most notably her dark comedy, The Understudy, whichearned multiple awards including Best Director and Best Cinematography at Columbia University's National Undergraduate film festival. Her latest project is a web series, Horrible Insane Girl, for IFC's Comedy Crib. (Hayley's Directory of Photography Reel)
JENNA GELENBERG - PRODUCER

Jenna Gelenberg is a soon-to-be graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, with a focus on writing, producing, and casting. Since leaving her small town of Blue Bell, PA and embarking on her NYC journey, she’s jumped headfirst into the entertainment world with internships at CBS’s Blue Bloods and NBC’s Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon. Jenna has been involved in the production of numerous short and indie films (www.imdb.com/name/nm6194168/) and recently launched her own casting company (www.gbergcasting.com) to enormous success.


IMPACT:

This short film is a passion project and a professional outlet for our team. We hope for this film to make its way into festivals or grow an audience online so that a broad audience can share in our comedic and dark ways of storytelling.


RISKS & CHALLENGES:

Making movies is definitely risky, but hey, so is the Mafia business, right? We’re confident that our experience and passion will minimize the various risks that are associated with film production. We even have a contingency section in our budget that is set aside for any production-related hiccups. But all in all … no risk, no reward!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

If you’re unable to donate, social media is the next best way to help. Share this page with all your friends, family, and mobs and check out our FaceBook page (https://www.facebook.com/mafiadadmovie)! Thank you so much for everything you’re doing to help us make this movie!
story_txt:
THE FILM. 
Mafia Dad is a dark comedy that parodies and pays homage to the gangster movie genre. This short film follows a group of kids who stage an intervention for their friend, Michael, because they think his Dad is in the Mafia. To back up their claims, they tell their own visceral stories which parody scenes from famous Mafia movies in different, hilarious, modern settings.
   WHY ARE WE MAKING THIS MOVIE? 
Is there anybody out there who doesn’t appreciate a good gangster-mafia movie? If there is, give us their address and we’ll pay them a little visit. In all seriousness, we’re making this short film because it’s a fun, modern twist on a classically troubling and sticky family dynamic. From a directorial perspective, this concept is a creative playground. We’ve been watching classic films such as The Godfather franchise, Goodfellas, The Sopranos, The Untouchables and Scarface to better prepare for Mafia Dad’s characters, settings and situations. Underneath the hilarious situations and parodies, mass confusion and rush of adrenaline, we hope that people will ultimately walk from this story with a smile on their faces. This film represents us, as artists, and the kind of comedic work we want to create going forward in our careers. Mafia Dad will also be submitted to a variety of film festivals to showcase its hilarious take on the classic theme of Perception vs Reality.   WHAT WE NEED:
Unfortunately we do not have REAL Mafia Dads to fund this through a family “businesses,” so the majority of our fantastic cast and crew members are working for free. We need $4,000 to cover production and post-production costs. This money will go towards:

Equipment: We need top-of-the-line camera, lighting and sound equipment so this film can look its best!
Locations: We have the perfect places to shoot this movie, but we have to pay the owners for our production team to take over their space!
Special Effects Hair & Makeup: Our lead actor (Chet Gole) will be playing Mafia Dad… as well as his son Michael. We need extensive hair & makeup to make that believable. 
Production Design: We need authentic props and set design to bring this to life!
Transportation: We need to get our cast, crew and equipment from location to location!
Craft Services: We need meals for our cast and crew to get them through production!
Post Production: We need to secure editing labs, color correction and music rights, oh my!
Festival Submissions: We need to cover the cost of festival submissions... those things are expensive!

WHO WE ARE:

We are a team of young, passionate storytellers who can’t wait to tell this tale:
CHET GOLE - WRITER/ LEAD ACTOR



Chet Gole is an actor/comedian from Kentucky and a graduate of Arizona State University's Walter Cronkite School. His passion for sketch comedy led him to New York City where he gained a vast knowledge in late night comedy by interning and assisting production for the Late Show with David Letterman, Late Night with Jimmy Fallon and The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Chet's credits include acting in various web series, appearing on MTV's Girl Code and performing  in multiple  sketches on The Late Show with David Letterman. (Chet's Acting Reel)



HAYLEY KOSAN - DIRECTOR


In between late-night binges of The Sopranos, Hayley Kosan is an associate producer at The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore. Hayley has directed many short films, most notably her dark comedy, The Understudy, whichearned multiple awards including Best Director and Best Cinematography at Columbia University's National Undergraduate film festival. Her latest project is a web series, Horrible Insane Girl, for IFC's Comedy Crib. (Hayley's Directory of Photography Reel)

JENNA GELENBERG - PRODUCER

Jenna Gelenberg is a soon-to-be graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, with a focus on writing, producing, and casting. Since leaving her small town of Blue Bell, PA and embarking on her NYC journey, she’s jumped headfirst into the entertainment world with internships at CBS’s Blue Bloods and NBC’s Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon. Jenna has been involved in the production of numerous short and indie films (www.imdb.com/name/nm6194168/) and recently launched her own casting company (www.gbergcasting.com) to enormous success.



IMPACT:
This short film is a passion project and a professional outlet for our team. We hope for this film to make its way into festivals or grow an audience online so that a broad audience can share in our comedic and dark ways of storytelling.

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

  
Making movies is definitely risky, but hey, so is the Mafia business, right? We’re confident that our experience and passion will minimize the various risks that are associated with film production. We even have a contingency section in our budget that is set aside for any production-related hiccups. But all in all … no risk, no reward!   OTHER WAYS TO HELP: 
If you’re unable to donate, social media is the next best way to help. Share this page with all your friends, family, and mobs and check out our FaceBook page (https://www.facebook.com/mafiadadmovie)! Thank you so much for everything you’re doing to help us make this movie!

story:
Hi, I am Guy Towe, radio talk show host on LA Talk Radio for more than 5 years. 
Los Angeles is the capital of homelessness in the country: 245,000 will experience homelessness in the next year, with more than 80,000 sleeping on the streets on any given night.  This number includes about 5,000-10,000 unaccompanied minors (many are victims of human trafficking) and about 6,000 veterans.   A full 50% of all homeless people are ethnically African-American, while their percentage of the general population is only about 9%, a staggering imbalance proportionally.

These folks are not old marbles to be discarded, they each have stories both heart-warming and heart-breaking.  I want to give a voice to those who do not have a voice, to let them tell their own stories to the world, a message in a bottle if you will. 
At the same time, there are a lot of institutions, programs, and services available to help the poor; these I want to identify and bring out into the light so any humanitarian listener can know how to support those efforts.
You can be involved yourself!  At whatever level you are comfortable with, your contribution to this campaign will help launch the show and empower the homeless.
The funds will be used to produce the show for at least 6 months, covering such expenses as airtime, crew, equipment needed to broadcast live from the streets of Los Angeles, etc.  We are also going to give stipends to the homeless we interview, you can contribute directly to them by that method.
Thank you for helping me speak up for the poor, the needy, the destitute; and giving them a voice.

story:
Remember when Tom Cruise portrayed Les Grossman as the producer of the MTV Movie Awards back in 2010? The Les Grossman character attracted an enormous fan base, and a Les Grossman spin-off movie was set to come out in 2012. Whatever happened to that?

My name is Justin Brush. I am a 21-year-old actor and screenwriter, and a few years ago I came across a very interesting character who claims to be the real Les Grossman. After doing some research, this is what I found...
It turns out that Les Grossman is not a fictional character. There is in fact a living, breathing real Les Grossman who was an over-the-top aggressive loud-mouthed concert and movie producer back in the late-60s and through the 70s. 
Here are a few of his notable accomplishments: 
 1. Grossman produced the Led Zeppelin/Who Concert on May 25th, 1969. This was the only time in US rock and roll history that these two bands performed on the same concert stage.
 2. Grossman booked Joe Cocker in June, 1970 for $1500 to open for Janis Joplin in December, 1970. By the time he performed, he was making $25,000 a night.
3. Grossman got David Lynch started with his band, Tractor, as composer for Lynch’s pre-Eraserhead movie The Grandmother. He was also a non-credited associate producer of Eraserhead.
4. He organized the US Capitol as the backdrop for the Washington DC scene of the Alice Cooper promotional tour in the Martin Scorsese movie Medicine Ball Caravan.
5. In the 1990s and 2000s, Grossman became a wild horse enthusiast. He worked as a private citizen looking after their well-being. Then he developed neighboring wild horse properties.
6. LG became a dog fancier who raised superstar Best in Show Champion Hall of Fame Flat-coated retriever Angee and Champion Flatcoat Trooper. Angee was invited to the Westminster Dog Show as the number one bitch in her breed.
Grossman's producing days were on sabbatical until the powers that be gave Tom Cruise LG's real time persona. Since then, the real LG has written three books including "A True Hollywood Legend…Les Grossman AKA Tom Cruise's Alter Ego" .
When I met LG, I was working on student projects at college where I majored in theatre and computer science. I saw this project as an opportunity to launch my professional career as a screenwriter. Any and all support will be acknowledged by incredible perks!

story:
Diamond Cab: Making Transportation Accessible for Aging Hong Kong

Diamond Cab (Hong Kong) Limited was founded in Feb 2010 with the vision and mission of providing legal, safe and convenient point-to-point transportation for the wheelchair-bound passengers in Hong Kong, so as to meet the huge need of an aging population. Since Diamond Cab launched its services in Feb 2011, the six Diamond Cabs have finished over 84,710 single trips tailor-made for the wheelchair users. We have 17 caring drivers with outstanding driving skills who are passionate about Diamond Cab and deliver the professional wheelchair-accessible transportation to our passengers with 24-hours pre-booking available.

Diamond Cab drivers knee down to serve the needy in wheelchairs every day in Hong Kong. 

When your waist cannot support because of old age, our driver is ready to serve you by bending his waist too!


Diamond Cabs usually have higher occupancy rates in day time except on holidays, as wheelchair-bound elders need our cabs to travel for their frequent and regular medical treatments. However, Diamond Cab is not just a non-emergency ambulance. With our vision and mission to cultivate Happy Aging in Hong Kong, we also organize weekly events during the evenings and help the elderly enjoy barrier-free activities like karaoke parties or night sightseeing tours with spectacular views.


We have Diamond Leisure 2.0 events every week to provide unprecedented sightseeing tour experiences to the wheelchair-bound elders. The one above was taken at SKY100 in the highest building in Hong Kong and the one below was taken at the Observation Wheel just launched last year and at the Japanese Hot Pot (Shabu Shabu) restaurant.

We Need Your Financial Support to Replace Old Cabs

After running for more than four years, Diamond Cabs have traveled over an average of 320,000 km each and urgently need more capital for better maintenance or replacement and expansion in next five years.

Your support will definitely help Diamond Cab to keep leading the world to provide professional barrier-free taxi services for aging societies.


Media Coverage: 

Fast Company 2011: http://www.fastcompany.com/1718338/diamond-cab-picks-hong-kongs-fledgling-social-entrepreneurship-scene

The City Fix 2011: http://thecityfix.com/blog/social-entrepreneurship-in-hong-kongcabs-for-the-disabled/

Phoenix TV 2011: http://v.ifeng.com/news/world/201103/fb4476e8-3f12-42cd-afd7-da9a4a9f8cd3.shtml

Nikkei CNBC 2014: http://www.ustream.tv/recorded/55230352

TED City 2.0 2014: http://www.tedcity2.org/talks/elderly-transportation-designed-for-dignity-2/

Commercial Radio 1  2015: http://crtv.881903.com/crtv/index.php?cat=all&vid=Uo74mD1RSXw

Apple Daily Tomo News: http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/news/art/20150606...

Awards:

UK Social Enterprise Awards 2012: Highly Commended International Social Enterprise

Cartier Women Initiative Awards 2013 (Finalist, Asia-Pacific): http://www.cartierwomensinitiative.com/candidate/doris-leung

The Purpose Economy Asia 100: http://purposeeconomy.com/pe-100-asia/

Chivas The Venture 2015 (Finalist, Hong Kong)  https://www.theventure.com/hk/en/


Funding breakdown:

Diamond Cab uses Toyota’s Noah Welcab model. We hope to change our existing fleet one by one in the coming years.

Each new vehicle will cost about US$65,000, so we aim to launch our fundraising campaign starting at US$33,000 and hope to build up more momentum through Chivas The Venture campaign.

If the amount of funds raised is not enough to buy new vehicles, we will redirect any amount raised to support the increasingly expensive maintenance for the current fleet of cabs.


Team Bios:

Doris Leung, Founder and CEO, Diamond Cab

(Post Career: Principal Reporter, i-Cable News Limited)

Joseph Ngai, Chairman, Diamond Cab (Pro Bono) 

(Present Career: Managing Partner, Mckinsey&Co, Hong Kong)

Diamond Cab operates with 1 Administration Officer, 17 Diamond Cab Drivers and 8 Call Center Staff, with the support of Social Ventures Hong Kong and our dedicated Board of Directors. At least 5 Strategic Partners work closely with us for daily transportation operations.

 


You may get a Miniature Diamond Cab  

For contributions of $800 and above we will send you a Miniature Diamond Cab – a 1:43 unique cab model that represent the barrier-free mission of Diamond Cab for wheelchair users in Hong Kong.

The professionally designed and manufactured Miniature Diamond Cab was brought to London and shared a moment with a London Cab.


For contributions of US$500 and above, you will get a free airport transfer on a Diamond Cab to the Hong Kong International Airport. You will be able to enjoy Diamond spaciousness to accommodate your luggage too! Diamond Cabs are designed to accommodate up to 5 passengers (including wheelchairs of wheelchair-bound passengers and any luggage).

The winner of our Favorite Passenger Award, Eva Law, brought her mother in a wheelchair to travel and was dropped off at the Hong Kong International Airport by a Diamond Cab.


Would you like our elderly friends to sing your favorite Cantonese / Mandarin songs for you? We frequently take our elderly beneficiaries to karaoke parties. For contributions of US$200 and above, we will post a video of their special dedicated performance for you on our online platforms!


Singing favorite songs is always the best anti-aging activity with Diamond Cab!


Perk just claimed by Contributor Maggie Fung Wing Sze, who wishes to listen to one of the famous Mandarin song of Teresa Tang for celebrating her birthday on 11 May. Auntie Law was very serious to sing on behalf of the elderly in the Charity Karaoke Party organized by Diamond Cab on 6 May. Join us to contribute and also empower the elders to sing for crowd funding!


What an enjoyable Karaoke Night with the Aunties!

For contributions of US$25 and above, we will offer two cash coupons to underprivileged wheelchair-bound passengers to ride on Diamond Cabs. More coupons means longer distance rides to the needy! Your name will be acknowledged in our online platforms.

You are not only supporting Hong Kong, but all the aging cities in the world including yours!

Aging is not just unique in Hong Kong, but common anywhere in the world. With your help, we can not only make Diamond Cab successful, but also create hope for other aging cities to find a way out.

With the support of an impact investor, we just secured the 7th Diamond Cab, which will be launched in 2016 in Hong Kong. This is the second time that impact investing has worked successfully for Diamond Cab! Our two impact investors put in US$1.8m totally to fund the purchase of new cabs and taxi licenses.

Every dollar counts – a contribution on your part can go a long way when matched with the existing licenses with Diamond Cab’s pioneer taxi owners to keep our mission going!


Not Enough Financial Support will lead to termination of Diamond Cab

As our cabs are really getting old, we must keep them going with safe and new parts. Without sufficient financial support, we will need to terminate their operations one by one.

Other than crowdfunding, we also work hard to pitch cab advertising and event sponsorship in Hong Kong.


Our garage partners are working super hard to support Diamond Cab with safe and efficient operation at least cost.


Or you can tell more people about Diamond Cab needs!

We will also appreciate other forms of support! Simply forward our message to your network contacts to spread the word of Diamond Cab.

Remember to use the Indiegogo’s sharing tools!


FAQ:

What is the background of Diamond Cab?

Diamond Cab is a privately owned company. We received investment support from Hong Kong’s pioneer venture philanthropic organization, Social Ventures Hong Kong in 2010. We launched our service by partnering with taxi owners who rent expensive taxi licenses and cabs to us at affordable prices to support Diamond Cab and seek significant impact for a change in aging culture in the long run.

What is the career background of Diamond Cab’s Founder?
Doris Leung quit her job as TV journalist in 2009 to lead Diamond Cab. Doris was mainly inspired by her mother who suffered from disabilities after developing a brain tumor in 2007. Doris has overcome huge challenges related to licenses, vehicles, drivers, calling services, maintenance, passenger management, etc to make this social startup sustainable for the 5th year running.

Did the Hong Kong SAR Government give any support to Diamond Cab?

As a privately owned enterprise, Diamond Cab is not entitled to receive any government or charity funding. The HKSAR Government does acknowledge Diamond Cab’s contributions in making a huge difference to the taxi industry in Hong Kong. Diamond Cab serves as a showcase to call for more changes in government policies to support social ventures in Hong Kong.


What regional impact has Diamond Cab made?

A company in Taiwan launched unprecedented barrier-free taxi services in 2013 because its partner visited Diamond Cab in 2012. Now there are over 100 barrier-free taxis serving people in need in Taiwan. A new impact investment fund in Singapore is planning to work with Diamond Cab to bring the idea to Singapore as well.

Taiwan barrier-free taxi was inspired by Diamond Cab and founded in 2013.  Jacky Hsu, Secretary of Taiwan Access for All Association visited Doris Leung, Founder and CEO, Diamond Cab in 2012 and then lobbied the taxi operator and government to start up the barrier-free taxi service. Now they have over 100 barrier-free taxis in Taiwan.

unprecedented barrier-free taxi services in 2013 because its partner visited
Diamond Cab in 2012. Now there are over 100 barrier-free taxis serving people
in need in Taiwan. A new impact investment fund in Singapore is planning to
work with Diamond Cab to bring the idea to Singapore as well.

Taiwan barrier-free taxi was inspired by Diamond Cab and founded in 2013.  Jacky Hsu, Secretary of Taiwan Access for All Association visited Doris Leung, Founder and CEO, Diamond Cab in 2012 and then lobbied the taxi operator and government to start up the barrier-free taxi service. Now they have over 100 barrier-free taxis in Taiwan.

story:
MRS. PHIPPS (Velvet Rhodes) IS DOWN TO HER LAST TWO MILLION AND DECIDES TO RENT A ROOM IN HER MANSION. THE FUN BEGINS WHEN THE ROOM MATES MOVE IN FROM AROUND THE WORLD!

ROOM FOR RENT THE SERIES EPISODE 8

The award winning series is taking off in a new direction.  In this episode Mrs. Phipps decides to help the homeless and interviews several likely candidates to move into her mansion.  She also discovers that her mansion is haunted!  Many ghosts start appearing and things starts moving  around..oooooo creepy!  As well as all of this abnormal behavior, three very well known celebrities want to move in as room mates!

THIS IS AN ONGOING SERIES WEBISODE POTENTIAL TELEVISION SHOW.  WE HAVE MADE 7 EPISODES WHICH HAVE SCREENED AND WON AWARDS AT THE IDYLLWILD INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL, ACTION ON FILM INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL, LAUGHLIN INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL, GLENDALE INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL.

story:
After May 30, please go to our Facebook page:  www.facebook.com/Californiasealsdoc or email: take2mark@sbcglobal.net

WHY?

The history of the California Golden Seals includes white skates, orange pucks, female streakers, some future NHL superstars, a flamboyant owner, and even a young Tom Hanks.  
With such a wild background, the time for a documentary about this long-defunct hockey franchise is way overdue.

THE BACK STORY

In the late 1960s and early 70s, I was a young, transplanted  Canadian kid growing up in Northern California.  Naturally, my dad would take my brothers and I to see the new, local NHL hockey team - the California Seals. (later renamed the "Oakland Seals" and then: "California Golden Seals.")   

Through nine seasons, we watched as our team suffered through poor ownership, disasterous trades, crazy uniforms, and of course - their infamous Polar Bear White ice skates.   And every time the struggling Seals seemed ready to start firing on all cylinders, another calamity would strike.  As one writer stated: "Everything that could go wrong, did."    

I always felt that the Seals would make for a fascinating documentary.   And since I grew up to become a television producer,  I was in a great position to do something about it.  My credits include shows for E! Entertainment Television (25 episodes of "True Hollywood Story") as well as documentaries for the TV Guide Network, NBC, and the Reelz Channel.

WHAT'S ALREADY COMPLETED

Beginning last summer, I travelled across Canada and the U.S. to interview more than 25 former Seals players, team officials,  journalists, fans, and current NHL players.

The interviews have all been transcribed and I'm currently writing the script.

Everyone told great stories which will be augmented by an incredible collection of rare photos, documents, memorabilia, and home movies that have been generously donated. 

THE NEXT STEP: ARCHIVAL  FOOTAGE

This is where you come in:  we're seeking to license a wealth of archival footage featuring the Seals.  This crucial material includes old game highlights, plus an amazing collection of 16mm news stories that have sat in storage for 40 years. 

This is the single biggest cost with the documentary.  The 16mm film has to be retrieved by an archivist, cleaned and prepped, transferred to videotape, and then licensed for use from local TV stations.  

The old videotapes of televised games featuring the Seals also need to be licensed, as well as transferred to current video formats.

Finally, we also need to pay a fee to the NHL to use images of the various teams.  (The folks at the NHL are aware of this documentary and are being quite helpful.) 

THE PAY-OFF

You'll be helping to tell the story of one of hockey's most-fascinating and little-known chapters.  In return, we've assembled a variety of perks we hope will make contributing fun.  

THE PERKS INCLUDE……

ORIGINAL HOCKEY CARDS….


1970'S CALIFORNIA GOLDEN SEALS COIN BANK! 


OFFICIAL SEALS MEDIA GUIDE 1974/75 


SEALS AT NEW YORK RANGERS PROGRAM - DEC. 1970 


VINTAGE SEALS PENNANTS...


CALIFORNIA SEALS T-SHIRTS….


REPLICA SEALS JERSEYS…ALL THREE ERAS….


ORIGINAL PROGRAMS…


STICKERS, MEDIA GUIDES, DVDS & DIGITAL DOWNLOADS OF THE FILM, AND MUCH MORE!
YOU CAN ALSO RECEIVE A CREDIT AS "ASSOCIATE PRODUCER" OR "PRODUCER" ON THE MOVIE!
After May 30, please go to our Facebook page:  www.facebook.com/Californiasealsdoc

story:
A New Approach to Filmmaking...

The challenge of taking on a feature film is huge, costly and time consuming. On the other hand,  a short film can be made on comparatively small budgets and in only a few months. I think the key to making the feature film more manageable is in finding a way to combine the simple practicalities of the short film, within the longer form of the feature film. If we create a multi-narrative film and segment each strand of the story, assigning different teams to different sections, maybe we could make a feature film using the same parameters of a short film?!

                              

I'm Alan Livesey, an independent Director based in Preston, Lancashire. I studied Film Production and Screenwriting at the University of Central Lancashire. Since then I have produced a series of commissioned short films and filmed a short drama on location in Los Angeles CA. I co-produce music videos and have written a feature film on commission, a script that was shortlisted at the Beverley Hills Screenplay Contest.

After achieving this much, I've been keen to make the step up to making a feature film. The Blackout Film Project is my approach to this challenge. By building several production crews, all responsible for a short story within The Blackout, we share the workload and produce our feature film in a fraction of the time of an ordinary independent feature film.


The Blackout

The Blackout is a multi-narrative feature film set in Preston, Lancashire.
When an all-power blackout hits the nation, the people of Preston are left isolated with no lights, no phones and no transport. The Blackout follows six characters and their journeys across the city on the first night of complete darkness.

The Production

So where are we up to so far? We have six producers currently building their crews. We have a database of crew members ready to get involved. We have a completed script, with all of our stories weaving in and out of each other. We have actors ready to find out more about our stories and audition for our characters. We have access to Cinema standard equipment.
And between the whole team, we have huge amounts of skills, flair and experience, spanning the whole range of the filmmaking process. We know how to make a small budget go along way.
We are looking to raise £8,000 to supplement our production. Each of our Production Teams gets a 6th of this money (around £1,300). So £8,000 might seem like a tiny amount for a feature, but with preproduction complete and the resources we already have, £1,300 seems like a realistic amount for a short film.
And that is the beauty of this approach to filmmaking.

The Change to Filmmaking

We know what we're doing is a new way of making a feature. Sure, there are anthology films made in the same way, but they don't feel like a complete film. Sure, there are multi-narratives, but they're still a single director's vision (and take just as long as any other feature film).

And there are obstacles. Our goal is to make a cohesive multi-narrative. That means the scripts have to flow well, the cinematography has to feel uniform, and the final cut needs to feel like one story.
But The Blackout Film Project is also about collaboration. Our stories have been written by a team of six independent, award-winning writers who have given their creative input at every stage of the re-writing process. Their progress has also been monitored and edited at every stage by our main script editor. The same process will be replicated through production, ensuring we have a cohesive single film at the end of this project.

                               


Your Contribution

Now we know how important your money is to you. And we all know it doesn't cost me £45 to send you a digital copy of our script(!). And we know that the contribution you make to this film is what makes it come alive. So we want your contributions to be up to you. We'd rather have 3,000 contributors put some small change into our project, than try and convince 300 that they need a "social media shout-out" for £25 (we offer that as standard!).
We're offering as much as we can for the smallest contribution.  We're happy to offer a Business Sponsorship package for Businesses that want to support our film too. And you can support our project by following us online, signing up to our newsletter and spreading the word.
We've got all the 'nuts and bolts' in place, we just need some loose change in the meter to get us up and running.
This is your chance to be part of something amazing.

story:
About The WorkOut Video!

The WorkOut Video!  is an experimental film that, under the guise of a workout video, explores the complexities of today's fitness culture through the eyes of two eager, successful fitness instructors. First conceived in August 2014 by Chris Andrae and Kayla Eisenberg, The WorkOut initially was given breadth as an interactive live theatrical experience. The show culminated in a full workshopped production in October 2014, as Chris and Kayla's senior project at NYU Tisch School of the Arts,  produced by Playwrights Horizons Theater School. Since graduating, Chris and Kayla have been hard at work planning what they felt was The WorkOut's necessary next step - a short film adaptation. The WorkOut Video! is this film. Chris and Kayla have already begun editing the film's screenplay, storyboarding, and assembling an exceptional team of filmmaking collaborators to help bring this film to life. The last piece to completing this beautiful puzzle is YOU! 



What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to fund the making of The WorkOut Video! This campaign was launched to raise money for all production intents and purposes. Here's what your donations will be used for:

  • Location/Space: Three days of filming on location in a workout studio/gym - $200
  • Music: We've had Swedish DJ OLWIK mix our very own The WorkOut! theme song - $250
  • Film Equipment: This includes camera/lighting/sound/insurance materials - $1900
  • Costumes: Wardrobe, including hair and makeup - $200
  • Transportation: Moving van to transport film equipment to and from set - $250
  • Meals: Nourishment for the production team/crew - $150
  • ICE/Contingency Money: $300
  • Total Budget: $3250

Your monetary donation, regardless of how large or small, is so greatly appreciated and will go a long way. Feel free to check out the "Perks" we've come up with to show you just how much your help means to us. A perk you can't put a price on, however, is knowing you've contributed to the making of important, experimental, relevant art, and being able to see how that contribution comes to fruition. 



The WorkOut Video!'s Impact on Us and You

None of us live under a rock - it's become increasingly clear that the Fitness Culture of 2015 has been taken a few notches up from the 1980's dance-fitness craze of sweatbands, leg warmers, and Olivia Newton-John. Today, "Working Out" means striving to become the BEST, most physically fit version of yourself; and your mind will follow. In other words, the better you look in the mirror, the happier, more confident you will feel. The correlation is direct. However, anyone that's heard or read a Buzzfeed article about Meghan Trainor's "All About that Bass" knows that there are two sides of every coin. Whether it's not caring enough about your body image to work to improve it, or caring TOO much to the point of superficiality, you just can't win the game of "I look and feel good enough." The media (virtually every branch), gym trainers, fitness instructors, and your great-aunt who said you"maybe shouldn't have two brownies for dessert this time" have monopolized on the power to send out these mixed signals, and in 2015, we gradually allow them to have this authority. 
But this unconscious compliance can get to, and IS getting to our heads. Beauty standards are becoming warped and un-warped and warped again as we allow others to rate our physical and mental strength on a scale from 1 to SoulCycle. It's SO necessary that we talk about both sides of this issue: we don't want to become obedient slaves to today's fitness culture, but we do want to look damn good for bikini season! The WorkOut Video! complicates this conversation that we must start having. We're getting inside the minds of fitness instructors who are both giving and receiving these mixed messages, and in doing so, exploring and making discoveries about the psychology behind 2015's fitness culture. This film must come to life in order for us to make a well-versed statement about body image and compliance that EVERYONE has struggled with and/or questioned at some point. Chris and Kayla have been working on The WorkOut! for almost a year now, researching and discussing and workshopping and exploiting their own physical and mental vulnerabilities so they can bring this short film to you - the people who need to see it and turn it into part of the necessary dialogue to find a way for us all, in 2015, to just be good enough. Your help in funding this project will make that possible. 



The WorkOut Video! Production Timeline

Here's how we plan on gettin' it all done: 

  • March 31st: The LAUNCH of our Indiegogo!
  • May 1st: Indiegogo Campaign is finished. 
  • May-June: Editing/finalizing drafts of the screenplay, storyboarding, choreographing, staging, rehearsing (this is when all the magic happens!)
  • First Week in July: Begin shooting The WorkOut Video! (3 days)
  • Mid-July - Mid-August: Post-production
  • Late August/September: Submission of The WorkOut Video! to local short film festivals. 
  • Early September: Premiere screening of The WorkOut Video!


             The WorkOut Video! Team

Chris Andrae (co-creator, director) is a New York based artist who recently graduated from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts with his BFA in acting (PHTS, ETW) and a minor in Cinema Studies. There, he received the prestigious Alec Baldwin Drama Scholarship as a member of Tisch's "Dean's Scholars." Performance credits include: Handwritten (screen, Robbie Starbuck Media), No Place (stage, dir. Jennifer Morris), Three Sisters (stage, dir. Derek Lucci), Backstage at the Horror Drag (ANIMALS), and Don't Major in Debt (immersive, w/ Jane Lynch). He has been working on The WorkOut! for nearly a year, and with Kayla since beginning college together. Chris is an intern for Big Dance Theater and The Wooster Group. contact@chrisandrae.com // chrisandrae.com
Kayla Eisenberg (co-creator, writer) is an actress, playwright, and choreographer based in New York. After receiving her BFA with Honors from NYU Tisch (Playwrights Horizons Theater School) and studying Shakespeare at The Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London, she could not be happier creating The WorkOut Video! - a project that has remained so personal and relevant throughout its year-long journey - with forever-collaborator and friend, Chris. Selected credits: Cordelia in LEAR, Tamora in Titus Andronicus, Amy-Joy in Life Under Water, and Brigida in Uncle Giff's Christmas Special. She has also performed in the NY International Fringe Festival and with Untitled Theater Company #61. Kayla's written work has appeared in Manhattan Repertory Theater's Fall Festival. Interested collaborators should contact via kaylaeisenberg4@gmail.com. 
David Jaffe (editor) was born and raised in Yardley, Pennsylvania and currently studies film at New York University. David's short films have appeared in festivals in Lambertville, Philadelphia and Manhattan. As a freelancer, David has worked as a production designer and an art director on both independent and commercial projects.
Peter Liu (cinematographer) is a filmmaker living in NYC. He received his B.A. in Film Production from NYU in 2014. When he is not writing or working on a project, Peter enjoys cooking, laughing at jokes, and playing video games
OLWIK (music) Swedish native Herman Olvik, better known as OLWIK, stands at 18 years old and is quickly ascending the ranks of the dance music industry with his modern progressive sound that utilizes live instrumentation. He has been immersed in music since his early childhood, being classically trained on the piano, drums and guitar. Eager to improve on a daily basis, OLWIK strives to create melodies that speak for themselves.
You: AWESOME. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out! This is an ambitious project that the world needs to see. If you are not in a position to donate money, please send the link to this campaign to ANYONE that is! 

Support us! If it's money you CAN'T give, but CAN give something else (space, equipment, props, food, etc.), shoot us an email at theworkoutnyc@gmail.com and we would be MORE than happy to graciously receive what you have to offer.

Talk about us! We all love the limelight, but it's important to begin or continue having conversations about the beauty standards and obedience/compliance surrounding today's fitness culture. So start the dialogue with a friend, or your mom, or a stranger on a bench! And when you do, be sure to drop The WorkOut's name; mention that we need all the help we can get to contribute to the dialogue in the best way we possibly can - by making art.
story_txt:
About The WorkOut Video!
The WorkOut Video!  is an experimental film that, under the guise of a workout video, explores the complexities of today's fitness culture through the eyes of two eager, successful fitness instructors. First conceived in August 2014 by Chris Andrae and Kayla Eisenberg, The WorkOut initially was given breadth as an interactive live theatrical experience. The show culminated in a full workshopped production in October 2014, as Chris and Kayla's senior project at NYU Tisch School of the Arts,  produced by Playwrights Horizons Theater School. Since graduating, Chris and Kayla have been hard at work planning what they felt was The WorkOut's necessary next step - a short film adaptation. The WorkOut Video! is this film. Chris and Kayla have already begun editing the film's screenplay, storyboarding, and assembling an exceptional team of filmmaking collaborators to help bring this film to life. The last piece to completing this beautiful puzzle is YOU! 

   
What We Need & What You Get
 We need your help to fund the making of The WorkOut Video! This campaign was launched to raise money for all production intents and purposes. Here's what your donations will be used for:







Location/Space: Three days of filming on location in a workout studio/gym - $200


Music: We've had Swedish DJ OLWIK mix our very own The WorkOut! theme song - $250


Film Equipment: This includes camera/lighting/sound/insurance materials - $1900


Costumes: Wardrobe, including hair and makeup - $200


Transportation: Moving van to transport film equipment to and from set - $250


Meals: Nourishment for the production team/crew - $150


ICE/Contingency Money: $300

Total Budget: $3250

Your monetary donation, regardless of how large or small, is so greatly appreciated and will go a long way. Feel free to check out the "Perks" we've come up with to show you just how much your help means to us. A perk you can't put a price on, however, is knowing you've contributed to the making of important, experimental, relevant art, and being able to see how that contribution comes to fruition. 




The WorkOut Video!'s Impact on Us and You

None of us live under a rock - it's become increasingly clear that the Fitness Culture of 2015 has been taken a few notches up from the 1980's dance-fitness craze of sweatbands, leg warmers, and Olivia Newton-John. Today, "Working Out" means striving to become the BEST, most physically fit version of yourself; and your mind will follow. In other words, the better you look in the mirror, the happier, more confident you will feel. The correlation is direct. However, anyone that's heard or read a Buzzfeed article about Meghan Trainor's "All About that Bass" knows that there are two sides of every coin. Whether it's not caring enough about your body image to work to improve it, or caring TOO much to the point of superficiality, you just can't win the game of "I look and feel good enough." The media (virtually every branch), gym trainers, fitness instructors, and your great-aunt who said you"maybe shouldn't have two brownies for dessert this time" have monopolized on the power to send out these mixed signals, and in 2015, we gradually allow them to have this authority. 
But this unconscious compliance can get to, and IS getting to our heads. Beauty standards are becoming warped and un-warped and warped again as we allow others to rate our physical and mental strength on a scale from 1 to SoulCycle. It's SO necessary that we talk about both sides of this issue: we don't want to become obedient slaves to today's fitness culture, but we do want to look damn good for bikini season! The WorkOut Video! complicates this conversation that we must start having. We're getting inside the minds of fitness instructors who are both giving and receiving these mixed messages, and in doing so, exploring and making discoveries about the psychology behind 2015's fitness culture. This film must come to life in order for us to make a well-versed statement about body image and compliance that EVERYONE has struggled with and/or questioned at some point. Chris and Kayla have been working on The WorkOut! for almost a year now, researching and discussing and workshopping and exploiting their own physical and mental vulnerabilities so they can bring this short film to you - the people who need to see it and turn it into part of the necessary dialogue to find a way for us all, in 2015, to just be good enough. Your help in funding this project will make that possible. 
 

    
The WorkOut Video! Production Timeline

Here's how we plan on gettin' it all done: 
March 31st: The LAUNCH of our Indiegogo!
May 1st: Indiegogo Campaign is finished. 
May-June: Editing/finalizing drafts of the screenplay, storyboarding, choreographing, staging, rehearsing (this is when all the magic happens!)

First Week in July: Begin shooting The WorkOut Video! (3 days)

Mid-July - Mid-August: Post-production

Late August/September: Submission of The WorkOut Video! to local short film festivals. 


Early September: Premiere screening of The WorkOut Video!


 

             The WorkOut Video! Team

Performance credits include: Handwritten (screen, Robbie Starbuck Media), No Place (stage, dir. Jennifer Morris), Three Sisters (stage, dir. Derek Lucci), Backstage at the Horror Drag (ANIMALS), and Don't Major in Debt (immersive, w/ Jane Lynch). He has been working on The WorkOut! for nearly a year, and with Kayla since beginning college together. Chris is an intern for Big Dance Theater and The Wooster Group. contact@chrisandrae.com // chrisandrae.com

Kayla Eisenberg (co-creator, writer) is an actress, playwright, and choreographer based in New York. After receiving her BFA with Honors from NYU Tisch (Playwrights Horizons Theater School) and studying Shakespeare at The Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London, she could not be happier creating The WorkOut Video! - a project that has remained so personal and relevant throughout its year-long journey - with forever-collaborator and friend, Chris. Selected credits: Cordelia in LEAR, Tamora in Titus Andronicus, Amy-Joy in Life Under Water, and Brigida in Uncle Giff's Christmas Special. She has also performed in the NY International Fringe Festival and with Untitled Theater Company #61. Kayla's written work has appeared in Manhattan Repertory Theater's Fall Festival. Interested collaborators should contact via kaylaeisenberg4@gmail.com.

David's short films have appeared in festivals in Lambertville, Philadelphia and Manhattan. As a freelancer, David has worked as a production designer and an art director on both independent and commercial projects.

He has been immersed in music since his early childhood, being classically trained on the piano, drums and guitar. Eager to improve on a daily basis, OLWIK strives to create melodies that speak for themselves.

story:
After The WWE Spotlight: Tony Altas takes an in-depth look at the Hall of Famer's career & what's really like for these superstars known around the world when their days on national TV ends.

All winter, Tony has had a difficult time paying his home mortgage and other bills.  He never made seven figures in a year;  his biggest year was $125,000 - in the 1980's, before you figure in tax, plus the cost of hotels (that wrestlers pay for out of pocket), rental car (that wrestlers drive and pay for out of pocket), food (that wrestlers pay for out of pocket) and other road expenses.  Like many wrestling legends, he had the fame of a millionaire but not the income of one due to the finances available in the professional wrestling industry.  

Even when he returned to WWE to manage Mark Henry a few years back, post tax / expenses, he was left with $40k plus - a nice middle class living, but not much to put away into savings to live off of post career.

Tony Atlas is NOT looking for a handout - that's the important part.  Tony wants to work as often as possible, still wrestling in the ring in his 60's, at fanfests and other personal appearances.  Unlike a lot of "video production" type campaigns, Tony is paid in cash each time he's here at the studio (like he will April 18th) - not when the final video is produced.  Fans support since December has made a difference in his life as we've taped seven plus hours of original content.


What We Need & What You Get!

"Break It Down":

  • To produce our Tony Atlas Experience video, there are appearance fees, travel and hotel accommodations.
  • Along with talent, we have our own equipment needs, building the studio set, rentals, staffing, printing, advertising and every tiny cost that can add up big!
  • Fans participating in this endeavor will be rewarded with awesome, interactive rewards and perks!

Make An Impact!

WWE Hall of Famer.  Bodybuilding Hall of Famer.  Half of the first African American WWE Tag Team Champions.  A career and life filled with the highest of highs, the lowest of lows and everywhere in between around the world!  

If everyone that watched our Tony Atlas sitdown studio shoot Christmas night donated just a dollar, we'd be more than funded to have this project continue!

Other Ways You Can Help!

It's 2015 - let's be realistic.  Times are still tough for a lot of folks.  Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise on social media!  Utilize Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Join www.facebook.com/MWFAction, "Like" & "Share" posts!
  • Subscribe and enjoy over 700 FREE videos atwww.youtube.com/bostonwrestlingcom - "Like" & "Share" your favorites so even more fans can enjoy them at no cost!

story:
A Fully Interactive Comedy Series

In the digital age, we all have more than one persona — who we are in our daily lives, and the face we present to the world through social media. REXED is a comedy that shows us both sides of the young and the clueless, chronicling the misadventures of an over-confident, talent-free wannabe in his quest to be a star.

Rex is Certified "FUNNY" on FUNNY or DIE — watch here!

What sets REXED apart? Fans can follow Rex through Instagram, Twitter, Vine, etc., as well as his YouTube vlog. Tweet at Rex? He'll tweet back. Comment on his latest video? You might catch him mentioning you in his next vlog post.

Lots of series have a social media component, but REXED is the first that is about social media celebrity, capturing the rise of the next major media influencer... orrrr his spectacular failure. (That's up to you!) Different aspects of his story will unfold on different platforms — follow one wild drunken night through manic tweets and increasingly blurry Instagram photos. Some of Rex's antics may only be found on Vine... or get Snapchatted to a select few of his favorite fans... or unfold streaming live on Periscope. REXED is a satire of social media, unfolding on social media.

Rex may be a star in his own mind, but the co-stars of REXED are his subscribers and followers — AKA, YOU — because your reactions to his words, pictures, and videos will be the true catalyst that shapes Rex's story, capturing Rex's reactions from fans (and, of course, trolls and haters) in real-time.

Scripted, but unpredictable. Along the way, you'll see Rex behind the scenes in his quest to be "liked," shared, and followed — not just the face he presents through social media and desperate grabs at stardom, but also in our scripted series that pulls back the curtain on what Rex is really like when he thinks no one's watching. (Sneak preview: he's a mess.)

The series includes fans' actual engagements with Rex — comments on YouTube videos, tweets to Rex, the number of likes and followers on Instagram — showing how social media affects his daily life, actions, and state of mind. What Rex does next is determined by whether he has 10 followers or 10 million, giving the audience an unparallelled amount of influence and interactivity with our star.

Stepping into Rex’s universe will be an immersive experience that allows you to interact with our star anywhere you spend your time online. In fact, it's already started.

Here’s where you can start interacting with Rex right now:

Rex on Twitter @RexYouUp
Rex on Instagram @RexYouUp
Rex on Vine @RexYouUp
Rex's YouTube

So watch out. Rex is coming at you… whether you like it or not.

Who The Hell Is Rex?

Rex grew up in Beverly Hills, retiring from a lucrative child modeling career to focus on his studies (kindergarten). More recently, he starred on the Real Housewives-esque Actual Apartment Renters of Los Angeles — until he was voted off in the first episode for being "too drunk too function."

Watch Rex's audition for Actual Apartment Renters of LA

Next, Rex turned his attention to his aspirations to be a rap star alongside his on-again, off-again girlfriend Lana — an "anti-socialite" who used to be famous for being famous and now spends her days drinking heavily and hiding from paparazzi in her bathroom. Together, Rex and Lana turned it up in “B.O.M.D.,” which you can feast your eyes on below (if you dare).

Now, Rex has turned his attentions to social media in hopes of stardom. He's trying anything and everything to get noticed on the internet — cooking videos (with Chee-tohs!), kidnapping puppies ('cause the internet loves dogs), sharing his not-so-deep "insights" with the world, and so much more. 

Get "B.O.M.D." on iTunes!

REXED the series follows our hapless “hero” on his mission to get the world to take notice of his many talents — and, more importantly, his gorgeous face.

That's where you come in...

Why We Need Your Help 

Rex’s social media exploits thus far have been fun, but the real fun begins in the scripted series, which can only be made with your contributions.

We need your money! Seriously, folks, in order for us to fully produce a high-quality first season, we need a cool $22,000.

Refer to the graph below for a reference as to where exactly that money will go...

ACTUAL BUDGET:


REX'S BUDGET:

For a full interactive chart, click here.


Rex's Entourage

X. Alexander – Writer/Director/Producer

X. Alexander majored in film at USC and has written for numerous pop culture websites, in addition to working on a very eclectic mix of screenplays for a very eclectic mix of people. During his decade in Los Angeles, he has come into contact with a wide array of power-mad maniacs and desperate narcissists who in no way informed his creation of these characters, and will certainly not be parodied in future episodes. He is the writer, producer, and director of THE AUTEUR (a short film starring Rex that inspired the spin-off series REXED).

Andrea Adams – Producer

Andrea most recently produced the IFC Midnight/Sundance Selects documentary MY AMITYVILLE HORROR and has worked on films including CHRONICLE, ALICE IN WONDERLAND and THE ROMANTICS. She produced THE AUTEUR as well as many other short films and music videos. REXED will be her first foray into the wild realm of original series.

Eric Kalisher – Producer

Eric works in the media industry, guiding the evolution of old forms (print magazines) and the rise of news ones (YouTube channels). After several years away from the camera, he returned to the world of film production in 2014 with THE AUTEUR. When he's not trying to make Rex famous, he's working on several writing projects and preparing a move to the director's chair.

Hear Us Talk About Rex On 'Crowdfund Cast'!

Rex's Live Performance of "B.O.M.D." at Venice Beach (filmed on GoPro with a drone):


Rex greets "fans" in Venice:

Our Intent

Rex isn’t so responsible with money. But we are! Our team already produced THE AUTEUR, a short film starring Rex to be released later this spring. No matter how much we raise for REXED through your generosity, one hundred percent goes toward the costs of production and post-production of our original series — cast and crew, locations, equipment, and so on. (No helicopter. No hookers.)

The more we raise, the more you’ll see and hear from Rex — and the more awesome it can be! We want to make this a fun ride for all (not just for Rex).

Please share this campaign page and/or your favorite Rex videos to spread the word and help Rex dominate the world.


#GetREXED
