story:
THE JOURNEY SO FAR

The idea of playing in the world of contract killers first assailed Jennah while in film school many (many) years ago. After gathering friends together to play with katanas and shoot a short film, the  idea refused to die and continued to develop into a more fully fleshed out story, finally evolving into a TV series concept. Jane then came onboard as the director, ready to bring life to the world and shoot a section of the first episode in order to demonstrate its potential as a series. 

 

THE STORY

Andrea "Andy" Jones was the promising protege of Eva Moore, one of the top contract killers in the business. After a particularly grizzly job, Andy walked away to live a "normal" life, leaving Eva angry and betrayed. A year later, Andy has a loving fiancé and spends her days running a small martial arts school. Life is blissfully peaceful, until one night she is attacked by a mysterious man. She comes home, bloodied and bruised, to find Eva in her apartment. Positive that Eva was behind the attack, Andy lashes out at her and a vicious fight ensues. Eva overpowers Andy, but stops short of killing her. Instead, Eva defends her innocence and tells Andy that there was an attempt on her life as well. She asks Andy to join her in uncovering the identity of their assailant. Distrustful of Eva's true intentions, but unable to return to her quiet life, Andy has no choice but to agree to an alliance and return to the underworld of killers in her search for the truth.

For this shoot, we will focus on the scene when Andy first discovers Eva in her apartment and the former mentor tries to lure Andy back into the game. This scene sets up the story and, through the physical confrontation between the assassins (one highly trained, the other out of practice), allows us to demonstrate the tone and pace of the series. Ultimately this scene introduces the characters of Andy and Eva and the complex relationship they will navigate throughout the series.
 

WHAT WE NEED

Support! As with any project, we very much need funds to shoot this. The cast and crew are all volunteering their time and labor because of the shared excitement to work on the project, so the money raised will go entirely to the production costs: equipment, locations, props, food to keep people going etc.  Every little donation counts! 
 

WHAT ELSE TO KNOW

An important part of this project that greatly excites us is the focus on two strong female characters in the lead roles, with a female-led production team. There will always be ongoing conversations within the entertainment industry about women in front and behind the camera,  and it's important that we continue to work hard to display our skills and talent as we strive to make advancements in the industry.
story_txt:
THE JOURNEY SO FAR
The idea of playing in the world of contract killers first assailed Jennah while in film school many (many) years ago. After gathering friends together to play with katanas and shoot a short film, the  idea refused to die and continued to develop into a more fully fleshed out story, finally evolving into a TV series concept. Jane then came onboard as the director, ready to bring life to the world and shoot a section of the first episode in order to demonstrate its potential as a series. 

 
THE STORY
Andrea "Andy" Jones was the promising protege of Eva Moore, one of the top contract killers in the business. After a particularly grizzly job, Andy walked away to live a "normal" life, leaving Eva angry and betrayed. A year later, Andy has a loving fiancé and spends her days running a small martial arts school. Life is blissfully peaceful, until one night she is attacked by a mysterious man. She comes home, bloodied and bruised, to find Eva in her apartment. Positive that Eva was behind the attack, Andy lashes out at her and a vicious fight ensues. Eva overpowers Andy, but stops short of killing her. Instead, Eva defends her innocence and tells Andy that there was an attempt on her life as well. She asks Andy to join her in uncovering the identity of their assailant. Distrustful of Eva's true intentions, but unable to return to her quiet life, Andy has no choice but to agree to an alliance and return to the underworld of killers in her search for the truth.For this shoot, we will focus on the scene when Andy first discovers Eva in her apartment and the former mentor tries to lure Andy back into the game. This scene sets up the story and, through the physical confrontation between the assassins (one highly trained, the other out of practice), allows us to demonstrate the tone and pace of the series. Ultimately this scene introduces the characters of Andy and Eva and the complex relationship they will navigate throughout the series. 
WHAT WE NEED
Support! As with any project, we very much need funds to shoot this. The cast and crew are all volunteering their time and labor because of the shared excitement to work on the project, so the money raised will go entirely to the production costs: equipment, locations, props, food to keep people going etc.  Every little donation counts! 
 
WHAT ELSE TO KNOW
An important part of this project that greatly excites us is the focus on two strong female characters in the lead roles, with a female-led production team. There will always be ongoing conversations within the entertainment industry about women in front and behind the camera,  and it's important that we continue to work hard to display our skills and talent as we strive to make advancements in the industry.

story:
This epic documentary tells the story of raising a family, living on the land and searching for God. It is told through the eyes of Shraddha, who has been filming her unique journey and family over the last 20 years. The film explores life's universal questions and how we can all make a positive difference in our daily lives. Shraddha, with her husband Gito and their three children built a life and a sanctuary deep in the rainforest. They drink pure mountain water, grow organic vegetables and live in a hand-built house which runs on solar power.

The film takes the viewer on an extraordinary journey of a family's quest seeking the meaning of life.

Who am I?   Who is God? 

How can we find world peace?    How can we live in harmony with nature?

Their quest for meaning took the family around the globe to meet spiritual leaders:  H.H. The Dalai Lama, Osho, Papaji- India, Dorothy Maclean - Findhorn Scotland,         Jose Arguelles -Mayan, Chief Arvol Looking Horse - Lakota and other visionaries.

            

                          The Forest Family, in the early days of making this film


In her early 30's, having worked successfully as an actress, Shraddha moved from the city to the country to find an alternative lifestyle. She documented her personal development and growth, as she home birthed her children and created a family life in the lush sub-tropical rainforest on the rim of the Wollumbin Caldera.

            

                        The house in the forest, hand built from rocks and timber


THE  SPIRITUAL QUEST

This is a story of courage, a search for truth, a journey of trust and a quest for answers. Will they discover what they are looking for, overcome obstacles, meet the people they want to interview and find the answers? 

The theme of spiritual and personal quest carries us through this story, as we are given valuable insights on this unique journey.


          

 Meeting H.H. The Dalai Lama at a press conference during his Australia                            Tour 2002 "Happiness in a material world" 


THE STYLE

This personal narrative takes the audience on an intimate journey on life, love and God combining unique footage and colourful visuals with an original music score. It introduces us to some of the world's most active peacekeepers and sacred places of power. Along with spectacular footage of their land and culture, the forest family meets and interviews indigenous elders and spiritual masters. They speak about the urgency for peace on earth and the need to care for our environment.  

    

                 

                                        The Gyoto Monks of Tibet, Australia 1994


THE VISION

Shraddha's vision to make this film began with a performance of the Gyoto Monks of Tibet. As the monks sung their ancient tonal sounds, she experienced a deep meditation that guided her to make a film about the art of being.


         

                                        Shraddha in the forest under the stars


The film opens in the Australian rainforest, where Shraddha can be seen in a fire heated bath. As she gazes up through the trees to the stars, she contemplates the questions which will send her and her family on a pilgrimage to the four corners of the planet.


       

                   Our community walks for peace at the start of the Iraq War 2003


INSPIRATION TO  MAKE THIS FILM

We feel that there is more to life than war, consumerism and greed. Happiness comes by living a simple life, connected to family, nature and Spirit.

This inspired us to document and reveal to others that there are choices in how we live our lives and how we walk on this planet, interconnected to all living things.


Gathering of many elders from around the world, celebrating "The New Dawn"          at the end of the Mayan Calendar 2012, Byron Bay, Australia


We want to honour the different wisdom keepers on the planet, the masters and elders that we have met along the way. We have made a commitment to share their ancient teachings to promote peace on earth.


       

       World Peace and Prayer Day with Chief Arvol Looking Horse, Lakotah 2003


WHY THIS FILM IS IMPORTANT 

We are making this film because of a deep concern for our future generations. We want to see that our children have their birth-right, to live on a planet that has clean water, fresh air and the freedom for all of us to be happy human beings.


             

     Celebration of life: Mahto at his naming ceremony with Shraddha and Gito 1997


This film is our story of an alternative approach to life. We hope to inspire other people to find their own way to happiness and inner peace by living in harmony with mother nature.


WE ARE READY TO COMPLETE THE FILM

We have filmed for over two decades and there is only so much we can do on our own. This film has an immense potential to be seen around the world. With professional help in editing, sound, music, marketing and distribution, this dynamic team will bring the film to completion. 

MUSIC                                                                                                                                               Music is a big part of this film, with a score composed by local and international musicians, using a mix of traditional and modern instruments, including live location recordings. Sound engineering will be done in a studio with a musical director to produce the original sound track for the film.

EDITING                                                                                                                                        Editing is an enormous job, with footage gathered over a long period and hundreds of hours of tape, shot on different cameras. Over the years we filmed in different formats. Editing will include transfering this material to digital format.

DISTRIBUTION                                                                                                                                We wish for as many people as possible to see this film. We are looking to cover the costs to  apply for international film festivals and alternative cinemas, as well as marketing, advertising and distribution of this documentary world wide. Travel expenses will include introduction of the film as guest speakers at screenings and further promotion. 

 POST- PRODUCTION OF FILM                                                                                            Script, Sound Effects, Music, Narration, Equipment, Editing, Publication, Distribution, Promotion

- Team Fees: Director, Producer, Editor, Musicians

- Post-production including Editing, Sound Mix and Colour Grading

- Mastering a Digital Cinema Package

- DVD Production

- PR & Media Release

- Online Marketing 

- Advertising

- Opening Event – World Premiere 

- Multi-city Theatrical Release

- Distribution


A CALL TO ACTION & SHARING

The more funds we raise, the further we can promote this important film and influence conscious change for a peaceful planet. 

´Eye See´     Acrylic on  canvas, by Gito von Schlippe

You can win this Original Art work of Gito by sharing and donating  to our Campaign with your friends and family.

Help us to send out the message and support the making of this film for              world peace and awareness for our environment.


FOREST EXPERIENCE 

Receive for your generous "forest experience" donation.

We invite you to come and share the lifestyle of the family in the rainforest.  You will spend an memorable week up high in the mountains with us, among ancient trees and giant waterfalls. Experience the "Aqua Dome", above a spring fed pool with underground warm water caves, Enjoy the silence of the bush and the sounds of nature, sleeping in a comfortable guest cottage set apart from the main house,  This unique sanctuary was built for meditation, yoga, singing, massage and guests.


Created and designed by Gito with the help of dome master Steve Areen www.steveareen.com/domehome






Shraddha Star - Director/Cinematographer

Shraddha has been travelling and filming around the world, working on a major documentary film project called ”The Art of Being”, as well as producing other various documentaries related to spirituality and the environment. 

Based in the beautiful Australian rainforest, she runs a film production studio in    Mt Nardi, living with her husband Gito and their three children, holds a Diploma in Performing Arts and worked as an actress based in Sydney in the Film, Television and Theatre industry and also performed in India, Japan and USA. She studied at Australian Film Television & Radio School - research development, sound production, camera and editing.

http://www.theartofbeing-themovie.com


Gito von Schlippe - Artist, Filmmaker, Photographer and Writer

Gito is a spirited being. He lives deep in the Australian rainforest with Shraddha and  family where he designed and hand-built their house and art studio. Created from rocks and timber, this sanctuary blends into the natural mountain environment. His unique lifestyle has been documented by German TV who filmed him and his family at their home on several occasions. These documentaries were screened throughout Europe on prime TV.

The artwork of Gito von Schlippe has been exhibited in Europe, USA and Australia for more than 25 years, he holds an Advanced Diploma of Fine Arts. During that time he has made several environmental and spiritual documentaries and written a book about his life, titled: "'Auf Umwegen".

https://www.etsy.com/au/shop/GitoArtGallery


Thomas Mai - Producer

Hi, I'm Thomas from Denmark but I live in Australia with my amazing wife and daughter . I have worked in the film business for the last 20 years as a producer, sales agent and now crowdfunding pioneer.

I have sold over hundreds of feature films to distributors around the world ranging from the smallest independent films to bigger films with Hollywood stars. I run workshops and seminars to help filmmakers understand the new digital rules.

Created Smart Film Income to have a place where filmmakers can learn and share their stories and run Industry seminars  on Social media,                             Crowdfunded and Distributed  over 80 International Film Events.  

http://smartfilmincome.com


Tarshito - Musical Director

Tarshito is a  seasoned performer and composer, originally from South Africa, has released many albums of his own and produced several others, as well as playing and recording his music for theatre, TV and cinema.

He moved to Australia and built his own solar powered recording studio  and recorded with  local and international musicians. He composed and recorded soundtracks for the healing arts. His music has been released on many international compilation albums and won a number of NCMI and Dolphin Awards.

He recorded and produced  “River of Love” by Bunna Laurie, released on the International  Green Peace Album, composed and produced the music for the film, “Whale Dreamers”  shown on ABC TV, released internationally, winner of the best music and song at the Tahoe film festival 2008.

http://www.tarshito.net


Triny Roe - Production Assistant

Triny has been making films  and writing since the 1980s. A Bachelor of Agricultural Science was followed by studies in journalism where she discovered a talent for film and video production. This became her career and life path. 

She produced videos for teaching, research and promotion for the University of Queensland. Triny also made several short films which were screened at festivals including the Brisbane International Film Festival. She also scripted  2 episodes of a TV serial drama" Breakers". She coordinated and curated three short film festivals as part of the biennial Brisbane Festival Fringe Inc.

https://au.linkedin.com/in/triny-roe



Vasumi Zjikaa  - Production Assistant

With solid networking skills, Vasumi has held major organisational roles in festivals, gatherings and events worldwide. These included the Joy Festival, Sacred Art Theatre, Rainbow Gatherings and has Prayer-formed and shared teachings at many events worldwide including Bali Spirit Festival, Geneva Yoga Festival, Rainbow Serpent Festival, Voices of the Sacred Earth and many others. She is passionate about projects which reflect the connection to the earth and the universal understanding of love and peace.

Vasumi worked as PA on Whale Dreamers, which received major awards at International Film Festivals and was screened on ABC TV, Australia.

Her lifes work has been travelling and teaching the Mayan Calendar. She worked alongside and learnt from José Arguelles.  Vasumi also creates 13 Moon Journals based on the Mayan Dreamspell Calender. 

www.lovevasumi.wix.com/dreamspelltheatrewww.timewaves.org

story:
JUMP what?

A fledgling Private Investigator wants to get to the bottom of a man's mysterious association with crimes taking place in Los Angeles.  After tracking him down, the criminal turned 'Jumper' negotiates with her instead. Or is she talking to herself? 

Oh, JUMP this.

What makes JUMP unique is that we are using artists from multiple genres of story telling from cartoonist/graphic novelist to voice over actors and filmmakers, and shooting a low budget film with high quality gear (Thanks to Drew!) in locations downtown in LA. The goal is to create high quality content with a female protagonist who's uniquely comedic -- ABSURDIST - voice challenges YOUR perspective on how to face your fears in life.

Wait, JUMP who?

Celine Nyanga: (writer) is a playwright, writer and translator originally from Paris, France. She has written poetry, short stories and screenplays both in French and in English. After graduating from film school in Paris, where she wrote and directed a short film and a documentary, she worked on several feature films as an assistant director in France. Céline settled in Los Angeles a few years ago, where she wrote and directed the award-winning play Uterine Affairs, which premiered at the Hollywood Fringe Festival in June 2016.

Monica Gozalbo: (writer) is a writer and producer based in Los Angeles. She has worked in the advertising and corporate film sector both in her native Spain and in the US, and has participated as a director, writer and producer in independent productions for film and theater (including the award-winning play Uterine Affairs, premiered at the Hollywood Fringe 2016). Mónica has published several books and articles as a translator and writer, and holds a PhD in Film Studies.

Lisa Cordileone (actor/producer), Frankie Ingrassia (director), Drew Ganyer (director of photography)  Alex Goens (sound), Glenn Stanton (man/jumper), Michael St. Michaels (angry driver), Paige Braddock (cartoonist)

A Note from the Writer: 

The story is not about suicide, it's about living life to the fullest without fear. It's almost the reverse of suicide, it's a jump to life. The man is not afraid of dying, and thus, not afraid to live. He makes her confront her fears to liberate her. She is not afraid of heights anymore after her encounter with the man. She was able to get rid of all the rationality and narcissism she had at the beginning to finally be truthful even with her own feelings, and ready to take a leap into the unknown.

But, JUMP why?

If we are able to meet our goal with YOUR SUPPORT we will be able to tell a story that may just provoke YOU to take a deeper look inside and see how willing you are to let go of fear. Would you JUMP? Join us in telling this story and maybe you'll have a new perspective on how to answer that question.

And, JUMP where?

100% of funds go directly toward paying for: 

SAG-AFTRA Day Rates/Meals/P&H - $498.75

CREW Day Rates/Gear - $650

Location - $250

Los Angeles Film Permit - $660

Insurance - $200

Post Production (partially donated) - $500

Indiegogo Fees - $100

What do I get if I JUMP?

Besides our undying LOVE and GRATITUDE, you'll receive social media shoutouts, listing in the credits and on stage personal thank you's if accepted for Film Festival screenings.  Free tickets to screenings, (check for locations, dates/times) IMDB credit and hanging out with our team! 

Yes, so...JUMP when?

NOW! Use #jumponit and let's get this campaign up and running! 

Can't donate? NO WORRIES! Best thing we can do is spread the word, tell a friend, share the links, come cheer us on at film festivals (fingers crossed) and let us thank you for making it all possible!!

STAY TUNED for updates throughout the course of our campaign!
story_txt:
JUMP what?
A fledgling Private Investigator wants to get to the bottom of a man's mysterious association with crimes taking place in Los Angeles.  After tracking him down, the criminal turned 'Jumper' negotiates with her instead. Or is she talking to herself? 
Oh, JUMP this. 
What makes JUMP unique is that we are using artists from multiple genres of story telling from cartoonist/graphic novelist to voice over actors and filmmakers, and shooting a low budget film with high quality gear (Thanks to Drew!) in locations downtown in LA. The goal is to create high quality content with a female protagonist who's uniquely comedic -- ABSURDIST - voice challenges YOUR perspective on how to face your fears in life.
Wait, JUMP who?
Celine Nyanga: (writer) is a playwright, writer and translator originally from Paris, France. She has written poetry, short stories and screenplays both in French and in English. After graduating from film school in Paris, where she wrote and directed a short film and a documentary, she worked on several feature films as an assistant director in France. Céline settled in Los Angeles a few years ago, where she wrote and directed the award-winning play Uterine Affairs, which premiered at the Hollywood Fringe Festival in June 2016.
Monica Gozalbo: (writer) is a writer and producer based in Los Angeles. She has worked in the advertising and corporate film sector both in her native Spain and in the US, and has participated as a director, writer and producer in independent productions for film and theater (including the award-winning play Uterine Affairs, premiered at the Hollywood Fringe 2016). Mónica has published several books and articles as a translator and writer, and holds a PhD in Film Studies.
Lisa Cordileone (actor/producer), Frankie Ingrassia (director), Drew Ganyer (director of photography)  Alex Goens (sound), Glenn Stanton (man/jumper), Michael St. Michaels (angry driver), Paige Braddock (cartoonist)
A Note from the Writer: 
The story is not about suicide, it's about living life to the fullest without fear. It's almost the reverse of suicide, it's a jump to life. The man is not afraid of dying, and thus, not afraid to live. He makes her confront her fears to liberate her. She is not afraid of heights anymore after her encounter with the man. She was able to get rid of all the rationality and narcissism she had at the beginning to finally be truthful even with her own feelings, and ready to take a leap into the unknown.
But, JUMP why?
If we are able to meet our goal with YOUR SUPPORT we will be able to tell a story that may just provoke YOU to take a deeper look inside and see how willing you are to let go of fear. Would you JUMP? Join us in telling this story and maybe you'll have a new perspective on how to answer that question.
And, JUMP where?

100% of funds go directly toward paying for: 
SAG-AFTRA Day Rates/Meals/P&H - $498.75
CREW Day Rates/Gear - $650
Location - $250
Los Angeles Film Permit - $660
Insurance - $200
Post Production (partially donated) - $500
Indiegogo Fees - $100
What do I get if I JUMP?
Besides our undying LOVE and GRATITUDE, you'll receive social media shoutouts, listing in the credits and on stage personal thank you's if accepted for Film Festival screenings.  Free tickets to screenings, (check for locations, dates/times) IMDB credit and hanging out with our team! 
Yes, so...JUMP when?
NOW! Use #jumponit and let's get this campaign up and running! 
Can't donate? NO WORRIES! Best thing we can do is spread the word, tell a friend, share the links, come cheer us on at film festivals (fingers crossed) and let us thank you for making it all possible!!
STAY TUNED for updates throughout the course of our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Garry Anthony Fraser, I'm a BAFTA award winning filmmaker and social entrepreneur that focuses on issues in Scottish society that most people shy away from.  I focus on deprived council schemes and the young people who live in them. I can get through to the most hard to reach in our society,  but I need your help.  Really.  

Wideo Media, a social enterprise I set up in 2012,  aims to harness creativity in youths who are otherwise marginalised in society and empower them through the art of filmmaking. 
It's really important for me to help create stepping stones for socially excluded young people throughout Scotland  I found my own path out of the margins, and now I want to leave a ladder for others to climb. 
Inner City Arts (ICA) intervention projects are a proven catalyst and real game-changer for the life's of the most vulnerable young people in society. They also benefit community safety, and increase life-chances. 
Edinburgh University Social Work & Political Science Dept will carry out evaluation of this project, our fourth so far. This will give us a social return of investment to help our case for future sustainability.
We will work with 11 young people who are all in need of intervention & support right NOW!!!  And we need your help. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need £15k funding to run this project. This will cover travel and subsistence  for the young people, staffing costs, camera hire, insurance, and post production marketing.   
  • Our minimum costs of making an intervention are £9,000, However, It will be under-resourced and will have a far weaker impact without appropriate funds. To make a real difference in the lives of young people we need £15,000  

Lots of people have banded together to provide some amazing rewards and perks; Irvine Welsh has donated signed books, or come & get dinner with some of the cast & crew. You can also visit our editor while he cuts the finished film - or get a character named after you.  If you have a company logo, it could appear on our closing credits.  

The Impact

What do we do?  In short..

""we get wee c***s off the schemes and into education.Nobody else does it."

This is an opportunity to intervene at a critical time in a young persons life and improve their chances.

We have run 3 projects before with next to no funding & helped over 25 young people into employment, education,training. Imagine what we could do with your help. 
  • By contributing to the campaign you are literally helping to save lives through offering an alternative to the life that some of these folk seemed destined to.      
  • This project is valuable because the issues raised effect all of us as a society. It's not a government led initiative,      
  • Once this project is completed, we will stick with the young people through their next steps to create a peer to peer support network for college education and/ or jobs.

What the press says

(links)

 

       Vice Interview 

""no excuse" for young people to avoid education, no matter what their background.".

          STV Interview

"Most of them left school without any qualifications only to plunge deeper into a life with little hope".

Education interview

"no excuse" for young people to avoid education, no matter their background.

Irvine welsh

"Garry is an astonishingly talented and driven filmmaker He’ll be both inspirational to, and inspired by, the young people he’ll be working with. I’m very excited to see their interpretation of this story"

BBC radio Interview
"Garry managed to find his path out of addiction after realising his creative talents on the HND film course at Edinburgh College in 2006. Now Garry is an internationally respected director"

Risks & Challenges

  • Our minimum costs of making an intervention are £9,000, However, It will be under-resourced and will have a far weaker impact without appropriate funds. To make a real difference in the lives of young people we need £15,000.
  
  • This is the fourth project that Wideo Media are running, we have smoothed out the whole process to ensure that the young people reap the full benefits. 

  •  Edinburgh University has agreed to carry out an evaluation of this project to work out its Social Return on Investment.  That way you will also be able to see how far your money goes in reality.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help, please just spread the word through social media and sign up to our newsletter - the more people that can become part of our movement, the better. We will make our society a better place for us all to live.

story:
DEVOUT, The Georgian Orthodox Monks, living between the mountains and sky, confirm their devotion in relative solitude. We pay homage to their lifestyle and visit these amazingly beautiful, rugged, remote monastery locations. The project is now in the critical post production phase.

We had returned to Georgia in the summer of 2014 to complete the interviews and dialogues.  The project also received a formal endorsement of the Georgian Embassy in Germany.

Upon completion, DEVOUT will reveal the lives of the monks and devotees living within the monasteries of the Khashuri and Kareli districts in the Urbnisi Eparchy. This region has the largest concentrated number of monasteries in Georgia whose original construction dates back to the 11th century.  The film travels to a cliff monastery perched 1700 meters on the side of mountain; through beautiful mountain landscapes and to the small cave which holds the bones of monks murdered in the 14th century.  We feel privileged the project has been given a blessing and access to previously unseen (undocumented) special holy sites and this film boasts the first time some of these scenes have been recorded for publication.  An assemblage of interviews with the archbishop of Urbnisi, priests, monks and devotees is combined with everyday footage that exposes the rituals of the current monastic life.  We are inspired by their unwavering devotion, love, and respect and so very excited to bring this reportage to you!

Thus far we have created this film all on our own and with the thankful support from our first Indiegogo campaign($6600.). We have collectively served our creative spirits. In the last 3 years, we have put in hours researching, planning, filming, and editing to get to where we are, and spent thousands of dollars of our own money to produce it. Our first visit to the monasteries was in the summer of 2012. Our second and third visits to film were in 2014. The project was given a blessing by Archbishop Iobi and permission for filming.  During the filming the monks supported our efforts with meals and beds and served as guides to the furthest locations.

Join us in the campaign and you will be supporting this next important phase.

Together we create the work, together we finish the work, together we offer the work to the world.

What We Need & What You Receive.


Our initial GOAL is to raise $7,000 to go towards:

-follow up interview shooting days

-post production editing,

-original music production and license fees,

-sound design and sound mixing,


Our Stretch GOAL of $8,000 will go towards:

-video color gradient adjustments and balancing,

-creation of main and end titles,

-Mastering the Digital Cinema Package(needed for theater screenings).

-DVD production

-Legal counsel**

The more we can raise, the further we can promote this beautiful and inspiring film. We sincerely hope you will find a level that meets your possibility to contribute to our film project.

Impact

The benefits of supporting this film go beyond the downloads, DVDs, names in the film, elite producer status, or any of the other unique perks we offer. You will be part of a faith-based movement working towards a deeper conscious awakening. By supporting this campaign, you are aligning with those who have faith and devote their lives to expressing their faith for us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides a financial contribution to the campaign, you can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. We never know who might be inspired to participate. Send an email to your friends, family, or co-workers. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this project happen. 

We trust you will join us. Thank you.

James Higginson

Director/Producer

*Once the film is completed and released, we will be sending out the link for digital downloads and shipping the DVD's.

* *We can still use a great deal of help from experts in the fields of event/screening organizing, etc. To lend your unique skills to this film, please let us know how you would like to help by writing us at info@avonbiehl.com.

story:
Remember the Good 'Ol Days..cozying up on the couch with a Swanson TV Dinner and watching your favorite Sci-Fi show like Star Trek, Lost in Space, etc.?

Hello There! I Am Richard Randall, Writer - Producer of NIGHT SHADOWS.  A New Motion Picture... 

 My background is in motion pictures, television and the making of commercials.  I've been involved in show business for over 25 years here in Los Angeles mostly behind the scenes on the prodution end of things.  I started out at the bottom as a production assistant, worked my way up through various jobs and companies.  Became a commercial casting studio supervisor and even directed several short films until now having reached this point of actually making a full length movie.


NIGHT SHADOWS is a bold new Science Fiction Movie.  It is actually three stories in one film.  The first story is called "Who's Out There?" It deals with the exploits of a young man who is trying to track down the source of mysterious U.F.O.sightings.  The next story is  "Space Journeys" It takes place 100 years from now in the Asteroid Belt where mining operations and space settlers fight for survival in a brutal environment as all out war is about to begin throughout the solar system.  The third story is called "Time Limits" and its about a scientist who travels back in time to the Old West where he faces the dangers of frontier life.  

Science Fiction stories is a passion of mine.  I grew up watching Star Trek, The Outer Limits, Lost In Space, Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea, The Time Tunnel and Land of the Giants.  Going to the movies to see 2001: A Space Odyssey, The Time Machine and many more.  Now I have the chance to actually make movies that I hope others will enjoy and I encourage you to be a part of this exciting experience too.  With your contributions we will be able to see our dream come alive.  It will finish what we set out to do.  To complete the post-production costs with editing, music, special effects and so on.  We need you to put the icing on the cake!


We Need Your Help!

The amount we need and are looking raise in order to finish NIGHT SHADOWS properly is $60,000.  This money will go right into the finished motion picture no middle man or studio bosses involved. To show our thanks and appreciation to you we have some wonderful NIGHT SHADOWS items that I think you will enjoy and actually remind you of what it was to be a part of something special too!  The art of Movie Making...   In the event that we do not reach our goal the money will be used to prepare a new campaign and reorganize our company for another attempt to live the dream.


With Your Help We Can Do So Much!
The Making of NIGHT SHADOWS is something you can always be proud of.  Movie making is the greatest form of art and entertainment in our entire world today.  When completed this movie will be seen by millions of people around the world and your contribution will play a vital role in making all this happen.  I have been a part of many wonderful film, television and commercials, but this is a labor of love, something I've always wanted to do and bringing others into that process is even more fun and rewarding.  I invite and encourage you to be a part of this exciting new movie making experience - to tell your family and friends to share in our dream as well. The more people who get involved the better.  It's like going to the movies in reverse, because you are a part of the whole wonderful process not just paying to see a move after it is finished.  How awesome is that?  It's like being an assistant coach in a professional basketball game in a giant arena! 


Risks & Challenges Ahead

Life has its ups and downs.  There are always going to be risks in life.  Just getting out of bed each day and going to work can be dangerious and some people say that even the things in your home can harm you too!  So it takes courage to face the problems head on.  I think that most of the problems in making a movie have already been removed in this case since I'm only looking for funds to complete this project and that means this is a low risk investment for you.  Just enjoy the special contributor gifts we have in store and be confident that you have helped make our dream come true with your contribution of funds and please tell your friends and family members to help out too if they can.  Pennies make dollars and every little bit of coin goes a long way.  Help spread the word out there because your time is of value also.  Time is money and I think that every positive effort leads to more good vibrations and creates a great action in the right direction.  That's all it takes to win. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


There's something very sinister about this car...You'll find out more in Night Shadows!

story:
Who We Are

The filmmakers:

James Thweatt-The director and screenwriter of The 89th Key is James Thweatt.  James is currently a senior filmmaking student at the University of Central Arkansas.  An LGBT activist, James focuses his filmmaking on LGBT characters and themes and The 89th Key is no exception.  A fearless and tireless storyteller advocate, James recognizes a lack of LGBT characters and themes in the rich and diverse history of international and American filmmaking industry.  He wants to provide a platform for the LGBT community and for their stories to be told in ways that don’t demean or victimize them.  Beyond his activism, James was born in Little Rock, Arkansas.  He was a professional actor and singer for over a decade which, upon retirement, he decided to pursue his other love—filmmaking.  As an actor, his film roles include, among others, My Dog Skip with Kevin Bacon and Academy Award nominee Diane Lane and The White River Kid with Antonio Banderas and Bob Hoskins.

Hunter Byrd-The producer of The 89th Key is Hunter Byrd.  Aside from wrangling alligators and hooking venomous snakes, Hunter Byrd has always had a passion for educating people about nature through what he calls "Conservation filmmaking".  Hunter has previously traveled across the globe to film the world's most endangered crocodiles. He has also helped AETN's nature show host, Chuck Dovish, with his Exploring Arkansas series and feature documentary, Bayou Bartholomew. Today, Hunter is stepping out of the swamps and hitting the stage to produce the short-film musical The 89th Key.  Afterwards, he hopes to continue his filming back in the Philippines and Borneo promoting environmental awareness and protecting our world's endangered species.

The Importance of Our Work:

Every little girl in America has been taught through fairytales, books, film, television and media in general that she deserves her prince--her knight in shining armor.   All little girls except transgendered girls.  Fairytales are an inherit part of our culture.  They play an even more important role in the imaginations and creativity of marginalized communities.  Characters portrayed in media, film, books, etc. allow marginalized individuals to fantasize and see themselves represented, sometimes for the first time.  Without continued representation in the media, there could be isolation and other negative consequences.

Since coming out at the age of 16, I have felt a deep kinship with trans-women and their severe lack of representation in the media.   The cost that is having on their lives is immeasurable and unconscionable.  Considering, that among the LGBT community, trans men and women are at the most risk for violent crime and suicide, it's easy for me to empathize, but it's also easy for me to see the impact in real and measured ways too.  So, as a filmmaker the urgency of telling stories that featured empowering transgendered characters and stories, like those in The 89th Key, are of paramount importance to me.  I hope you share my vision and my passion!

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to make this film we need a lot of dough.  It's an ambitious project and this is the breakdown of what we need and what incentives we have to offer you for your generous contribution:

  • Craft Services-We will need to feed approximately 40 people for 7 days of filming.  Starving actors and crew tend to revolt!  Total: $1,500.  
  • Costumes & Wigs-Because the film is a period film set in the 1940's, costumes and hair are specific and costumes that cannot be borrowed must be bought, rented or constructed for our very large cast.  Total: $1,500.
  • Equipment Rentals-Fortunately the majority of equipment will come from the college, however, there are specific pieces of equipment that we need to rent for 7 days in order to make the film (i.e., lenses, gimbal, etc.).  Total:  $1,000.
  • Production Costs-We will need to decorate the set, obtain props, prepare for the unexpected, etc. Total: $500.
  • Musicians-You can't make a musical without them!  Total: $1,000.
  • Post Production Costs-Festival entry fees, marketing, etc.  Total: $1,000
  • GRAND TOTAL:  $6,500
Here are some really cool things that we have put together for you for your donation!!!

COOL CAT:  $25 Donation

  • Listed in the credits as a "COOL CAT"
  • Digital copy of the music

GANGSTER/GUN MOLL:  $50 Donation

  • Listed in the credits as a "GANGSTER or GUN MOLL"
  • 2 tickets to the premiere screening
  • Digital copy of the music

SHOWGIRL:  $100 Donation

  • Listed in the credits as a "SHOWGIRL"
  • 2 tickets to the premiere screening
  • Digital copy of the music
  • Digital copy of the film
  • Signed Cast Poster

THE FAN DANCER:  $250 Donation

  • Listed in the credits as an "ASSOCIATE PRODUCER"
  • 4 tickets to the premiere screening
  • Digital copy of the music
  • Signed copy of the CD by the cast
  • Digital copy of the film
  • Signed copy of the DVD by the cast
  • Signed Cast Poster

TICKLE THE IVORIES: $500 Donation

  • Listed in the credits as "CO-EXECUTIVE PRODUCER"
  • Dinner with the Director, Producer & Principal Cast
  • 2 VIP tickets to the premiere screening
  • Digital copy of the music
  • Signed copy of the CD by the cast
  • Digital copy of the film
  • Signed copy of the DVD by the cast
  • Signed Cast Poster

THE ICE MAN: $1,000 + Donation

  • Listed in the credits as "EXECUTIVE PRODUCER"
  • Private screening for 2 of the film with the Director and Producer
  • Dinner with the Director, Producer & Members of the Principal Cast
  • 4 VIP tickets to the premiere screening
  • Digital copy of the music
  • Signed copy of the CD by the cast
  • Digital copy of the film
  • Signed copy of the DVD by the cast
  • Signed Cast Poster

The Impact

The 89th Key is a fairytale for transgendered people, specifically transgendered girls and women.  The film features a principal transgendered character who is not a victim, who is in control of her own life, who has her own sexuality yet is not exploited, who is not a stereotype, and doesn't focus on the American media's obsession with genitalia or surgery or any of the other salacious aspects of transition and is the object of love and not just sex.   This film is a musical-comedy fairytale love story for and about transgendered people but also it's designed to help start a dialogue with all people.  Beyond that it's also a fun musical-comedy!

As a contributor to the film you not only will be helping some deserving college students make a film, you'll also allow the film to be seen by many people, making it's way into festivals across the country.  To have these impactful images of transgendered people seen by as many people as possible is a huge thing.  Won't you help us achieve that goal? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about our little film is a great help to us and spreading the word about our Indiegogo campaign is also extremely helpful!  Thank you!
story_txt:
Who We Are The filmmakers:



James Thweatt-The director and screenwriter of The 89th Key is James Thweatt.  James is currently a senior filmmaking student at the University of Central Arkansas.  An LGBT activist, James focuses his filmmaking on LGBT characters and themes and The 89th Key is no exception.  A fearless and tireless storyteller advocate, James recognizes a lack of LGBT characters and themes in the rich and diverse history of international and American filmmaking industry.  He wants to provide a platform for the LGBT community and for their stories to be told in ways that don’t demean or victimize them.  Beyond his activism, James was born in Little Rock, Arkansas.  He was a professional actor and singer for over a decade which, upon retirement, he decided to pursue his other love—filmmaking.  As an actor, his film roles include, among others, My Dog Skip with Kevin Bacon and Academy Award nominee Diane Lane and The White River Kid with Antonio Banderas and Bob Hoskins.
Hunter Byrd-The producer of The 89th Key is Hunter Byrd.  Aside from wrangling alligators and hooking venomous snakes, Hunter Byrd has always had a passion for educating people about nature through what he calls "Conservation filmmaking".  Hunter has previously traveled across the globe to film the world's most endangered crocodiles. He has also helped AETN's nature show host, Chuck Dovish, with his Exploring Arkansas series and feature documentary, Bayou Bartholomew. Today, Hunter is stepping out of the swamps and hitting the stage to produce the short-film musical The 89th Key.  Afterwards, he hopes to continue his filming back in the Philippines and Borneo promoting environmental awareness and protecting our world's endangered species.

story:
Meet Bijaya. A member of the Nepalese community of Nuneaton. 'NEPS' is his story, his friends' story, his families' story. It will be the honest, unfiltered voice of Nepalese youth living in Britain. 


'NEPS'. The Youth of Nepalese Britain.   

In 1997, all Gurkha veterans with at least four years of service were granted the right to settle in Britain. With this, came a change in the cultural landscape of towns and cities across the country. This not only affected the lives of the veterans, but also their children and grandchildren, who would find themselves settling in Britain far away from home. 

'Neps', is a colloquial term used by Nepalese youth to refer to a younger subculture within Nepali-British communities. As second or third generation Gurkha's, their lives are often dominated by the influence of the British Army, fore fronted as the ultimate ambition for a lot of Nepalese young men.  

But is this a true reflection of Nepalese youth in Britain?  

The purpose of our film is to a give voice to this generation of Nepalese youth. To explore their relationship within the communities they live in and the influence of British life on their existing cultural values. It aims to challenge Nepal's military stereotypes, breaking down preconceptions about youth subculture, masculinity and ethnic diversity.        

Hamro Pusta Films was founded by filmmakers Joel Davidson and Suraj Sahi in order to explore the realities of identity and community among Nepalese youth. We are passionate about making this film a reality, and need your help to do so.

Where your money goes...

The £2000 funding target will go towards travel costs to Pokhara, Nepal for Nepalese crew members (a trip that will see many return to their hometowns and extended families). It will also contribute to film festival fees, equipment hire and a trip to meet the families of the film's key members.     

All excess funding will be donated to the 'Nepal Youth Foundation'.

  

What your money means...

Your money allows for Nepalese youth to be heard. 
Support for this film is vital for us to achieve our goal of exploring the issues and questions that are not presented to the western world regarding Nepalese culture.  
Perks
We are offering some very special and unique gifts and opportunities for everyone who donates to the project. These include limited edition copies of the film, extra digital and physical content as well as invitations to screenings, Nepalese cultural days and experiences, and much more! 
Check these out on the right hand side of this page! 

What you can do...

Any contribution to our project is greatly appreciated. If you can't donate, then that's fine too! You can support in a number of other ways: 

Share and Like our facebook page at facebook.com/nepsfilm 

or tweet us at @NepsFilm 

PLEASE BE A PART OF PROVIDING A VOICE FOR NEPALESE YOUTH.

story:
From the Filmmaker


Who We Are

The Story

90 year old War veteran Arnold Abbott was arrested November 5th, 2014 for feeding the homeless, something he has done for more than 20 years in South Florida. He faces jail time in 2015. Himself and others, including pastors from a local church, have been arrested or cited by the city more than once since November for violating a newly formed city ordinance that prohibits the feeding of homeless people on city property December 31st, a judge "suspended" the law for 45 DAYS. On February 14, 2015, the anti-feeding ordinance goes back into effect. This year on Valentine's Day, the day of love… the city will uphold its law and continue cite/arrest Arnold Abbott along with the others that continue to feed the homeless. 

"As long as there is breath left in my body I will fight it!" ~ Arnold Abbott

The Filmmaker

I have been a filmmaker for over 25 years and this travesty is happening in my own backyard. I could not sit back and just watch. I need to help the best way I know how. I picked up my camera and I'm making a DOCUMENTARY FILM to help Arnold raise awareness on a person's right to feed others who are less fortunate. It's the right thing to do. I am producing an hour long documentary film entitled, Breaking Bread. I have personally been filming Arnold’s fight since November and quickly realized after meeting him and seeing how truly heroic he is in his daily battle to feed the homeless, it is not just about Florida's homeless problem in tourist areas. Over 70 cities across America have the same anti-homeless laws. Arnold cannot do it alone! We need your help!

The Film

Our film Breaking Bread is about the Sharing & Gifting of food and how in a modern democracy it is illegal to do so because of anti-feeding laws that protect tourist areas. Our film documentary will visit other countries that Share & Gift food as part of their culture to discuss the global issue of feeding the hungry. The film will discuss the reasons for these laws, we will look at both sides, and hopefully come up with a solution that is more humane. We will visit places along the way that take care of their homeless people in innovative ways, with hopes that we can educate politicians back home to find better ways to treat homeless people here in America.

Each of you that contributes to this project will make a difference in spreading awareness of this local, national and global issue. We will premiere this film in all 70 cities in some way, shape or form with each of you and your local organizations, meet-ups and with community leaders who can make a difference in their part of the world. We want the politicians creating these anti-feeding laws to see how truly ridiculous it is that a person can be arrested for feeding another human being. 

We will tour the film festival circuit, nationally and internationally to gain momentum about Arnold's fight against anti-feeding laws. Our goal is to have the film distributed for the world to see through all media platforms available. With your help this film will be made and people less fortunate then us will have a hot meal, anywhere someone wants to feed them. 

We will make a difference with the making of the film BREAKING BREAD this year! 


What We Need

Our goal is set at $25,000… this is what we need to begin to tell the story about the humanity of Sharing & Gifting of food. We will follow Arnold’s story as we have been since November, through his upcoming legal battle on February 14, 2015 and as he travels to over 70 cities across America to raise awareness on anti-feeding laws.  

Once the film is finished, 10% of any distribution of the film will go to Arnold's legal fees and/or his foundation to continue his fight.

We will finish the film by July 4th, 2015.


What You Get

PERKS

This film is about the Sharing & Gifting of food, our perks are too! We encourage you to contribute and for your participation you will receive a gift of food from PANERA BREAD as a show of our appreciation. We ask though you take this gift a step further and challenge yourself to ask for it "To-Go" and Share it with someone that needs a meal more than yourself. During this campaign we will announce where these perks will be coming from... we are working on that now! The PERKS will be distributed with a digital coupon.

We challenge all of you to make a difference in your communities to share & gift food, like 91 year old Arnold Abbott does every day. 

We are all Arnold Abbott! 

We can change the world, each one of us, one meal at a time.

Film Credit

Each contributor will see his/her name recognized in this film. At the end credits, we will have INDIEGOGO CONTRIBUTORS honoring all of you that believe in Arnold Abbott's social movement against anti-homeless laws in their communities. It will be a symbolic gesture to abolish these terrible laws that arrest people for feeding people with hunger.

See your name on the big screen, it's A VISUAL PETITION! 

MOVIE POSTER

Each contributor will have his/her name ON THE MOVIE POSTER! YES! You will receive a digital copy too! You are making this movie possible, your name will be on the poster! This is our way of honoring you for your contribution!! Also, the names of all the homeless people I meet, the people I meet helping the homeless, will be on the poster as well.

See your name on a movie poster!

Here is a cut out sample of the poster with your names embedded in the background image. You help us make a difference, your name will be on the poster for the world to see.


How YOU Are Making A Difference

•This project is valuable to you, your friends and family because it reminds us who we are as human beings to Share & Gift food to someone in need. Not just one person, this can reach 1000's that need a meal, locally, nationally and globally!

•This also does something else, we are not only creating a film, we are also Creating A Social Movement Against Anti-Homeless Laws! 

Let us make history by changing the laws in the America, starting with Arnold Abbott in South Florida and your community at home!


Other Ways You Can Help

"I cannot contribute now."   WRONG! YOU CAN!

Here is how! All of you are contributors!

•There are share icons at the top under our video, share this with everyone on all your social networks! Encourage your friends and family by taking a moment to share each link on Facebook, Twitter, eMail, how ever you prefer. Just share it. Share it daily on all platforms of social media! 

Also, use our two hashtags (#breakbreadfilm #arnoldabbott) on your social media and spread the awareness of this campaign!! 

#breakbreadfilm #arnoldabbott 

If you find just one person to contribute, that will make a difference to someone in need by helping us raise awareness to get these laws changed and to feed the hungry. Imagine if you found 10 people!

That is all there is to it!   Thank you!

Also connect with me at:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/KIRKGILLON

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kirkgillon

Instagram: http://instagram.com/kirkgillonfilmdirector

IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4346770


Media Attention

Just Google!  "Arnold Abbott arrested for feeding homeless"

story:
The Film

After losing his mother to obesity, a thirty-two year old chubby ginger comedian and vegan son-of-a-pig-farmer sets out to avoid the same fate by running one hundred miles through the mountains of Colorado in one of the world's most unforgiving ultra trail marathons...and lives to tell jokes about it.

  • Part documentary and part stand-up comedy special, Once Is Enough is an inspiring hybrid documentary composed of two components.  The first component is a documentary film following Jeffrey, in the wake of his mother's death, losing over one hundred pounds and attempting to run one of the world's most difficult one hundred mile ultra marathons.  The second component is a stand-up comedy special about the entire experience.  The final film with be a seamless juxtaposition of both components that will have the audience in tears one minute and rolling in the aisles the next.  
  • Jeffrey James Binney is a Los Angeles based actor/comedian who has been seen on Late Night With David Letterman, in the 1st National Tour and Chicago Company of the Broadway musical The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee, and at comedy clubs and festivals across the country. 
  • Jeffrey's trainer, Ian Sharman, has been racing around the world in all styles of events since 2005 and coaching since 2010, having run around 200 ultras and marathons in every type of weather and on all terrains. He's won almost 50 multi-day races, road marathons, trail ultras and adventure races with experience of running in many mountain ranges, including the Himalayas, Andes, Rockies and European Alps. He also holds the fastest time in a trail 100-mile race in the US (12h44m), the record for the Grand Slam of Ultrarunning (69h49m) and is the 2013 Leadville Trail 100 Champion.

What We Need

What's more expensive than making a movie?  Making a movie that requires taking an entire film crew into some of the most remote wilderness locations to film a chubby ginger running 100 miles through the forest.  Enough of the touchy feel stuff...here's what need...

  • Grand Canyon Rim to Rim to Rim Training Run ($11,000) - We'll be taking our film crew into the Grand Canyon to follow Jeffrey attempt the forty-five mile run down into the Grand Canyon, up the other side, and back again.
  • Leadville 100 ($22,000) - We'll be taking Jeffrey's running crew and film crew to Leadville, CO for a week to film his attempt at the Leadville 100.  The logistics of getting this many people and our equipment onto these mountain trails to film someone constantly moving for thirty hours, sometimes in the dark, through some of the roughest terrain in North America are mind-boggling...not to mention expensive. 
  • Comedy Special Live Taping ($16,000) - We'll be taking our film crew to Kansas City to film Jeffrey's one-hour comedy special about the experience.  Although it's still costly, we're filming in Kansas City to help reduce the cost.
  • Post-Production ($30,000) - Many people don't realize that the most time-consuming and expensive part of the film making process is what happens after everything has been shot.  Editors...sound...color correction..this is the stuff that can make or break a project like this.  
  • Equipment ($9,000) - External hard drives, software, at least six pair of running shoes, headlamps,....the list is endless. 
  • PR, Marketing, Advertising, Festival Fees ($19,000) - Once we have the finished product we want to make sure we have the resources to get it out there so people can see it!  Our team feels confident we can do the job with $19,000.

The Leadville 100

The race where legends are created and limits are tested.  One hundred miles of extreme Colorado Rockies terrain - from elevations of 9,200 to 12,600 feet.  100 continuous miles of unrelenting trail that must be completed in 30 hours. The Leadville 100 is one of the world's oldest and toughest ultra marathons.

In most years fewer than half the starters complete the race.  Dehydration, muscle spasms & sodium imbalance are just a few of the ways a runner can find himself on the side of the trail unable to finish. 

Risks & Challenges

The are a number of risks and challenges with taking on a project with so many physical and logistical challenges.  Our team has put together an incredible plan of action to ensure everything goes as smoothly as possible.  Here are a few of our biggest challenges...

  • Finishing Successfully - Jeffrey is training with one of the world's greatest endurance athletes and so far he has been successful in all of his runs.  However, it's possible he won't finish.  No matter how prepared Jeffrey is physically and mentally there are things out of his control that could go wrong.  Hypoglycemia, hyponatremia,  broken bones, sprained ankles, hypothermia...just to name a few.  While Jeffrey's trainer and medical team will be monitoring him closely throughout the process, it's important to note that the film does not hinge on Jeffrey finishing the race.  While finishing is the goal and highly likely, we will still have an incredibly inspiring story to tell whether he is successful in his attempt for not. 
  • Crew Safety - When watching the film of Jeffrey running 100 miles it will be easy to forget that capturing Jeffrey's run will require film crew to run with him while carrying cameras.  
  • Elements - We'll be filming outdoors in some of the most rugged and unpredictable conditions.  We're ready for everything from lightening to frost-bite...but we'd be lying if we said this wasn't at the forefront of our minds.

Our Goal

Our goal is to inspire millions across the globe to use the time they have on this planet to do something incredible.  Jeffrey's "something incredible" is taking charge of his health and pushing himself physically and mentally further than he has ever gone by running 100 miles.  But what's YOUR "something incredible?"  This project's goal is to inspire you to find your incredible! 

#FindYourIncredible

Each time you use the hashtag #FindYourIncredible when posting about goals you're working toward during our IndieGoGo campaign you'll receive an entry into a drawing for a $250 REI Gift Card!

Share!

Can't contribute to the project?  That's ok!  The fastest and free-est way to help the project is by sharing our video and campaign! Share it on your FB wall, tweet it, send it to your friend who just ran their first 5k...we can't emphasize enough how incredibly helpful it is when people share our story!

Follow us on Instagram and Twitter 

@JeffreyBinney

or find us on the web at 

www.OnceIsEnoughFilm.com

story:
The Journey Home

With big dreams for a feature film and a small budget, often times a collaborative effort is necessary to make the film a reality. An environment where everyone pulls together their expertise to make one fully functioning machine of talent is the best way to make your dreams come true. It just so happens this film has all the components to be the perfect place for collaboration. I have joined together with the greatest film family and we have an amazing storyline. Now we need the capital to move forward with our dream. As the creator I am relying on the fans to make this film possible.

Do you ever think about how a film begins, where the ideas come from?

Do you love films with bigger meanings, which change the lives of viewers forever?

Are you interested in film and movies but don’t know how to get involved?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

Our popular culture reinforces the idea that films are is expensive and difficult to create. We're out to change that fallacious idea with our new feature film: “The Journey Home”! “The Journey Home” gives viewers an inside look at young, fiercely independent young woman who is an avid horsewoman, defying her conservative father only to have a near-death accident that leaves her in a coma.

During the coma, the young woman revisits the scene of the accident. When the young woman finally wakes up from her coma, she has to fight to reclaim her life and her independence, which she reclaims against huge odds and the fear with which the accident left her. Help us establish a film to serve people in need of seeing this story come to life. As little as $1 gets your name listed in the credits of the film, your name will be forever honored as a contributor. Seeing and being part of this film will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!"

More about the Project

The story of “The Journey Home” is one that will resonate with most people who are trying to find strength in a tough place. The storyline teaches us, as only a few stories can, about the essential wisdom of pushing through when times get tough, learning to fight against all odds. “The Journey Home” will bring so many positive messages to people:

  • Learn about life’s inevitable obstacles
  • How to persevere with grit and courage
  • Entertain through universal lessons

When reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a film that needs to be created. We feel these features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed. This paired with attention to detail and quality filmmaking will send this project to the top of its genre. Our mission is to create the best film and viewing experience for all fans and enthusiast alike!

Our company is passionate with creating a film for humanity, this film is meant to bring awareness and hope to people going through tough times. Film has been a tried and true way to bring an issue to the masses. Films also provide a sense of understanding that not many other media outlets can do. Our goal is to stay dedicated to our mission of perseverance and courage because we know our society will benefit greatly! We have developed a unique method script, actors and location that is second to none. Help us make this film a reality and let’s start spreading the word today!

For us to bring “The Journey Home” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to start production. It will assist us with the cost of filming, crew wages and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first to see “The Journey Home”. We will also use our funding try and extend our audience through the Internet and film festivals.

We will also be using the funding to expand the possibilities for the usage for international distribution, to further work on and edit the first version of “The Journey Home” and create additional films that will compliment “The Journey Home”.

“The Journey Home” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about US$20,000 in order to break “The Journey Home” onto the market. That will includes marketing, supplies, labor and related expenses for start-up.

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word. We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters. Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed. We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve. You are part of our “The Journey Home” film family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

If you wish to contact us:

Website: watch this space!

Our Social Media Connections:

  • Instagram: sonya612
  • Twitter: sonya612
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheJourneyHomeFilm?ref=hl
  • YouTube: watch this space!

Contact Information

  • Name: Sonya Shaykhoun; Wally Shaykhoun
  • Phone Number: +974 33 07 61 11 (Sonya in Qatar), +1 917 (Wally in NYC).
  • E Mail: shaykhoun@gmail.com (Sonya); wallyshaykhoun@me.com (Wally)

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at shaykhoun@gmail.com and/or wallyshaykhoun@me.com
