story:
Parti d’un concept d’une saison unique, «À dos de talents» est devenu un concept d’échelle provinciale au Québec qui vise à promouvoir les talents émergents et la relève artistique de chaque région. Elle est destinée à un public cible de 15 à 25 ans ainsi qu’à tous les intervenants du domaine artistique, à l'entourage proche ou éloigné des participants ainsi qu'à tous les amateurs de musique, art ou télévision et websérie.

Le principe de l’émission est simple. Il s’agit de présenter des jeunes artistes, de parler de leur cheminement artistique et de promouvoir leur musique ou leur art. Ces artistes seront des jeunes artistes et des amateurs dans le domaine. Chacun des épisodes de la saison sera axé sur un jeune artiste (musique, art dramatique, arts visuels et autres). Tous les artistes auront un style différent afin de démonter la diversité présente dans le domaine des arts. Ils présenteront néanmoins leurs propres compositions afin de proposer du nouveau matériel aux auditeurs, en français, car cela est un des buts de l’émission . Les participants seront interviewés par un(e) animateur(trice) afin de connaitre des informations importantes telles que leurs inspirations, leurs motivations, leurs spectacles et autres. L’animateur(trice) sera également un(e) amateur(e) et devra animer l’émission selon un scénario préétabli.


 À chaque épisode, de jeunes artistes se présentent au public. Un talent caché en eux en fait leur renommée et ils se livrent aux caméras pour le dévoiler. Que ce soit en musique, en chant, en théâtre, chaque talent vaut la peine d’être vu, écouté et ressenti. Les artistes seront interviewés, échangeront ensemble et découvriront de nouveaux horizons. De plus, ils présenteront leurs propres compositions sur le plateau. «À dos de talents» est une émission qui met en valeur les jeunes, leurs talents et laisse place à la créativité... «À dos de talents», tout simplement inspirant!



La saison 3 sera composée de 14 épisodes.
Chacun des 14 épisodes aura durée d'environ 30 minutes. L'épisode de clôture de la saison 3 regroupera tous les artistes dans un même et unique épisode.

À dos de talents» est une émission faite pour des jeunes. L'émission vise à promouvoir la relève artistique et faire connaître des talents. Ainsi, l'émission vise à atteindre les buts et intentions suivants : 

1) Promouvoir et faire découvrir des talents émergents

2) Aider à la diffusion (sensibiliser la population) 

3) Permettre le développement d’une équipe de production 

4) Ouvrir un réseau d’artistes 

5) Promouvoir l’importance de la langue française 

C’est sur ces cinq principaux points que l’émission «À dos de talents» a vu le jour. Sur deux saisons particulièrement réussies, l’émission a réussi à prouver que ces fondements faisaient la différence et surtout, qu’il était très payant de les intégrer au concept.  Des exemples de réussite et d’atteinte des objectifs seraient les artistes comme Simon Lacas (saison 1, Étoile montante Ford 2013) Thomas Argouin (saison 1, 2ème place de la finale nationale de Cégep en Spectacle en 2013), Émile Bilodeau (saison 2, 2e place de la finale nationale de Cégep en Spectacle en 2014), Douce Sévigny (saison 2), Alexandre Légaré (saison 1/2), Les Passagers (saison 2).


Au fil de ses deux premières saisons, l’équipe de production de l’émission a remarqué qu’un certain manque de présence sur le web se faisait sentir. Ainsi, l’équipe a développé une stratégie web qui va permettre à l’émission de passer à un stade supérieur lors de sa diffusion. Cette stratégie vise principalement à développer le contenu relatif aux artistes participants ainsi que d’augmenter la réactivité des membres de la communauté en leur offrant des outils spécialisés à leur visionnement web et finalement augmenter la présence sur le web. Voici les trois (3) points majeurs de cette stratégie web : 

1) Page web indépendante

«À dos de talents» s’est muni d’une page web indépendante de sa maison de production. Cette page web va permettre de placer plus de contenu pour les internautes puisque l’espace sera beaucoup plus vaste et libre. Cette page va permettre une fidélisation du public face au nouveau contenu exclusif qu’elle contiendra. 

2) Web TV

Malgré les diffusions télévisuelles de l’émission, le concept initial de l’émission est tout de même la diffusion web, afin de touchant le plus vaste public possible sur le plus de territoire possible (autant québécois, canadien qu’international). Cette Web TV va permettre la diffusion de contenu supplémentaire pour les auditeurs et surtout du contenu exclusif. 

3) Réseaux sociaux

Les réseaux sociaux permettent de cibler les auditeurs directement dans leur monde et également de faire parler de l’émission. Dans cette stratégie, les réseaux sociaux viendront promouvoir la programmation de la Web TV et du contenu exclusif dédié aux internautes sur la page web de l’émission. 


 Le budget global de la saison 3 est chiffré à 77 510$. Tout ce budget englobe l'entièreté de la production (de la pré production à la diffusion). Couvrant la location du matériel de tournage, le transport du matériel et les ressources nécessaires (humaines et matérielles), ce montant est le budget minimum pour une réalisation dans de bonnes conditions. 
Dates importantes
24 mars 2015* : Conférence de presse
28, 29, 30, 31 mai 2015: Tournage de la saison Alma
6 septembre 2015*: Lancement de la saison 3
16 janvier 2016* : Spectacle de clôture de la saison 3
*Dates sujettes à changement.
Pour voir tous les événements de la production : http://adosdetalents.tv/evenements

 «À dos de talents»  a été nominé à plusieurs prestigieux galas de renommée régionale et nationale, et l'émission continue d'être nominée! 

Gala Forces AVENIR (2013) : Lauréat AVENIR Projet par excellence (Saison 1)

Gala Florilège (2013) : Finaliste catégorie Initiative Jeunesse (Saison 2)

Concours québécois en entrepreneuriat 2014: Lauréat Régional (Montérégie) et Finaliste National (saison 2)

Swiss Web Program Festival (Montreux, Suisse) : Prix du PublicCatégorie «Culture et divertissement» (Saison 2)


Producteur et réalisateur: Robin Degotte 
Assistante à la producteur: Katherine Couillard 
Directrice artistique: Katty Noben
Régisseur de plateau:  Frédéric Degotte 
Chef Son : Charles Desrochers

Voici un lien vers la première épisode de la deuxième saison! Pour revoir la saison 2 :  http://adosdetalents.tv/addt-tv


VOUS pouvez nous aider à réaliser ce concept "une saison, une région" à travers le Québec et ainsi démontrer la diversité de notre jeunesse. Nous avons besoin de VOUS!

RproductionsD, département production vidéo

Téléphone: +1 (450) 916-4277

Courriel du producteur : robin.d@rproductionsd.com

Courriel de production : production@adosdetalents.tv

Site internet : www.adosdetalents.tv

©. Tous droits réservés. RproductionsD. 2015.
story_txt:
Parti d’un concept d’une saison unique, «À dos de talents» est devenu un concept d’échelle provinciale au Québec qui vise à promouvoir les talents émergents et la relève artistique de chaque région. Elle est destinée à un public cible de 15 à 25 ans ainsi qu’à tous les intervenants du domaine artistique, à
l'entourage proche ou éloigné des participants ainsi qu'à tous les amateurs de musique, art ou télévision et
websérie.

Le principe de l’émission est simple. Il s’agit de présenter des jeunes artistes, de parler de leur cheminement artistique et de promouvoir leur musique ou leur art. Ces artistes seront des jeunes artistes et des amateurs dans le domaine. Chacun des épisodes de la saison sera axé sur un jeune artiste (musique, art dramatique, arts visuels et autres). Tous les artistes auront un style différent afin de démonter la diversité présente dans le domaine des arts. Ils présenteront néanmoins leurs propres compositions afin de proposer du nouveau matériel aux auditeurs, en français, car cela est un des buts de l’émission . Les participants seront interviewés par un(e) animateur(trice) afin de connaitre des informations importantes telles que leurs inspirations, leurs motivations, leurs spectacles et autres. L’animateur(trice) sera également un(e) amateur(e) et devra animer l’émission selon un scénario préétabli.



 À chaque épisode, de jeunes artistes se présentent au public. Un talent caché en eux en fait leur
renommée et ils se livrent aux caméras pour le dévoiler. Que ce soit en musique, en chant, en théâtre, chaque
talent vaut la peine d’être vu, écouté et ressenti. Les artistes seront interviewés, échangeront ensemble et
découvriront de nouveaux horizons. De plus, ils présenteront leurs propres compositions sur le plateau. «À
dos de talents» est une émission qui met en valeur les jeunes, leurs talents et laisse place à la créativité... «À dos de talents», tout simplement inspirant!







La saison 3 sera composée de 14 épisodes.Chacun des 14 épisodes aura durée d'environ 30 minutes. L'épisode de clôture de la saison 3 regroupera tous les artistes dans un même et unique épisode.




À dos de talents» est une émission faite pour des jeunes. L'émission vise à promouvoir la relève
artistique et faire connaître des talents. Ainsi, l'émission vise à atteindre les buts et intentions suivants : 



1) Promouvoir et faire découvrir des talents émergents






2) Aider à la diffusion (sensibiliser la population) 






3) Permettre le développement d’une équipe de production 






4) Ouvrir un réseau d’artistes 






5) Promouvoir l’importance de la langue française 












C’est sur ces cinq principaux points que l’émission «À dos de talents» a vu le jour. Sur deux saisons
particulièrement réussies, l’émission a réussi à prouver que ces fondements faisaient la différence et surtout, qu’il
était très payant de les intégrer au concept.  Des exemples de réussite et d’atteinte des objectifs seraient les artistes comme Simon Lacas (saison 1, Étoile montante Ford 2013) Thomas Argouin (saison 1, 2ème place de la finale nationale de Cégep en Spectacle en 2013), Émile Bilodeau (saison 2, 2e place de la finale nationale de Cégep en Spectacle en 2014), Douce Sévigny (saison 2), Alexandre Légaré (saison 1/2), Les Passagers (saison 2).









Au fil de ses deux premières saisons, l’équipe de production de l’émission a remarqué qu’un certain
manque de présence sur le web se faisait sentir. Ainsi, l’équipe a développé une stratégie web qui va
permettre à l’émission de passer à un stade supérieur lors de sa diffusion. Cette stratégie vise principalement à
développer le contenu relatif aux artistes participants ainsi que d’augmenter la réactivité des membres de la
communauté en leur offrant des outils spécialisés à leur visionnement web et finalement augmenter la présence
sur le web. Voici les trois (3) points majeurs de cette stratégie web : 



1) Page web indépendante

«À dos de talents» s’est muni
d’une page web indépendante de
sa maison de production. Cette
page web va permettre de placer
plus de contenu pour les
internautes puisque l’espace sera
beaucoup plus vaste et libre. Cette
page va permettre une fidélisation
du public face au nouveau
contenu exclusif qu’elle
contiendra. 
2) Web TV


Malgré les diffusions télévisuelles
de l’émission, le concept initial de
l’émission est tout de même la
diffusion web, afin de touchant le
plus vaste public possible sur le
plus de territoire possible (autant
québécois, canadien
qu’international). Cette Web TV
va permettre la diffusion de
contenu supplémentaire pour les
auditeurs et surtout du contenu
exclusif. 
3) Réseaux sociaux


Les réseaux sociaux permettent de
cibler les auditeurs directement
dans leur monde et également de
faire parler de l’émission. Dans
cette stratégie, les réseaux sociaux
viendront promouvoir la
programmation de la Web TV et
du contenu exclusif dédié aux
internautes sur la page web de
l’émission. 










 Le budget global de la saison 3 est chiffré à 77 510$. Tout ce budget englobe l'entièreté de la production (de la pré production à la diffusion). Couvrant la location du matériel de tournage, le transport du matériel et les ressources nécessaires (humaines et matérielles), ce montant est le budget minimum pour une réalisation dans de bonnes conditions. Dates importantes24 mars 2015* : Conférence de presse28, 29, 30, 31 mai 2015: Tournage de la saison Alma6 septembre 2015*: Lancement de la saison 316 janvier 2016* : Spectacle de clôture de la saison 3*Dates sujettes à changement.
Pour voir tous les événements de la production : http://adosdetalents.tv/evenements
 «À dos de talents»  a été nominé à plusieurs prestigieux galas de renommée régionale et nationale, et l'émission continue d'être nominée! 
Gala Forces AVENIR (2013) : Lauréat AVENIR Projet par excellence (Saison 1)
Gala Florilège (2013) : Finaliste catégorie Initiative Jeunesse (Saison 2)
Concours québécois en entrepreneuriat 2014: Lauréat Régional (Montérégie) et Finaliste National (saison 2)
Swiss Web Program Festival (Montreux, Suisse) : Prix du PublicCatégorie «Culture et divertissement» (Saison 2)


Producteur et réalisateur: Robin Degotte 
Assistante à la producteur: Katherine Couillard 
Directrice artistique: Katty Noben
Régisseur de plateau:  Frédéric Degotte 
Chef Son : Charles DesrochersVoici un lien vers la première épisode de la deuxième saison! Pour revoir la saison 2 :  http://adosdetalents.tv/addt-tv



VOUS pouvez nous aider à réaliser ce concept "une saison, une région" à travers le Québec et ainsi démontrer la diversité de notre jeunesse. Nous avons besoin de VOUS!
RproductionsD, département production vidéo
Téléphone: +1 (450) 916-4277
Courriel du producteur : robin.d@rproductionsd.com
Courriel de production : production@adosdetalents.tv
Site internet : www.adosdetalents.tv
©. Tous droits réservés. RproductionsD. 2015.

story:
Il Mongol Rally è una corsa non competitiva a scopo benefico che si tiene ogni anno dal 2004.

Le regole sono poche e semplici:

-   L ’auto utilizzata deve avere minimo 10 anni e un motore inferiore ai 1200 cc.

-   è vietato utilizzare autostrade e gps.

-   è obbligatorio versare 1000£ in beneficenza.

La partenza ufficiale sarà a Londra il 19 luglio, ma ogni team potrà iniziare il proprio viaggio da qualsiasi città europea.

Il traguardo invece è lo stesso per tutti e si trova a Ulan Ude, in Siberia.

Abbiamo deciso di incentrare il nostro progetto sulla pallacanestro. Sostenuti da Scaligera Basket infatti organizzeremo anche incontri, gare di tiro e mini-partite con la presenza di giocatori professionisti dove il ricavato verrà devoluto in beneficenza.

story:
What you have seen here described is the essence of the WALPIE WALK.

Walpie Walk is all about freedom, joy and groovyness in your feet. It's about feeling the uplifting and eternal beat of the universe and surrendering to it. The way to achieve the Walpie Walk is to follow in Walpie's cute little pawsteps.

And who is Walpie?

Walpie is a cat creature of the species Walkopard (Panthera walkus). Walkopards are a recently discovered feline species. So far Walpie is the only known specimen of the Walkopard species. 

So where does Walpie live?

Right now we are building a brand new home for Walpie to live in; a smartphone app for Android and iOS. That means that each of you will be able to have Walpie on your smartphones very soon.

The main purpose of this app is to allow you to take a walk with Walpie whenever you please. The more you walk with him, the more you will become like him. That means that your WALPINESS score will increase. Walpiness score will unlock various features inside the game, and bring you certain rewards.

Here you can see a screenshot of the main walking feature inside the app:

float: right;

Walpie app in walking mode

The way the walking works is using your GPS system to track your real movement. When you start walking, after a couple of steps, Walpie starts walking with you. If you think about cheating and turning the walking mode on when driving a car or a bicycle, think again! Walpie has his own thing going, his own rhythm and if you go too fast, he will drop out of your phone. Your app will be catless and empty from that moment on. But don't worry, you can return to that location later and pick him up. Just approach the right GPS location and he'll hop into your smartphone. 

For best results, be sure to turn the music on and try to walk in it's 105 BPM rhythm. This is the beat of the Walpie Walk.

Before going out for a walk with Walpie, be sure to check his mood. Sometimes he feels like going out, and sometimes he feels like staying in. His tail will tell. The more he feels like walking, the more Walpiness score you get after each walk.


Walpie tail mood test

Also, be sure to check how shiny his fur is in the fur gloss test. If it's not shiny enough, you'll have go give him enough privacy (behind the curtain) to lick himself. After a good licking session, he's good to go.


The licking curtain

Your advancement in Walpiness will unlock several songs which Walpie can sing for you. His meowing and singing sounds like a Hammond electric organ from the 60's and 70's popular music.



Walpie singing

And if it's actually you who don't feel like going out, you can still play with Walpie indoors. But you still need to follow in his pawsteps. Try and remember Walpie's step pattern on a field of twenty squares and try to repeat it with your own steps.


Pawsteps minigame

Every now and then, Walpie comes to us with a brand new idea for what he'd like to have in his new home, so don't be surprised if other cool features appear by the time you get your hands on the finished app.





So where on earth did Walpie come from? Well...we're not so sure about the "Earth" part, but...well, it's a long and weird story and here is the short version.

You might have noticed that on the beginning of our pitch page we've quoted someone named "Mr. MITS". This is the man behind the curtain who started this whole thing. It was him who discovered Walpie in the first place.

Not much is known about Mr. MITS, and the most anyone has been able to squeeze out of him is written down in this interview on our blog.  Click here if you wish to read more about this mysterious figure: WALPIE'S BLOG


MITS with his favorite record player

As you can see from this poster, MITS is always seen wearing a suit, which is how he got his name Man In The Suit (or MITS). Also, very few people have had the privilege to see his face.

So what does this guy have to do with anything?

Slow down, we'll get to it.

MITS worked as a record producer in the 70's and ran a little recording studio in New York. During the great blackout of 1977 when most of the city plunged into darkness due to a power outage, something strange happened. It seems that some kind of electronic cat found its way through the empty electrical grid, and into a 24-track tape machine in the little studio of Mr. MITS. When strange organ sounds started appearing on empty tracks of the 24-track tape, MITS realized that his tape machine is "haunted". Figuring out that he had discovered a new type of feline life form, he decided to make a proper home for it. Next year, in 1978, he produced a vinyl record with the song Feline Dancer, as a new home for Walpie to move into. Walpie accepted the gift, and that's where he has been living for the past 36 years; inside a vinyl record.

In the following music video, you can see Walpie in his old vinyl home.




In the year 2014, MITS decided to make a more modern home for Walpie: the Walpie app. For 36 years, Walpie has been walking along the grooves of his magical record, and now the entire world is the groove to walk on. 




Basic goal: $1000

Launching the app


Our basic goal is to raise 1000 USD to help us with finishing and launching the Walpie app both for Android and iPhone. We have already spent a lot of money from our own pockets in order to get to this point, but raising this amount would greatly help us in getting to the completion of this project.


Longshot goal: $7000

Walpie Sniffer


Do you believe in miracles? We sincerely do, and so does Walpie. We know gathering 7000 USD is a longshot, but such things do happen sometimes. We have a plan that would greatly benefit from such generosity on your part. The plan is to take the Walpie project to a whole new level with the WALPIE SNIFFER network. 

Walpie Sniffer is a feature we wish to develop as part of the Walpie app, that uses your internet connection, and a worldwide server system to keep track of GPS locations of all Walpie users in real-time. Such a feature would enable you to find the nearest users with Walpie running on their smartphone with the goal of encouraging you to find them on the street, approach them and become friends.

If the two of you start walking together, you'll both get increased Walpiness points for your walk, a a few other fun surprises. 

Since this feature would require some additional development time, the first version of the app, predicted to be launched at some point until May of 2015, might not have this feature. In that case, an update would be provided later to all the funders which would add the Walpie Sniffer feature to their apps.

While, not yet designed, the interface of the Walpie Sniffer feature will show you an arrow pointing the direction in which you'll find the nearest Walpie user, and approximate the distance at which you might find them. The rest is up to you. Figure out a way to approach them and start a conversation without being too awkward...




Every dollar you support us with will be appreciated and rewarded with a gift and our sincere thanks. But sometimes we come across people who surprise us with truly generous contributions, and these people deserve something special from us. For that reason we have worked out three PREMIUM REWARDS for very large contributions. 


Gold Edition Walpie app ($100 or more):



In the Gold Edition of the Walpie app, your personal name will appear in several places including the customized splash screen and the info page which you can open anytime you wish to brag to your friends that you had a custom version of the app made specially for you. Oh, and one more thing...

We'll let you in on a little secret: Walpie speaks from time to time. Sometimes we are having trouble understanding him like Mr. MITS does, but with his help, we'll implement a "meowslator" feature which will translate Walpie's meows in the app. So don't be surprised if he mentions you sometimes in the app. 

Only 100 personalized copies of the Walpie Gold Edition app will be made.


VIP Edition Walpie app ($250 or more):



How would you like to speak with MITS himself? So far, very few people, outside of his circle of personal friends and acquaintances, had this privilege. As they say, he is an enigma wrapped in a mystery. But MITS has agreed to give a chance to 24 generous funders to get to know him better by speaking with him DIRECTLY through a special VIP message feature inside the app. This rare edition of the app will be called Walpie VIP Edition. If you own a copy of the VIP Edition app, you'll be able to send 1 message every day to Mr. MITS, and he'll give you a reply as soon as he is able, usually within 24 hours, and sometimes even instantly. You'll receive his reply INSIDE the app.

So what would one ask MITS anyway?

The most obvious question would be: What planet is he from? The less obvious ones would be: What is his favorite ice-cream flavor? What is the brand of the suit he is wearing in all the Walpie ads? Was he, by any chance, the guy you saw in the subway the other day?....

Whatever you ask him, he will give you an answer, as long as it doesn't jeopardize the secrecy surrounding his identity. But he might leave you a couple of hints, now and then, as to who or what he really is...


Limited Edition Walpie vinyl record ($400 or more):



Having Walpie on your smartphone is cool and all, but experiencing him the old school way is something else. The core of the Walpie experience is ANALOG. Life is analog. We don't want you to get the wrong impression though: Walpie is the same, regardless of where he resides. But there is something special about interacting with Walpie through a pure analog medium like a vinyl record. It's DIRECT.

If you are one of the 7 funders to contribute more than $400, besides having Walpie on your smartphone, you'll also have him on vinyl. The record you'll receive will be one of the only 7 copies to be pressed of this special record, since 1978.

If you don't know what a vinyl record is, disregard all of this... Well, you can still contribute $400 and get a nice black plastic disk thingy. Just don't throw it to the dog like a Frisbee; Walpie will be insulted.





Phi-Line is a team, formed with the dedication of developing the Walpie app, and continuing to offer support and updates for it after it's launch.

Phi-line is a duo consisting of the following individuals:

Tomislav Krpan: The manager of the project, and the software developer working  on the app. Tomislav is a decent chess player, so he knows when to make a move for the project. The rest of the time, he quietly stares at the monitor, like a checkerboard, trying to figure out how to get out of programming stalemates.

Edgar Njari: The project art director and graphic designer. Edgar is also a photographer, so he views the entire project through the lens of his camera. He decides how something is going to look and feel and where to throw in even more purple and pink. Phi-line does it's own advertising materials, and Edgar is the person behind them.



Risks and challenges:


The main challenge we are going to face, once the campaign is over, is meeting our deadline for the launch of the app. We plan to finish this app by any means, and things are progressing well, but life is full of surprises. That being said, you WILL get your app and all the other perks that we offer. The worse thing that can happen is that you have to wait an extra month or two. Well, there are always worse things...like an asteroid hitting the Earth and extinguishing all life on this planet, but let's be optimistic.

Phi-line is a duo consisting of the following individuals: Tomislav Krpan: The manager of the project, and the software developer working  on the app. Tomislav is a decent chess player, so he knows when to make a move for the project. The rest of the time, he quietly stares at the monitor, like a checkerboard, trying to figure out how to get out of programming stalemates. Edgar Njari: The project art director and graphic designer. Edgar is also a photographer, so he views the entire project through the lens of his camera. He decides how something is going to look and feel and where to throw in even more purple and pink. Phi-line does it's own advertising materials, and Edgar is the person behind them.
Risks and challenges:

The main challenge we are going to face, once the campaign is
 over, is meeting our deadline for the launch of the app. We plan to 
finish this app by any means, and things are progressing well, but life 
is full of surprises. That being said, you WILL get your app and all the
 other perks that we offer. The worse thing that can happen is that you 
have to wait an extra month or two. Well, there are always worse 
things...like an asteroid hitting the Earth and extinguishing all life 
on this planet, but let's be optimistic.

story:
With a world seemingly in turmoil and divisions in the human race as big as ever, now seems like the perfect time for a generation (our generation) to learn from the experiences of those before us.  Men and women who have witnessed everything, from extremes of hate to unbelievable movements of love.    

SNIOP is a feature length documentary, book and a related multi-media project that asks the older generation 3 simple questions about life. The answers give an insight in to the world of those that have had a lifetime of experience, yet are often overlooked. Sharing a plethora of fabulous opinions, knowledge and views, SNIOP will entertain, enlighten and capture moments that may otherwise be forgotten.



The answers to these simple questions will not only be captured in the documentary but will also be shared via our website (www.sniop.co.uk) and popular social networking platforms; Facebook and Twitter.    We will also establish a Youtube channel for the transmission of all the interviews conducted; a resource that will live well beyond the projects origins and its creators.  SNIOP is intended as a continuing project; capturing social history and depicting changing attitudes and beliefs. Think of it as an ever evolving time capsule of the human spirit.

We also want to reach beyond the screen and create real, tangible change.  Therefore, this will be a non-profit project, donating any and all of its profits to a variety of charities doing wonderful work across the globe. This includes profits derived from sponsorship, DVD sales, downloads of the film, and sales of the book of selected photographs and interviews.


In 2015, we have reached a point in time where it’s easier than ever to share experiences and reach out to one another. SNIOP intends to embrace the technological advances we have made as a worldwide society and bring voices to light that may otherwise be forgotten.

Created with passion and joy, SNIOP will share these voices far and wide, so we can learn from and hopefully make a difference to all our futures.




Thank you for reading and for the opportunity to make SNIOP a reality.

Brian M Franklin (Creator & Director)

story:
Short Summary

A sensorial exploration of a relationship in old age; a film centred around those small moments in life shared with our loved ones, and the impact they have on us.

Our film focuses on David, an elderly man, as he takes care of his wife Helen, an aged potter, who is now frail and unable to completely take care of herself. We follow their joint struggles and the issues they face each passing day.

When Helen is resting, David visits her old pottery studio as a means of getting away from it all. It is here where David can concentrate on something in his control - the clay, his wife's previous love. 

As David shapes the clay, memories are brought back to life through a focus on the senses, primarily that of the touch; a process that provides an insight into their relationship and David's inner world and conflict. 

These moments are short-lived however, as David has to return to the aid of his wife Helen. How long can David live like this, and will he always be able to provide the care Helen needs?


Why We Need You?

Having already contributed a collective amount of £750 ourselves, we are now hoping to raise a further £1,250 in order to make the best possible version of the film. The money raised will be spent on a number of things, including payment for our four member cast (Old David and Helen and the actors playing their younger selves), period props and clothing, travel expenses and equipment hire amongst other things. Contributions of any kind will be greatly appreciated.


Locations

The majority of the film will take place in two main locations - Helen's pottery studio and David and Helen's rural cottage. Both of these locations have already been secured and so we are now very excited about getting in there and putting these great locations on screen.


Helen's Pottery Studio

This is where David comes to mould and shape the clay, in the same way that his wife Helen used to do. The process relaxes him and allows him to remember past memories of them both together, moments before Helen became frail. The pottery studio itself is still a working studio bringing an element of authenticity to the feel and aesthetics of the space. 


David and Helen's Rural Cottage

A three bedroom rural cottage where David and Helen have lived for many years. The garage in the garden will double for Helen's old pottery studio in the film.


Our Approach

We are very fortunate to have access to the Arri Alexa with Zeiss CP lenses and so will be mainly shooting with this, in conjunction with a GH4 for the film's more dynamic shots.

Our approach to shooting will vary depending on the content of each scene. Inside the house, shots will be static with the takes longer so that time appears to pass at a steady pace. Once David enters the pottery studio, slow-moving camera movements will enhance this slower perception of time. Certain shots will linger, on tools, drawings and objects of the past – all in order to portray David's nostalgia and to set up his journey down memory lane.

Once David’s memory kicks in, time will flow faster with the cuts much snappier as a result of David's inability to recall certain exact conversations, with some parts being distorted or completely inaudible. The memories that David will be able to recall, and the happiness they bring, will be short lived and always in contrast with the rest of the film.


Put A Face To A Name

Left To Right: Andrei Herea, Emma Hume

Andrei Herea - Director

"Born and raised in Romania, I’ve decided to study filmmaking abroad both to challenge myself and as a way of gaining valuable learning experience. Having came from an educational background rooted in Humanities, I made it my aim to approach films from the perspective and knowledge of a wide range of arts and social sciences.

With this in mind, I plan to approach ‘Our Life and Joy’ for a universal audience so that regardless of the walk of life one comes from, they will be able to connect with the film's deeply human story and themes, and hopefully be able to take something away from the experience and gain an insight into their relationship with their loved ones."

Emma Hume - Producer

"I have studied film for a number of years, beginning with theory and now focusing more on the practical side of filmmaking. Having had a keen interest in screenwriting and producing, I decided to specialise in both during my second year of studying 'Film and Video' at the University of South Wales. Now in my final year, I am very excited to be working on 'Our Life And Joy' and making it something that we can all be proud of. Having worked with John Giwa-Amu (Producer of 'The Machine' [2014]), I am keen to put everything I have learned so far into good use."

Left To Right: Keith Domingo, Amica Schiller, Rees Evans

Keith Domingo - Cinematographer

"I first became interested in filmmaking after experiencing it in college, it is during this experience that I realised my love for Cinematography. Since then I have gone on to study Film and Video at the University Of South Wales, specialising primarily in Cinematography.

Since commencing my studies there, I have worked as a Cinematographer and Editor on a number of short films including Devil’s Hand Shake, Love Tides, New Horizon and a viral advert for the 'WelshHearts' association. I am very excited to work on “Our Life And Joy”. I’m particularly looking forward to the sensorial aspect of the story and how we can complement this through the use of lighting. I believe that careful selection of shot type and the implementation of camera movement will play a very important role in the development of the characters.”

Amica Schiller - Editor

"I am currently studying Film Production at the University of South Wales with options in Cinematography and Editing, having previously studied Film and Television Production at Southdown's College, gaining a triple distinction grade with one distinction star. 

I first became interested in the art of editing after spending a summer editing corporate videos for a Swedish company called 'Qmatic'. Cutting films day after day was a great way to not only learn about the editing process, but also the role of the editor as well.

Having trained on Adobe Premier and AVID Media Composer with experience using Sony Vegas, I feel that I have a wide range of experience when it comes to editing packages. Following on from my corporate work with 'Qmatic', I have also had the pleasure of editing for 'Silent Edge', a talent management solutions based company in Tunbridge Wells."

Rees Evans - First Assistant Director

"After finishing Sixth Form in 2012, and a short work experience placement with the BBC, I decided to study 'Film Production' at Newport Film School, specialising in screenwriting and directing, and continuing my love for filmmaking which began as a childhood hobby on weekends.

Since then, I have written and directed a number of my own short films and have helped out on various other productions. I have also worked with numerous non-profit organisations, including a local primary school in which I had two days to write, shoot and edit a short film with an entire class of thirty year 6 pupils, an experience that I thoroughly enjoyed and found very rewarding. I have also helped create a short viral video for 'WelshHearts' - The Heart Charity for Wales.

I am very excited about 'Our Life And Joy' as I believe it is a story many people will be able to relate to regardless of their age."

Our aim is to produce a short film with a focus on visual storytelling through the use of strong visuals and sound design; to create an experience that is both emotionally gripping and thought provoking. 

Budget

Location Hire - £300

Actors - £300

Props - £150

Costume (period and modern) - £100

Sound - £200

Additional Equipment - £250

Travel - £200

Catering - £150

Music - £50

MakeUp - £50

Additional Costs - £250

Total: £2000


Thank You

Thank you for reading this far. Any contributions of any kind will be greatly appreciated, however if you are unable to donate right now, sharing this page on Facebook or Twitter would mean the world to us.
https://www.facebook.com/ourlifeandjoy
https://twitter.com/OLAJFilm

story:
Perchè

Carlotta è la nostra "mamma"...giusto?? Il 23 è il suo compleanno..e noi da brave figliuole le facciamo questo regalino di..Un nuovo cellulare!!

il 23 gennaio diamole un bel regalo

Il suo cellulare è praticamente morto, e quel poco che gli resta da vivere è "ostaggio" di Cice e Meli.

story:
UKIP - Changing the Face of Politics

Years of remote management by the labour run Wigan Council has caused Wigan to suffer. UKIP believe Wigan & Makerfield can do better. But, In order to ensure we win seats both locally and nationally we need your help.

What We Need

Local UKIP branches receive no funding from the national party. In order to win in Wigan, Makerfield & Leigh we need money. Here is what your money can buy:

  • £5 - Pays for 500 Leaflets.
  • £10 - Pays for 1000 leaflets.
  • £20 - Pays for a combination of leaflets and window posters.
  • £50 - Buys 5000 leaflets.
  • £100 - Buys enough leaflets for every house in a ward.

The Impact

A UKIP government will guarantee:
  • A referendum on our membership of the EU.
  • Tighter controls on immigration with an Australian style point system.
  • No tax on the minimum wage on 40 hours a week.
  • UKIP will ensure the NHS is free at the point of delivery and time of need for all UK residents.
  • UKIP Will cut foreign aid.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tom Kubik and I'm a commercial photographer based in San Francisco. 

I've been trying to find a way to supplement my commercial photography with something that leaves a lasting positive impact on a global scale, so when Mama Hope asked me to become a volunteer in their Global Advocate program, I knew it was a great fit! I'm going to be traveling with Mama Hope to document development projects that create social infrastructure that will ensure the community's self-sustainability. Before I go, I'm raising $8,900 to continue production of Mama Hope's Stop the Pity campaign that went viral 2 years ago. The videos were viewed millions of times and helped generate funds to complete more projects in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and Ghana. These videos and the funding they generate will directly affect hundreds of thousands of lives, and have a major impact on generations to come.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $10,000, and I'm already on my way to that goal, which is why I'm asking for $8,900. Production of media is not cheap, but we're scrappy and we can accomplish a lot on a shoestring budget. The goal is to produce 2 profile short films highlighting community leaders in Africa, the natives that are striving to make their communities the best they can be. We are also in talks about a collaboration with local schools to interview and photograph 8th graders from a San Francisco private school and 8th graders from the Akili girls' school in Kenya. The photos will be made into a book and sold with all profits going to support more development projects in East Africa.

Camera equipment (lighting, lenses, rigs) - $3,500

Travel (to and from Africa) - $2,500

Expenses in country (food, transportation, etc) - $1,000

Post production on videos - $1,500

Initial publishing costs of books - $1,500

PERKS

$1 or more - Everyone that contributes will get a producer credit in the films we make

$20 or more - Not only will you get producer credits in the film, but you will also get your name printed in the book on a "special thanks" page (25 available)

$50 or more -You will receive a printed 8x10" portrait from my journey, an edition of 25 (25 available)

$100 or more - You will receive a video shout out on social media from Africa that will be featured on the blog (5 available)

$250 or more - Signed softcover book of portraits of the 8th graders mentioned above (5 available)

$500 or more - Signed hardcover special edition book of the 8th graders mentioned above (5 available)

The Impact

We are heavily influenced by all of the media we consume daily. It's extremely important for these stories to be seen, which is why Mama Hope has asked me to take time off work and create movies and still images that tell the story of the amazing development happening in these small communities of East Africa. We know that showing the world these compelling stories will generate the much needed funding for Mama Hope to continue their partnerships with the leaders on the ground.

Mama Hope has already completed over 50 projects in 4 countries and directly impacted 150,000 souls. The partnerships they build  are sound, but also meant to be temporary. We are there as a partnership, providing the resources they need to complete self-identified projects using all local contractors. The money stays in the system, we help build a local, sustainable economy, and then we leave them to it.

With globalization on the rise, we need to turn our attention to Africa. The world is shrinking, and soon Africa's child population will be ready to enter the new global workforce. First they need the opportunity to prepare through great health and education. Your donations will help that happen. 

Risks & Challenges

We don't have the answers to their problems, but we do have the humility to admit that. That's why we put so much emphasis on the partnership and teaming up with the people that grew up in the community to help them complete their goals. 

It's really tough to break the stereotype of Africa as a war torn, starving, diseased continent, and the truth is that all of that exists. There's another equally valid truth, and that is all of the progress that's being made. The more we can enlighten people to the idea that progress is happening, the more people will have faith in development, and the more people will care about what's going on in Africa. With the continent supporting 15% of humans and growing, we need to ensure they have the resources they need to be successful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that we all have different financial situations, but the fact that you're reading this says that you care. Please, share this with all of your friends using the indiegogo share buttons. Come along with me on my journey to tell the world about the new Africa!

story:
Short Summary

We are one of the leading free-to-air Christian TV Stations in Africa. And with this upgrades to our work environment, we can go further and reach more people for the Kingdom of God.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $50 000 in order to upgrade our editing, graphics and studio departments. These departments shoots, edits and publishes 70% of the content on Spirit Word Channel.
  • You can become part of the team that Changes the world for Jesus Christ
  • Whether we reach the full amount or not, we will use 100% of the funds to upgrade what we can.

The Impact

  • We not only publish in Africa but also around the world with Livestreaming, and by doing so we reach a global audience.
  • In the history of Spirit Word (35+ years) we have built 2 churches, and established an editing, graphics, final control centre and studio within the last 10 years.
  • We need to go forward, we need your help!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us by not only contributing financially but also spread the Word, share the links. The more people know, the quicker we can raise the funds.
  • Use the Share tools on Indiegogo to tell all your friends, family and business colleagues.

story: Based on the "Happy Birthday Spider-Man" Story arc. Peter Parker must travel through his timeline, to get back to the present and save the city he has fought so hard for.
story_txt: Based on the "Happy Birthday Spider-Man" Story arc. Peter Parker must travel through his timeline, to get back to the present and save the city he has fought so hard for.

story:
Short Summary

We believe that everyone has a voice and our goal with this film is to give a small community a platform to have their voices heard. No voice is too small. They won't pipe down and neither will we. Nelson County is fighting the proposed Atlantic Coast Pipeline to protect their environment, their community and their homes.  We are a team of 4 college students trying to make a difference. We have spent many nights in the editing lab and many months filming. As college students with a full work load and jobs, this was no easy feat. Our first version of the film won the student documentary category at the William and Mary's Global Film Fest and an Honorable Mention at the Broadcast Education Association's festival. Now, we have high hopes for our 25 minute piece. We need your help. We need funds to take this community story to a national level. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $7,500. We need these funds to help us with post-production costs like having a sound mix and professional color grading. We then need the funds to enter festivals and host screenings in other communities to get this documentary seen by many. Your contribution would help us do that. 

The Impact

This issue is bigger than one community. This is an issue many communities are fighting all across America. We as Americans have a voice and do not deserve to be silenced by big money and large corporations. We won't pipe down. 

Risks & Challenges

We are confident in our final version which will be screened May 4th. However, if we do not get funding then obtaining the resources to successfully leverage our film will be difficult. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like our Facebook page and keep checking to see ways you can get involved. Hashtag #wontpipedown to help spread awareness.

story:
THE BENCH

Green Valley Films are proudly working with a number of schools in Legnica, Poland to create this very touching movie that highlights the troubles that can haunt the underprivileged, with a modern twist on the supernatural.  Filmed in Polish with English subtitles.


Made up of an unknown cast, one of the main objectives is to involve as many children and young adults as possible. Some of the children involved have special needs and this is one of the reasons why this film will be so special. 

We want to make it an experience to remember!!!!!

The film has full backing from the ‘Blue Balloon Children's Charity’, actors and staff from the schools in Legnica along with a dedicated team of film-makers from Wales.

The combined partnership between Green Valley Films and the exceptional people of Legnica is fundamental to the creation of this movie. 

This really is an amazing project!

The Story 

Living rough on the Polish streets, two young boys struggle to survive each day. But their lives suddenly change forever in a way they never could have imagined. Following an accident, one of the boys develops a supernatural power, which attracts attention of the worst kind. His life hangs in the balance as his future is torn between the forces of good and evil. 



Who Are We?
We are an experienced company that produces all types of media work but primarily specialize in documentary making. We have worked on feature films in the U.K. and contributed to Japanese movies and projects all over the world. We have a great reputation for charity work and is our first feature film we are doing on our own. We were told the number of young people involved and the filming in Poland would be too hard, but this is something we know we can do!!!!
Why In Poland?
After supporting the 'Blue Balloon Children's Charity', who are involved with many different projects in Wales and Poland, we were lucky to meet some of the pupils and staff from the schools as well as the ever supporting local authority of Legnica. At first, we were going to film in Wales, but after visiting and meeting the amazing people of Legnica it suddenly felt right to shoot it out there. Yes, we were worried about the support out there, but every door was opened for us to film and the locations in Legnica fitted straight into our story. 
This was meant to happen!

Why We Need Your Help!!!!

We have been working on the preparation and script since last November, but now it's time to make the film. Despite us being very passionate about this film, we still need running costs, some equipment, travelling expenses and payment of staff. We'd love to make this for nothing but that's not how the world works.
The £30,000 we would like to raise will be split up between 3 main areas: 
1) £15,000 - Equipment
We wish to upgrade our existing equipment to get the best possible quality. At the climax of our movie we'll be working with up to 70 young people. We will need extra cameras, microphones and other materials to make sure it all runs smoothly. The last thing we want to do is ask them to keep coming back for re-shoots. We want to get this right!
2) £11,000 - Staff Pre & Post Production
As film-makers, we put a lot of our own time and money into the pre-production, but we need full-time staff on board to ensure the the movie's completion. Good will is great, but it won't pay the staff's wages, I'm afraid.
3) £4,000- Crew Travel & Accommodation
Travelling back and forth between Poland to Wales is not cheap. So far, all the travelling for casting, location scouting and numerous meetings has been covered by us as individuals. When it comes to filming, we need your help for travelling and living expenses, which all adds up . 


As movies go, we are working on a micro budget, but with the funds we generate we can pull this off!!!!!!!

If we don't reach our goal, then we'll do the best with what we get. We have come a long way and dug deep into our own pockets already. The good people of Legnica have opened their doors for us to film in their town. 
There are so many people helping us already we really want to make this work and produce a quality film. Shot in Polish with English subtitles and using a unknown cast made up from young people from Poland and Wales, We were told it was almost impossible to do.We don't believe that! 

We got some great perks for you too, from the bottom end with a digital download of the completed movie, to walk on parts and even private screenings, meeting the cast and even joining our team. Anyone who contributes to our project will be given access to the private behind-the-scenes Facebook group to be kept up to date with the production.  Check them out people, be part of THE BENCH!!!!

The Impact

One of the main differences with this film is the cast. All unknown but so talented, we were blown away by the number of people who auditioned and wanted to be part of the movie, to the point we re-wrote the script to include more parts.
But we want to make it a great experience for our young cast from the Welsh and Polish schools involved, including special needs schools. These young people are coming on board as extras in as many parts as possible. We want to make a special film, but we also want this to be a great experience for these people and you can help with that.  We really mean it, you will really be helping get these kids in the movie!!!!


Risks & Challenges

We have spent a lot of money so far and already have some good equipment. But in an ideal world we would like to upgrade to get the best quality possible.But if we don't reach our targets, we won't be able to achieve the high standard of quality we are aiming for.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight right now, so if you can't contribute financially you can still help us out. Share our campaign with people who can help. Spread the word on the social media sites to raise awareness of our worthwhile cause. Anything to help get the word out!!!. This really is a great project! Use the Indiegogo share tools, it will really help. 
Thanks Again We Really Appreciate It!

story: My name is Neal Tinney and for awhile I have wanted to create something that helps give back to the community in a positive way. I came up with the AOG project that stands for Acts of Giving. All the money raised will go back to the community either in requested or random ways. I am hoping by starting this project to create kindness and giving in others and to show my kids how important it is to give back and help others where you can. This project will not pinpoint anyone in particular and the money raised will be used to give back to random people. I believe everyone should receive some form of kindness regardless of their background. My hopes are to eventually start a big non-profit that gives back in positive ways, whether by randomly paying for some ones groceries or buying something for someone in need. Once our goal is reached there will be videos on our facebook page The AOK project of how the money was used to give back to others as we video all of our Acts Of Kindness. Please help get this project off the ground and maybe together we can create something great to give back and start a project that can give back to everyone in a positive way.

story:
Balloon Head Productions 

Balloon Head Productions is a Video and Acting Club organized by the Pitt Meadow Museum. The aim of the club is to be educational and experimental for both the children and leaders in the mediums of video, sound, acting, directing, editing and distribution.

Newly created in 2014, the club is loosely organized and experimental in nature. We meet around every 2 months or so to explore video production within the museum context. This involves using our exhibits as "scenes" and playing with our Hands On collection and amazing costume collections. We are open to all ages but currently our members are largely between the ages of 6 and 10. We publish our finished products via our YouTube channel and on our Facebook. All projects are rated G and our goals are to be experimental, creative and learn as a group about video production and acting.
We are raising money for a high quality video camera. By contributing to our campaign, you can help make our creative ideas a reality, as well as providing the Museum with a valuable research and data collection tool. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1000+ in order to buy a new, high quality Video Camera for the use of our club and for use by the Museum. 

In return for your charitable contribution we are offering an array of high quailty printed products from our custom sticker set at the $15 dollar level to cameo oppurtunities at the $100 level. 

If we don't reach our goal, we will pursue buying a used video camera instead :) 


Why Is This So Important? 

Here at the Pitt Meadows Museum, we have a wonderful community of volunteers, youth ambassadors and local supporters. By contributing to our campaign, you can help provide this community with a wonderful tool to help collect and save data for future use as well as giving our very creative kids the ability to create a much better quality product.  We have created over 7 unique productions with our very minimal technology and we are bursting with ideas for future projects. You can help make them a reality!


We Need Your Help! 

Our largest challenge is getting our campaign out there. You can help us greatly by sharing our fundraising goals with your friends, families and colleagues.  We are also always looking for new members and help and support from adults in the coummuity.

story:
Our Tail!

Welcome to NYC Pet Tails!  A mini-season of our pet care web series debuted in January and we have BIG plans for Season 2.

With a production team in place, we are ready to film 10 episodes this summer. We will interview NYC pet owners, share informative how-to's & put the spotlight on local non-profit animal rescue groups.

In order to this do this, we need your help. With your backing we can make this pet care series a reality and raise awareness for pet adoption in New York City.

We Value Your Support!

We have some amazing perks available as a thank you for your donation! Including a comedy show ticket, your burning pet question answered by a local vet and even the chance to appear on-camera!

What Do We Need?

In order for our professional cast and crew to spend over 10 days shooting 10 six minute episodes in New York City, we need your support.

Budget Items Breakdown:

  • Crew (including DP + Audio Engineer)
  • Camera Equipment
  • Lighting Equipment
  • Sound Equipment
  • Music
  • Craft Services
  • Post-Production
  • Festival Submission Fees
  • Publicity/Marketing Costs
We will be super-psyched if you help us reach our Indiegogo goal of $10,000.  Any donation would help our project tremendously and no contribution is too small. Every little bit counts! 

The Impact

Your donation will make a difference. There are over 2.7 million healthy animals euthanized in the shelter system each year. NYC Pet Tails aims to spotlight local rescue groups working to find homes for city pets & urge pet owners to adopt - not shop.

    Risks & Challenges

    As you know, nothing is ever for certain, but we can assure you the second season is  ready to go. Our team wants nothing more than to take this show to the next level.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Hey, not everyone can donate - we understand! There are still lots of ways you can offer support.

        • Spread the word! Share this page with your friends and fellow animal lovers.
        • Watch Season One & tell us what you think!
        • Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram for updates on the project!
        • Comment on our videos & visit our blog. The more interaction, the more the word will spread!

        Meet Our Team!

        Creator, Producer, Host: Gemma Smith

        Gemma is a New York city-based actor, host & teaching artist. Originally from Richmond, Virginia, she earned a BA in Acting from Christopher Newport University. While in the city, Gemma has appeared in numerous short films, commercials (IHOP & Kleenex), the series premiere of Southern Fried Homicide and onstage at The Abingdon Mainstage Theatre. As a host, Gemma loves connecting with others while sharing information + inspiration. She just wrapped a man-on-the-street hosting gig & is a proud teaching artist to students ages 3-13.

        Gemma lives in Astoria with her two rescue kitties, Lion-o & Luna. Learn more at www.gemmasmith.net.

        Associate Producer: Jennifer Yadav

        Jennifer is an actress, singer, writer, videographer, voiceover artist, and teacher based in New York City since 2009. Jennifer’s love of animals began as a child. She grew up with dogs, cats, gerbils, fish, rabbits, and even a chicken as a pet. She now has three cats and a dog, all local rescue animals found in the Bronx. Jennifer has performed off-Broadway for the past four years in The Jackie Mason Musical, currently playing at St. Luke’s Theater. She is a contributing writer for e-How, Global Post Science, and Synonym.com, and is an Adjunct Professor of Science at Berkeley College in NYC. She is also the Managing Director and Videographer for Shakespeare Without Fear, a classical acting workshop. For more information, visit www.jenniferyadav.com.


        Associate Producer: Amanda Simpson

        Amanda is new to New York and is excited to be working on her first New York based project. She attended Virginia Commonwealth University as well as Academy of Art University where she studied motion pictures and television. Amanda has worked as a casting director and producer for several short films. Amanda’s cat, Weasel, is currently keeping her 93-year-old grandmother company in Virginia. Amanda is an animal lover and is currently looking into adopting a cat for her Brooklyn apartment.


        Social Media + PR Manager: Nicole Vaccaro

        Nicole is an Actress/writer from Pittsburgh where she attended  California University of Pennsylvania for theatre and writing. She moved to New York in 2011 to pursue her dreams and has performed in various plays and short films. She is an avid animal advocate, and wishes to promote awareness  of the benefits of adopting an animal and TNR. She is is very grateful to be a part of the Pet Tails team!


        Thank you for your support + we look forward to sharing a purrfect Season 2 with you this fall!

pictures and television. Amanda has worked as a casting director and producer
for several short films. Amanda’s cat, Weasel, is currently keeping her 93-year-old
grandmother company in Virginia. Amanda is an animal lover and is currently
looking into adopting a cat for her Brooklyn apartment. Social Media + PR Manager: Nicole VaccaroNicole is an Actress/writer from Pittsburgh 
where she attended  California University of Pennsylvania for theatre 
and writing. She 
moved to New York in 2011 to pursue her dreams and has performed in 
various plays and short films. She is an avid animal advocate, and 
wishes to promote awareness  of the benefits of adopting an animal and 
TNR. She is is very grateful to be a part of the Pet Tails team!Thank you for your support + we look forward to sharing a purrfect Season 2 with you this fall!

story:
I began working on this documentary two years ago, after experiencing the amazing effects that a plant based diet had on my health. At that point I also realized that there where many films that talked about food, but few discussed the wide spectrum of the impact and effects that our food choices have on our health, on the health of the planet and on the lives of other species. So I decided to embark on a journey to make this film. With no financial backing I used my own time, funds and resources to begin this project. Over time the project grew and I realized the importance of making the best film possible so this important message could reach the masses and make a positive impact on peoples lives, on the health of the planet and on the lives of animals. As the project became more elaborate so did the production expenses. Thanks to a previous crowd funding campaign and donations from family and friends I was able to push through and record 32 interviews around the country with amazing people such as doctors, nutritionists, researchers, best selling authors, environmentalists, chefs, athletes, celebrities, bloggers, rockstars, regular people I met during my trip and many others, to try to get a wider perspective and understanding of the impact of our food choices. 



Last month we finalized the interview recording stage of the production process. We have over 60 hours of footage. We reached a point where we really want to make the best film possible and need a little help to cover costs of post-production expenses such as professional editing, music score and the graphics and animations that I want to have placed throughout the film to help reinforce the message and tell this story in an informative and entertaining way. And that's where you can really help make a difference! :)

WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO FINISH THIS FILM?



People often ask me why am I dedicating so much time, effort and resources on this film. There is no short answer to that, but basically it is because I believe it has an important message and I also believe that it can make a difference in people's lives and hopefully to some extent on the health of our planet and on the lives of other species. I know this is just one film and it won't change the world by itself, but by raising awareness and joining efforts we can all begin making a difference.


THE IMPACT OF FOOD CHOICES ON PEOPLE'S HEALTH:

*According to several studies (some sources listed below), a carnivorous diet can potentially have several effects on our health. 


**Sources: PCRM.org, Stanford.edu, WHO (World Health Organization), The China Study, T. Colin Campbell Center for Nutrition Studies, The Starch Solution (Dr. John McDougall), nutritionfacts.org.

I experienced first hand the positive impact that a plant based diet can have on health. Just 3 years ago at age 32, I was over 50 pounds overweight, weighing 220lbs at 5'7", my blood pressure was high, my cholesterol was through the roof and my sugar was so high that the doctor said I was in a pre-diabetic stage. After trying several yo-yo diets for a couple years I ran into information about a plant based diet and decided to give it a shot. It was a hard transition for the first few weeks but I got used to it and really began to enjoy this new diet and lifestyle. After a year on this diet I re did the blood tests and to my and the doctors surprise all levels went back to normal. And what's great about it is that I didn't have to buy any supplements (aside from vitamin B12), take any medication or subscribe to any diet programs, it was all in the food! I really wish that more people got access to this information so they could also transform their lives and improve their health.
Studies and statistics from all over the world show us that there is an epidemic of obesity, cancer and chronic degenerative diseases such as diabetes and hearth disease, in america and all over the world. And the numbers are rising. Many experts believe that a plant based diet can help. I interviewed several health authorities and experts for this film to try get an understating of these facts.

THE IMPACT OF FOOD CHOICES ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND ON THE LIVES OF OTHER SPECIES:

**Sources: FAO (Food and agriculture organization of the United Nations), WHO (World Health Organization), UN (United Nations), Food Choices and Sustainability (Dr. Richard Oppenlander).

Many people get surprised when they hear that the food they eat can affect global warming, produce massive amounts of CO2, methane and nitric oxide emissions, diminish our fresh water supply, contribute to the depletion of our natural resources, destroy the amazon forest, destroy our top soil, completely deplete our oceans beyond repair, create massive amounts of pollution and several other factors. Unfortunately that is the truth. The meat, dairy and fishing industries have a devastating effect on our planet. The global population will reach 8 billion people in the next couple decades, and the future looks grim. It is impossible to feed that many people on a carnivorous diet.  Simply put there is not enough land, water and animal feed to produce enough meat for 8 billion people. 

It is important to take action now, become aware of the impact that food choices have on our lives and decide if it's worth it or not making a change. I don't believe that "veganism" will solve all the problems of our world, but I strongly believe that it must at least be part of the solution.

HOW CAN A PLANT BASED DIET IMPROVE YOUR HEALTH?

**Sources: PCRM.org, Stanford.edu, WHO (World Health Organization), The China Study, T. Colin Campbell Center for Nutrition Studies, The Starch Solution (Dr. John McDougall), nutritionfacts.org.

Several studies suggest that a plant based diet can positively affect your health, millions of people around the world are experiencing the healing effects of this diet and lifestyle. Renowned doctors such as John McDougall M.D. (featured in this film), use a plant based diet approach to prevent and treat patients with a wide array of conditions. More and more physicians adhere to this practice every day. Hundreds of studies have been done on the effects of a plant based diet on health. The most notorious one, called the China Study was conducted by Dr. T Colin Campbell PHD (featured in this film) in conjunction with Cornell University, Oxford University in London and several universities in China. The study lasted 27 years and analyzed the impact that diet (more specifically animal and plant based protein) had on promoting and preventing disease. 
Many people are learning that the best way to loose weight is by adopting a whole foods plant based diet (whole foods meaning foods close to their natural state). 
Many athletes are discovering that they can gain more lean muscle, lose fat and improve their athletic performance by adopting this diet. People such as world champion ultra marathon athlete Hilary Biscay and world class triathlete Rich Roll, who I had the pleasure to interview for this film are 100% fueled by plants! 

HOW CAN A PLANT BASED DIET HELP OUR PLANET AND SAVE THE LIVES OF OTHER SPECIES?


**Sources: FAO (Food and agriculture organization of the United Nations), WHO (World Health Organization), UN (United Nations), Food Choices and Sustainability (Dr. Richard Oppenlander).

80 billion land animals and over a trillion fish and sea animals are killed every year for human consumption. Aside of the massive pain, suffering and torture inflicted to these animals our entire planet suffers as several ecosystems are disrupted affecting thousands of species of both plant and animals. By choosing a plant based diet you will be helping the planet and the animals in many ways. To give you an example, a cow requires 30 to 40 gallons of water daily (in average) to survive, that's 14,400 gallons of water per year. By eating one pound less of meat per year you will save as much water as if you didn't shower for that same entire year.
Also, did you know that 70% of the arable land in the United Stated is used for the production of animal feed? How does that relate to world hunger? Imagine that we used that same land to produce plant based foods such as, vegetables, grains, fruits, legumes, etc... 
There is a lot of confusion and misinformation out there. For example, many people are shifting to organic, grass fed meats, thinking they are doing good for the planet and for the animals, but even thought the animals might live a better life when compared to the deplorable conditions they are raised in the factory farms, they are still slaughtered in the same way. There is no humane slaughterhouse in the United States. Another fact that goes unmentioned is that grass fed beef is countless times more destructive to our planet. One cow needs a minimum of 1 to 2 acres of land to graze. After a couple years, once the animal gets killed it will render in average 300 to 400 pounds of meat. Those same 2 acres of land could potentially generate 20 to 30 thousand pounds of plant based food per year. You do the math... There are many terrifying examples like the ones above and we covered several in the film.  

CHECK OUT OUR ORIGINAL TRAILER (THIS IS OLD MATERIAL THOUGH, WE DID OVER 20 ADDITIONAL INTERVIEWS AFTER THIS WAS PUT TOGETHER)


*Note: "Although some researchers have concluded that livestock contribute more than 50% of global anthropogenic greenhouse gases, most recent United Nations studies place the figure at 14.5%. Stay tuned for an updated Food Choices trailer for the most recent data and perspectives concerning the damaging effect that animal agriculture has on our environment including new numbers and perspectives related to greenhouse gases and climate change. This, of course, will be in addition to all the other wonderful aspects of this film and what it will bring to you."--Dr. Richard Oppenlander

HELP MAKE THIS FILM A REALITY!

We are offering several awesome perks in exchange of your support! As one of the perks you can get multiple copies for the Food Choices DVD's and do screenings with friends and family at you home or school! 


The Food Choices Documentary will be fully accessible online and through all mobile platforms and devices.




You can be one of the first to watch FOOD CHOICES when it comes out! Check out our perks to see how you can get a digital download of the film!

ABOUT THE FILMMAKER:



Michal Siewierski is a multiple Emmy Award nominated world-class TV producer, director and most recently a documentary filmmaker. Michal has produced hundreds of TV commercials, several TV shows, and political campaigns. After experiencing the amazing impact that a plant based diet had on his health and on his life, Michal embarked on a journey to produce the documentary Food Choices in order to raise awareness and to try doing his part in helping save the planet for future generations. Michal lives in Chicago, IL with his wife, daughter and their black labrador Shadow.




For more information please visit:

www.FoodChoicesMovie.com

THANK YOU!

**These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Consult with your doctor before making any dietary changes.

**If interested in eating a plant based diet seek advice from a doctor, nutritionist or licensed holistic practitioner with a strong background in plant based nutrition. You can find a list of doctors in your area on the website of the Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine http://www.pcrm.org.

**The statements made above are solely based on the personal experiences and interviews done by the filmmaker and are by no means to be considered as health advice from the filmmaker.

story:
NINA is the story of a young singer songwriter who is unable to perform at the memorial service of her grandfather’s funeral, the man who originally inspired her to write music. With the help of her remaining family who include her sister, father, and grandmother Nina searches for inspiration to write music again as well as regain confidence during performances. Her mission to connect with her music ultimately leads her on a journey of self-healing after her loss.

Who are we?: We are a group of film production majors studying at Emerson College one of the foremost film schools in the country and for us this film is the beginning of our careers in the industry. Our entire crew has made several industry level pieces on their own, and this short is another step on our transition from students to professionals. It will be shot in two weekends in and around the city of Boston with a full cast and crew of about thirty people.

We’ve scrimped and saved for this project, but as with all filmmaking this is a team effort and we want you to be a part of our team. We’ve done the math and we’re asking for the bare minimum to make this short a reality.

Our entire cast and crew are volunteering their services for this project so we’re trying to make this set the best environment it can be for them. This includes having all of the proper working equipment, supplies, the best transportation and housing for them, and the best meals to make sure they have enough energy for the long days.

We also want to make sure the buck doesn’t stop when the cameras stop rolling. We want to make sure we can get a score that will be as good as the film and we want to send this short to as many suitable festivals as possible.

If we don’t reach our entire goal the film will still be made. We’ve got a plan B, C, and D to make sure this film reaches fruition. 

Fret not over number, charts, and graphs because we also have goodies for you. T-shirts, posters, your own digital download, this list goes on as you can see in the right side column!

We understand the internet is a dark and scary place with lots of people who want your money for nothing so why are we trustworthy?

We have the backing of Emerson College. This includes a multitude of equipment, the experienced guidance of our acclaimed professors, and the support of the entire film department. This includes providing us with months of pre-production workshops with other professionals, insurance, and experience of our own. Through the Emerson community we’ve all been on a multitude of sets, production meetings, editing rooms, and every imaginable aspect of production. We’ve built a formidable repertoire of knowledge and plan to use it at a larger scale now for this project.

Campaign Calendar: We’ll be sending you continual updates and behind the scenes perks throughout the duration of shooting and post-production.

August 3rd-6th--Final Cast read-throughs and production meeting

August 7th-9th-- First weekend of shooting

August 14th-16th--Second weekend of shooting

September 1st-- Post production begins

January 2016--Release date

You can help us in all sorts of ways! Donations of any kind (especially the edible kind) are always welcome. Quite possibly the biggest way you can help us is by helping us spread the word about our short. Don’t forget to share the campaign using the handy Ingiegogo share tools.

Director's Statement: I wrote this story because it was very personal to me while at the same time relatable to a broad audience. Nina is about an everyday girl trying to rediscover herself through music though her story could be reflected in any person trying to pursue something and coming to a point where what they’re doing loses meaning.  Sometimes in our lives we get too focused on one thing and forget to remember what is around us. Nina is a call to that. The death of Nina’s grandfather causes Nina to reflect on everything that is going on her life and her passion for music. I have faced similar struggles in my own life with art. Trying to be creative constantly and realizing that sometimes doing what you love doesn’t come easily to you. Especially when things happen in your life that are out of your control.

I have been blessed with the most loving and caring family in my real life who have supported me through the good and bad, guiding me through my toughest decisions. In this sense Nina’s family is guiding her through her depression and is her lantern through the dark after her grandfather’s death. They prove to be her inspiration, but even with that Nina needs to let herself grieve and find it in herself to be happy again.
