story:
Lighthouse Project - To renovate a former iconic building into a multi-purpose centre for entertainment, education and healing. The primary focus is a centre of excellence, with far reaching benefits to the community and other parts of the world. As an independent facility we remain focused on our core philosophies, principles and beliefs - without the interference of external factors such as politics or local Government . In today's economic environment we have to rely on our creativity to be unique and successful in our business approach, hence the opportunity I have pleasure presenting to you.

The Story - Introduction by Deane Thomas

I would like to tell you why I feel so passionate about the lighthouse project and how, together, we can transform lives, not only here in Vukovar, but also throughout the world.

I first came to Vukovar in 1998 with my family – I saw with my own eyes the after effects of an armed conflict – I saw an iconic building as an opportunity - a positive change can be made, by adding some creativity and western influence to a torn culture.

The building was once a regional place to be, a beacon serving the whole area – its’ atmosphere was buzzing with celebrations and commemorations – it was the heart of the town.

When I returned here to live last year I wondered why!! What is the purpose of me being here!  Then through my own personal healing and growth I began to recall my original visions from 1998.

I decided that something can be done and knew how together, we can make that change. As entrepreneurs, visionaries, pioneers or as individuals – We are strong enough to effect the changes needed – this is because we have lived our lives with open minds and hearts, with visions and dreams, ideals and feelings.

We can transform this Iconic building into a wonderful venue – one which will cater for the needs of the community at a grass roots level, where we will capture the hearts and souls of generations of people, especially the younger ones who are so unnecessarily affected by the travesty that occurred here in 1991 – they have an image that they have no responsibility for or to accept - it is our role to change this here and now.

By using new methods of teaching, we will change these innocent lives; we will capture their hearts and souls before they enter society; these techniques will include meditation, yoga, healthy eating, honesty, truth and self-confidence – these children will possess a much healthier outlook than at present.


We will help those that suffer daily from the consequences of armed conflict; by offering comprehensive ways of coming to terms and coping with living their lives in the here and now. They will have valuable one on one counselling as well as group activities – we shall also offer services such as alcohol and drug abuse sessions for those that need it.

We will cater to foreign students and teachers who will learn our valuable work directly in the field – they will then return home to share and apply this knowledge in their own communities, The transfer of healing and knowledge is at the core of this program, together we will monitor and collect valuable data and witness the success of our work at home and abroad.

In addition to this vision, as an independent operator we have to ensure the complex is a self-sufficient business unit.  Therefore we will include a private English school and kindergarten, 40 bed hostel, conference facilities, leisure and well-being centre, restaurant and entertainment area.

We will truly be helping others to grow and learn - which in turn empowers them to live a balanced healthy life.

Together we can make a contribution, however large or small.

I ask you to  join me in lighting the first beacon in our lighthouse, and allow it to shine and spread its’ light all over the world.

Thank you

Introduction above in other languages 

Russian French Spanish Croatian

Why do we need crowd funding?

We need to secure the property, our aim is to raise as much of the purchase price through crowd funding - we can access business finance but it is limited for a new start project, therefore we feel crowd funding is the best means in which to assist us to achieve the initial financial requirements for the project. The purchase price of the building is approx 2m Euro (in local currency) - Banks will support us once we have secured the property by granting mortgages  with grace periods up to 10 years, also renovation funds and working capital requirements, there are also EU funds which will made available for the renovation and works required. We shall also offer concessions to corporate investors (such as the gaming area, leisure complex and restaurant) we shall also sell or lease the private accommodation built into the project, this will add to the funding pool available for the project.

The Vision

To give Vukovar and its surrounding community a new heart so that it may grow and live through our offer of healing, wellness and therapy. We shall also educate the younger generations who are not responsible for what has happened.  They are already suffering from the actions of generations who are tolerant towards racism, nationalism and alcoholism.

The Mission

One of the missions to heal and offer a safe place for victims of Post Traumatic Stress  (1991/2 conflict), to teach in the community social awareness and skills to assist victims, as well as offer suitable solutions to change their way of thinking.

To establish programs for children of all ages, promoting wellness, healthy and spiritual ways of life, to include yoga, meditation and honesty, there is lots of research that demonstrates how children of all ages are being absorbed
into a very virtual society, there are far too many adverse activities the younger generations indulge in that pre-occupy their ability to actually experience and feel life.

A local based charity, The Coalition for Work With Psycho-trauma and Peace (CWWPP)is working for the empowerment of people during or after armed conflict or with the potential for such conflict to take control of their own lives, particularly at grass roots level. We will offer them facilities and resources to enable an international centre of excellence where we shall teach foreign students how to assist in their communities around the world, especially in war torn areas in every continent. They have agreed in principal to accept our offer.

We shall also be working with an established English language school from the region and/or overseas - the view to open a private school on one of the floors; our research shows there is a need for such a school. The syllabus will be based on Cambridge system and meet the necessary local legal requirements, There is no such offering within 250km of our location, but there are 2 large cities in close vicinity with populations and financial capacity to provide up to 75 students. We shall also open an English language kindergarten for children up to the age of 6
years old, covering English syllabus.  Parents will have a choice on where best to educate their children, something very new and futuristic for the local community.

The Property


The building is currently empty and being allowed to go into a state of disrepair. The former accommodation area is ready for reconstruction (all interior walls have been removed)- the original project of the current owners was being funded partly with European Union funds (some 2.5m Euro allocated)to convert it to a 4* hotel and leisure complex. The town already is home to a 4* hotel, whilst there is a requirement for rooms in the area, we feel the occupation rates will be much higher by offering essential and basic needs for the current necessity, with the

ability to adapt and change the building in the future to cater for busy periods and events held locally.

Plan for the current building -

The Building itself has 8 floors and a basement - the current market valuation in its present state is approx 5m Euro - with an estimated value of post renovation of up to 6.3m Euro. The objective is to have the facility fully functional by Summer 2016, to enable us to attract students to the English school for Autumn 2016. We are able to open the building in stages and dependent on financial capacity we can begin works as early as September 2015, with ground floor operational at the end of 2015, with the first 2 floors of accommodation completed and operational in January 2016.

Basement - Sports bar and gaming area (yes probably a casino or sports betting area)we shall probably lease to an established operator who will provide an exclusive area for guests to enjoy,  We have approached interested parties and will continue to negotiate a suitable agreement once the building is secured.  Alternative uses for this area are being considered.

First floor - entrance to basement area - small reception area - right side a selection of boutiques and small offices for lease to local companies. Entrance to main lobby and hotel area leading to back of property where we shall reconstruct the restaurant and bar areas, in a modern but culturally sensitive feel - adopting old and new interior designs where we can - extending out to terraces overlooking the River Danube and the footpaths leading form the property - the kitchens and restaurant will be catering for the businesses of the area and offer 4-5* cuisine - the kitchen will also prepare meals for the student areas, as well as outside catering for events in the area.

Second and third floors - to create low cost reasonable accommodation approx 20 double beds and 40 single beds (in bunk bed hostel style)- these can be taken up during the week days by students in the town and facility, and weekends by visitors to the town. The idea is not to compete with the 4* hotel -  there will also be a student communal area where we shall serve meals as part of their arrangements!

Fourth floor - to be used for the community activities that will offer meditation, yoga and other well being classes for all ages, as well as an area where local artists and writers can come and sit in peace and gain inspiration - this area can be converted into dormitory type sleeping spaces for use when there are major events in the town (and there are many of them)at the time of writing there is also a requirement to sleep 100 children twice per week in the town yet there is no space for them
anywhere - we will aim to fill the gap.

Fifth floor- conference facilities and office spaces for the international charity that has agreed in principle to the project involvement (CWWPP)- they have been present in the town since the end of the conflict and offer free support, and assistance to PTS victims as well as other necessary (alcoholism, abuse, trauma etc), they work extensively in the community and teach others to help others - this facility will enable them to offer walk in services, in house studies and many other
wonderful opportunities to expand their field of work to other countries. International conferences will be hosted in the facility, and will house state of the art technology to allow live streaming around the world.

Sixth Floor - International School and Kindergarten - English Language and Syllabus - I have approached 2 English schools with a view to cooperation, instead of us trying to reinvent the wheel we should offer their program - it is up to us to find the students, there is no such school within 250km of the town, and there is a demand for private English education in the region. We will attract students from Bosnia, Croatia and Serbia as all borders are very close - for older students we can offer accommodation also.

Seventh and attic floors - Private accommodation 3 apartments which will be sold or leased.

Within the complex there is a plan to build an extra new area which will include a small swimming pool, saunas and gymnasium -this new space will be constructed above the existing kitchen area at the rear of the hotel. the outlook will be the River Danube.  I shall discuss with architects the feasibility of making a roof top terrace and garden, so we can create an amazing outlook across the whole region and incorporate the beauty and nature into our wonderful venue.

Current Position

There have been discussions with bankers, at this time they need to involve head offices  due to the scale of the project - this process is likely to take some 6 weeks for them to complete their assessment and due diligence process.  We are aware of other bankers that have a keen interest in supporting a project of this nature therefore we can negotiate discounts on finance and/or sponsorship deals to promote them in the community (this is much easier once we are a client and have the asset), as this town is really a symbol of the Country and region. 

A team of local lawyers has agreed to work for free on the project, they can sense the value and importance this vision brings to the community.  Others in the community have committed to assist once we have secured the premises.

Once we secure the building I will be embarking on a national campaign to promote the project and secure additional sponsorship with socially conscious corporates, and sports ambassadors from all over the Balkans.

On acquisition of the building we shall be eligible to apply for EU funds - the current owner has been awarded 2.2m Euro from the central fund for the reconstruction and development -  there are other funds available for this project and will be meeting with the representatives from regional offices in due course I expect that we shall be eligible for up to 3m Euro in non-returnable grant funding - in addition to this we will also receive funding for creation of jobs in the town - the project will create 50-60 working places.


It would be very fitting for the President of Croatia to officially open and/or endorse this project in November 2016, this will be the 25th Anniversary of the fall of Vukovar - whilst this day is one of remembrance, it shall also be used a day to demonstrate to the "City of Heroes"  there is a new beacon shining, that is here to guide and help them in times of need - a true lighthouse.  I will seek guidance on who is the most appropriate statesman to officially open the venue - it may be more appropriate to invite a group of International sports and health ambassadors to celebrate a new beginning.

This project is evolving on a daily basis, I will post updates, I have created a closed group face book page which gives more details and pictures, please contact me for access.

Additional Help Needed - Please share this vision with people you fell will appreciate it and can offer assistance in any way - I am not a magician - I need volunteers to join the existing ones who are helping already - architects - publicists, philanthropists, NGO's, entrepreneurs and anyone who is willing to help.  Please direct emails to lighthouseproject@tdcgroup.ru


I am grateful for your time and input – and look forward to a successful project!


History of Vukovar from - Wikipedia 

Official town website - www.vukovar.hr

International Airport (30km) Osijek (OSI) - http://www.osijek-airport.hr
story_txt:
Lighthouse Project - To renovate a former iconic building into a multi-purpose centre for entertainment, education and healing. The primary focus is a centre of excellence, with far reaching benefits to the community and other parts of the world. As an independent facility we remain focused on our core philosophies, principles and beliefs - without the interference of external factors such as politics or local Government . In today's economic environment we have to rely on our creativity to be unique and successful in our business approach, hence the opportunity I have pleasure presenting to you.
The Story - Introduction by Deane ThomasI would like to tell
you why I feel so passionate about the lighthouse project and how, together, we
can transform lives, not only here in Vukovar, but also throughout the world.
I first came to
Vukovar in 1998 with my family – I saw with my own eyes the after effects of an
armed conflict – I saw an iconic building as an opportunity - a positive change
can be made, by adding some creativity and western influence to a torn culture.
The building was once a
regional place to be, a beacon serving the whole area – its’ atmosphere was
buzzing with celebrations and commemorations – it was the heart of the town.
When I returned here
to live last year I wondered why!! What is the purpose of me being here!  Then through my own personal healing and
growth I began to recall my original visions from 1998.
I decided that
something can be done and knew how together, we can make that change. As
entrepreneurs, visionaries, pioneers or as individuals – We are strong enough
to effect the changes needed – this is because we have lived our lives with
open minds and hearts, with visions and dreams, ideals and feelings.
We can transform this
Iconic building into a wonderful venue – one which will cater for the needs of
the community at a grass roots level, where we will capture the hearts and
souls of generations of people, especially the younger ones who are so
unnecessarily affected by the travesty that occurred here in 1991 – they have
an image that they have no responsibility for or to accept - it is our role to
change this here and now. 
By using new methods
of teaching, we will change these innocent lives; we will capture their hearts
and souls before they enter society; these techniques will include meditation,
yoga, healthy eating, honesty, truth and self-confidence – these children will
possess a much healthier outlook than at present.
We will help those
that suffer daily from the consequences of armed conflict; by offering
comprehensive ways of coming to terms and coping with living their lives in the
here and now. They will have valuable one on one counselling as well as group
activities – we shall also offer services such as alcohol and drug abuse
sessions for those that need it.
We will cater to
foreign students and teachers who will learn our valuable work directly in the
field – they will then return home to share and apply this knowledge in their
own communities, The transfer of healing and knowledge is at the core of this
program, together we will monitor and collect valuable data and witness the
success of our work at home and abroad.
In addition to this
vision, as an independent operator we have to ensure the complex is a
self-sufficient business unit.  Therefore
we will include a private English school and kindergarten, 40 bed hostel,
conference facilities, leisure and well-being centre, restaurant and
entertainment area. 
We will truly be
helping others to grow and learn - which in turn empowers them to live a
balanced healthy life.
Together we can make a
contribution, however large or small.
I ask you to  join me in lighting the first beacon in our
lighthouse, and allow it to shine and spread its’ light all over the world.
Thank you Introduction above in other languages  Russian French Spanish CroatianWhy do we need crowd funding?We need to secure the property, our aim is to raise as much of the purchase price through crowd funding - we can access business finance but it is limited for a new start project, therefore we feel crowd funding is the best means in which to assist us to achieve the initial financial requirements for the project. The purchase price of the building is approx 2m Euro (in local currency) - Banks will support us once we have secured the property by granting mortgages  with grace periods up to 10 years, also renovation funds and working capital requirements, there are also EU funds which will made available for the renovation and works required. We shall also offer concessions to corporate investors (such as the gaming area, leisure complex and restaurant) we shall also sell or lease the private accommodation built into the project, this will add to the funding pool available for the project.The Vision To give Vukovar and its surrounding community a new heart so
 that it may grow and live through our offer of healing, wellness and therapy. We shall also educate the younger generations who are not responsible for what has happened.  They are already suffering from the 
actions of generations who are tolerant towards racism, nationalism and alcoholism.The MissionOne of the missions to heal and offer a safe place for victims of Post Traumatic Stress  (1991/2 conflict), to teach in the community social awareness and skills to assist victims, as well as offer suitable solutions to change their way of thinking. To establish programs for children of all ages, promoting wellness, healthy and spiritual ways of life, to include yoga, meditation and honesty, there is lots of research that demonstrates how children of all ages are being absorbedinto a very virtual society, there are far too many adverse activities the younger generations indulge in that pre-occupy their ability to actually experience and feel life.A local based charity, The Coalition for Work With Psycho-trauma and Peace (CWWPP)is working for the empowerment of people during or after armed conflict or with the potential for such conflict to take control of their own lives, particularly at grass roots level. We will offer them facilities and resources to enable an international centre of excellence where we shall teach foreign students how to assist in their communities around the world, especially in war torn areas in every continent. They have agreed in principal to accept our offer.We shall also be working with an established English language school from the region and/or overseas - the view to open a private school on one of the floors; our research shows there is a need for such a school. The syllabus will be based on Cambridge system and meet the necessary local legal requirements, There is no such offering within 250km of our location, but there are 2 large cities in close vicinity with populations and financial capacity to provide up to 75 students. We shall also open an English language kindergarten for children up to the age of 6years old, covering English syllabus.  Parents will have a choice on where best to educate their children, something very new and futuristic for the local community.The PropertyThe building is currently empty and being allowed to go into a state of disrepair. The former accommodation area is ready for reconstruction (all interior walls have been removed)- the original project of the current owners was being funded partly with European Union funds (some 2.5m Euro allocated)to convert it to a 4* hotel and leisure complex. The town already is home to a 4* hotel, whilst there is a requirement for rooms in the area, we feel the occupation rates will be much higher by offering essential and basic needs for the current necessity, with theability to adapt and change the building in the future to cater for busy periods and events held locally.Plan for the current building -The Building itself has 8 floors and a basement - the current market

story:
THANK YOU VERY  MUCH FOR  YOUR SUPPORT!
IF YOU MISSED THE DEADLINE, FEEL TO CONTACT US ON FACEBOOK !



We are a team of experienced industry professionals based in Athens and Berlin. We are starting our crowdfunding campaign to help us realise a project we are very passionate about: A high-end short film about Greek Folklore.

We are profoundly interested in Greek folk tradition and want to re-imagine and bring these great atmospheric stories and music to an international contemporary audience.


We are making a short film about an alafroiskiotos, a person with a light shadow, one that can see into the spirit world of old, and his encounters with the ever seductive Neraides, the fairies of Greek folklore .



The visual approach will be highly stylised. We will borrow elements from the old and elevate them into a timeless status. For instance, in terms of costume design, we will be merging traditional folk costumes and jewelry with modern fashion.



As for music, we will be laying traditional sombre folk music over some avant-garde electronic atmospheres. We will also be implementing the same principle in cinematography, utilising analogue photography techniques in a modern way. This overall approach applies to all the aesthetic aspects, creating a unique world, a complete immersive experience.



Our aim is to also showcase the hidden  landscapes of Greece. We will be shooting on some amazing locations under the glorious natural light of the Attic sky. 


We have put together an amazing team of talented artists and we are currently in the pre-production phase of the film shoot. Through a unique blend of cutting edge aesthetics, experience and contacts we will be able to achieve a high-end artistic result for a very limited budget.

Finally, this film is a part of a planned short film trilogy that will also act as a proof of concept for a feature length film, currently in development.

We have put together some great rewards in the PERKS section on the right.
Please check them out, spread the word and help in any way you can!


We have calculated the budget trying to get the best out of your generosity and invest it solely on the quality of our project. If the goal is reached, any additional contributions will go towards the promotion of the film.

With your help we can cover the following costs:

  • Access to best possible equipment

  • Production costs

  • Costume making / material costs

  • Location costs

  • Post Production costs



As you can see from the PERKS section, we have some very exciting options! We want to share this experience with you, to make you a part of the process and to also provide some equally exciting mementos.

We want to enable you to view the entire process and to share behind the scenes material as well as some cool tips about the techniques we will be using to achieve our stylised look. As music is really an important part of this project, we will also be making the soundtrack available for digital download via the PERKS.

Finally we will also be creating some great concept art for our characters as well as an illustrated poster that you can choose to make yours.



We have a proven record in the industry having worked in major feature films such as The Two Faces of January, The Fifth Estate, Harry Potter & the Prisoner of Azkaban, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Dogtooth, Attenberg, Kinetta and more. We have also worked for big international brands such as Mercedes Benz, Volkswagen, Hugo Boss, Jimy Choo, British Fashion Council, VOGUE, Dom Perignon, Vodafone, O2, Absolut Vodka and many more.

For more specific information, please feel free to download a short presentation of our team here.  (this will be constantly updated as we add cast/crew).





Finally, if you are excited about this project but are not able to contribute financially, please help us spread the word about this campaign! 

Feel free to use INDIEGOGO's easy tools to share our campaign to your friends and social media contacts!

PLEASE LIKE US ON FACEBOOK: Mandēlion Facebook Film Page


* The images appearing on the various moodboards are only a part of the visual research and not presented here as actual designs.

story:
Short Summary

Amelia’s Closet is a coming of age story about an 11-year-old girl from a low income background who lives with her hard working single father.  At school, she is heavily bullied and often left feeling powerless. In attempt to reclaim a sense of power, she steals from the kids bullying her but shamefully hides the items in her closet. Stakes are raised when Amelia becomes reckless.  When she gets caught red-handed, she is forced to confront the hidden items in her closet and find true sense of empowerment.  

Amelia's Closet is a touching story about confronting truths about oneself, empowerment, and perseverance. It's our hope that we can bring attention to this project because the message is about empowerment, specifically for kids who may feel alone or are experiencing bullying from their peers.


The Team

Halima Lucas (Director)

Meet Halima Lucas! Not only did she write Amelia's Closet, but she will be directing it come June! Halima is from Stockton California, attended the University of the Pacific and is in her 2nd year of the graduate Production Program at USC. She's already written and directed several short films including Jean, Micah and A Little Bit of Me (all three films are included in the Director's package perk!) We are thrilled to be working with this rising star!


Jeremy Burkett (Producer)

Amelia's Closet is being produced by the super talented Jeremy Burkett. Jeremy is also a Graduate student in USC's Production program and has produced a string of films including Over/Under, Obscured and Supernatural. Jeremy and team took home the Espoir award for their creative work documenting the 62nd Cannes Film Festival in 2009.  He is a native of St. Louis, a Howard University alumnus and hopes to write, direct and produce his own projects in the future.


Liz Boston (Producer)

Our producer extraordinaire, Liz Boston, is a graduate student in her second year of the Stark Producing Program at USC. She is a NJ native and prior to coming to USC has worked as an editor/producer for television news as well as an associate producer/coordinator for Philadelphia award shows, parades and concerts. In addition to producing and directing a web series, Liz has directed several short films and is currently working a TV development internship at MGM.


What We Need & What You Get

We have set a goal of $15,000 for our short film. The money you donate will go toward purchasing props and securing locations, providing food for the crew and hiring a studio teacher to be on set with our talented, young lead.

Amelia's Closet is a thesis project for our Director, Halima Lucas, and will definitely be made. In other words, there is NO DOUBT that you WILL GET a film. However, we need your help to make this film the best it can possibly be.

Risks

No matter what, you will receive a film made with passion and effort, no matter the amount raised.  Every donation given will be used for that purpose.  However, the further we are from meeting our goal, the more the production quality of Amelia's Closet will suffer. The story is about a young girl learning to empower herself and we want to honor this beautiful story with beautiful production value.  

The Impact

Film has the amazing ability to to tie the viewer in the shoes of a complete stranger in a way that allows the viewer to understand the character's point of view.  Amelia's Closet reflects a world and perspective that is not often explored and giving people the opportunity to understand the world of the film and the real lives they represent only brings more empathy and growth in the world.

Ultimately, it is our hope that - through this film - we can bring attention to important subjects such as bullying, education, socio-economic disparities, and the search for empowerment. 

By showing films such as Amelia's Closet in schools and youth mentoring programs, we will have reached a more personal goal of helping young ones to know that they are not alone and like Amelia, can find a way to navigate the educational system.  This story is also for educators and parents, who of course play a huge role in the development of young people like Amelia/

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you don't have the means to make a monetary donation, that's okay because there are still a ton of ways you can help! 

  • You can tell EVERYONE you know! Know someone who might be interested in supporting a project about empowerment? Great! Tell them about out project!  The more visitors to our Indiegogo page, the better. So please spread the word! (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, etc.)
  • We take in-kind donations! For example, if you don't have money but (for some odd reason) have a ton of Subway gift cards . . . we'll take that too!  
Thank you for taking the time to check out our project! We are so excited to share such a personal, meaningful and empowering story with the world! If you have any questions, comments or words of encouragement, feel free to leave a comment or send us an email!
story_txt:
Short Summary Amelia’s Closet is a coming of age story about an 11-year-old girl from a low income background who lives with her hard working single father.  At school, she is heavily bullied and often left feeling powerless. In attempt to reclaim a sense of power, she steals from the kids bullying her but shamefully hides the items in her closet. Stakes are raised when Amelia becomes reckless.  When she gets caught red-handed, she is forced to confront the hidden items in her closet and find true sense of empowerment.  
Amelia's Closet is a touching story about confronting truths about oneself, empowerment, and perseverance. It's our hope that we can bring attention to this project because the message is about empowerment, specifically for kids who may feel alone or are experiencing bullying from their peers.

The Team
Halima Lucas (Director)


Meet Halima Lucas! Not only did she write Amelia's Closet, but she will be directing it come June! Halima is from Stockton California, attended the University of the Pacific and is in her 2nd year of the graduate Production Program at USC. She's already written and directed several short films including Jean, Micah and A Little Bit of Me (all three films are included in the Director's package perk!) We are thrilled to be working with this rising star!
Jeremy Burkett (Producer)


Amelia's Closet is being produced by the super talented Jeremy Burkett. Jeremy is also a Graduate student in USC's Production program and has produced a string of films including Over/Under, Obscured and Supernatural. Jeremy and team took home the Espoir award for their creative work documenting the 62nd Cannes Film Festival in 2009.  He is a native of St. Louis, a Howard University alumnus and hopes to write, direct and produce his own projects in the future.
Liz Boston (Producer)


Our producer extraordinaire, Liz Boston, is a graduate student in her second year of the Stark Producing Program at USC. She is a NJ native and prior to coming to USC has worked as an editor/producer for television news as well as an associate producer/coordinator for Philadelphia award shows, parades and concerts. In addition to producing and directing a web series, Liz has directed several short films and is currently working a TV development internship at MGM.
What We Need & What You Get
 We have set a goal of $15,000 for our short film. The money you donate will go toward purchasing props and securing locations, providing food for the crew and hiring a studio teacher to be on set with our talented, young lead.
Amelia's Closet is a thesis project for our Director, Halima Lucas, and will definitely be made. In other words, there is NO DOUBT that you WILL GET a film. However, we need your help to make this film the best it can possibly be.

Risks

No matter what, you will receive a film made with passion and effort, no matter the amount raised.  Every donation given will be used for that purpose.  However, the further we are from meeting our goal, the more the production quality of Amelia's Closet will suffer. The story is about a young girl learning to empower herself and we want to honor this beautiful story with beautiful production value.     The Impact Film has the amazing ability to to tie the viewer in the shoes of a complete stranger in a way that allows the viewer to understand the character's point of view.  Amelia's Closet reflects a world and perspective that is not often explored and giving people the opportunity to understand the world of the film and the real lives they represent only brings more empathy and growth in the world.
Ultimately, it is our hope that - through this film - we can bring attention to important subjects such as bullying, education, socio-economic disparities, and the search for empowerment. 
By showing films such as Amelia's Closet in schools and youth mentoring programs, we will have reached a more personal goal of helping young ones to know that they are not alone and like Amelia, can find a way to navigate the educational system.  This story is also for educators and parents, who of course play a huge role in the development of young people like Amelia/

    Other Ways You Can Help  If you don't have the means to make a monetary donation, that's okay because there are still a ton of ways you can help!  

You can tell EVERYONE you know! Know someone who might be interested in supporting a project about empowerment? Great! Tell them about out project!  The more visitors to our Indiegogo page, the better. So please spread the word! (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, etc.) We take in-kind donations! For example, if you don't have money but (for some odd reason) have a ton of Subway gift cards . . . we'll take that too!  

Thank you for taking the time to check out our project! We are so excited to share such a personal, meaningful and empowering story with the world! If you have any questions, comments or words of encouragement, feel free to leave a comment or send us an email!

story:
IMPURE THE MOVIE


STORY

13-YEAR-OLD DINAH JONES LIVES WITH THE CONSTANT ABUSE OF HER FANATICAL MOTHER LEAH. LEAH BLAMES THE GIRL FOR THE MYSTERIOUS DEATH OF DINAH'S GRANDFATHER, ISAAC, A DEVILISH PATRIARCH WHOSE SHADOW CONTINUES TO LOOM OVER THEIR FAMILY. DINAH'S FATHER AND BROTHERS ARE NO HELP: DINAH IS TRULY ALONE. TORMENTED BY BULLIES AND DISMISSED BY AN INDIFFERENT TEACHER, SHE RETREATS INTO A FANTASY WORLD, SPINNING MACABRE STORIES FOR AN AUDIENCE OF RATTY OLD DOLLS HIDDEN IN HER BEDROOM. EVEN THERE, SHE’S MOCKED BY THE WORD LEAH PAINTED ON THE WALL AS A CONSTANT REMINDER THAT DINAH IS “IMPURE”.

WITH THE SEEDS OF EVIL PLANTED AT HOME AND TENDED BY THE CRUEL WORLD OUTSIDE, SOMETHING HORRIBLE TAKES ROOT IN HER SOUL.

FOR A LONELY BOY NAMED CALEB, DINAH BECOMES HIS FIRST TRUE FRIEND, AND HE HAPPILY JOINS IN HER GROWING DARKNESS. BLINDED BY HIS OWN CHILDHOOD TRAUMA, DINAH’S ALCOHOLIC UNCLE EDDY BECOMES A PAWN IN HER PLANS. A SHY, SECRETIVE SCHOOL JANITOR SEES THE DANGER, BUT CAN HE BRING HIMSELF TO TELL THE TRUTH BEFORE IT’S TOO LATE? ONE BY ONE, SHE’LL MAKE HER ENEMIES PAY. WHO WOULD EVER SUSPECT THAT A QUIET, LITTLE GIRL IS THE SOURCE OF SO MUCH SUFFERING?

DINAH IS NOW PURE… PURE EVIL.



THE MAIN PRODUCTION TEAM:


Dana Olita - Creator/Director/Producer
While this film will be the freshmen feature film for Dana, she has numerous time behind the camera. Her vision that led to this movie was strong enough for her to want to take the reins and drive the production to success. In order to make it all come to life, she invested her personal time, energy, and money into finding the right crew to work with on this production, including film school graduates and those people familiar with film and the film process.

Michael Scotti Jr. - Co-Director
Having worked on short films, Michael is now ready to push the envelope and take on the feature film role as co-director, along with Dana. His talent and style of directing create a subtle but poignant look at the human condition, often times getting several messages across to the audience at once. And while his experience is notable to drama or comedy, Michael seeks new challenges at all times in his film career.

W Jeff Crawford - Producer
Having worked on more than 16 productions, including commercials, web series, film competition winners, and feature and short films, Jeff likes the challenge of making a movie happen in his home state of Pennsylvania. Director and Producer on several award-winning films, Jeff tends to gravitate towards productions that really need assistance getting off the ground. His long hours and perseverance have made him a credit to all film works he's helped with. And his knowledge and capabilities behind the camera are unsurpassed by many. He enjoys making a movie a success, especially feature films.

Randy Rock - Director of Photography
Randy is a graduate of Full Sail University, an established school for filmmaking, with a degree in Film. His love of colors, styles, and looks is why his material stands out much better than most cinematographers or DPs. And his technical knowledge is something many films need in order to succeed. His company, Golden City Films, has worked on numerous projects from commercial creation, to short films. While this will be Randy's first feature film, his teammates have complete confidence in his abilities.

THE CAST:

View the IMDB here: 

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4009484/?ref_=ttpl_...

RORY OGDEN as DINAH JONES

BILL OBERST JR as ISSAC JONES

KAREN-EILEEN GORDON as LEAH JONES

JACOB SCHMITT as CALEB

LAMAR KUKUK as EDDY JONES

DANIELLE FEIN as MRS. GRANT

TAELOR HIGH as MADISON

ANDRES RIVERA as JOSE


SCOTT GEITER as BOB

JESSICA GONDWE as AMANDA HARDEN

LISA BUDWIG as PRINCIPAL SMYTH

ROBERT HAAG as SCHOOL SUPERINTENDENT

JERRY PIETRALA as JACOB JONES

SARAH LYNN DEWEY as CRYSTAL

DAVID NORMAN NORTH as DETECTIVE REECE

MAX WASA as RACHAEL (CALEB'S MOTHER)

THE TITUS TRIPLETS as SIMON & LEVI JONES




WHAT WE NEED:
We are asking for $50,000 to help in the funding our film.  It is our desire to make a high quality Hollywood style movie here in Central PA.   We have some great Hollywood talent already cast, vetern horror icon Bill Oberst Jr, Karen-Eileen Gordon and Max Wasa.  We also have some amazing local talent like rising star Rory Nicole Ogden, Jacob Schmitt and so many others.  
The money raised will help pay for things like feeding the cast and crew, set locations, costumes, hair and make up and special effects.   



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • It's OK if you can't contribute.  We could use your help on a few other items:
  • Can you share our Indiegogo page?
  • Can you like and share our FB Page? https://www.facebook.com/ImpureMovie
  • Can you follow our twitter acct? https://twitter.com/ImpureTheMovie

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Thank you to everyone who supported this campaign!
You can continue to make donations at 18inchjourney.com/support.


June 2015 - We have broken ground!


Our Dream
Fifteen years ago, Melissa and I joined my mother and father on this 52 acre piece of land called “A Place for the Heart”, and launched a one week creative worship camp for high schoolers.

We wanted to create a place for them to encounter the freedom of the gospel of Jesus. This one-week camp grew into a two-month school, which grew into an extended internship, which then became a six-month second phase of the school. 
Along the way, as we have grown, we’ve intentionally kept our schools smaller, and more intimate in nature. Our desire is to be face to face with the students that come, to sit and eat at a table together, and pour into their lives in a personal way.
Today, we host Phase 1 and Phase 2 of the 18 Inch Journey, internships, and retreats, and have a full time staff running the schools with us every year.  What was a small seed, the dream of God for this land, has fully blossomed.

Our Vision
My father started this ministry on a principle from Mother Theresa, “If you wait till you have what you think you need to do ministry, you’ll never do ministry.” God used the stick that was in Moses’ hand to deliver Israel from Egypt. We have used everything in our hands to host our first worship camp and many 18 Inch Journey schools since.  

Over the past eight years, we’ve expanded, remodeled, and rearranged our buildings in every way imaginable to host our schools and retreats. We’ve turned barns into apartments and sheds into studios. With the expansion of our discipleship schools and internships, we simply need more space. We have maxed out the capacity of our facilities. Now we need your help to expand our housing for the dream to continue to grow.

Our History
Since 2008:
  • Seven 18 Inch Journey schools
  • Students coming from 27 states and 15 countries
  • Total of 137 students who have been radically changed by the love of Jesus!

 

Our Need

We believe one bunk can change the world. More cabins means more bunks. More bunks means more hearts. And each heart that encounters the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit will never be the same. Marriages, families, culture, cities, and nations will be blessed and impacted by the DNA of the sons and daughters who come to this land, setting apart a season to be with God, and family. Help us change the world by investing in this dream.

Our goal is to build three new cabins for student housing. Each of these cabins cost around $50,000 so we need to raise $150,000.  

  • $50,000 we can build One cabin
  • $100,000 we can build Two cabins
  • $150,000 we can build Three cabins.

Our plan is to break ground in May, and have these cabins built before the start of our next 18 Inch Journey School in the Fall. The $150,000 goal is our first step toward a much larger vision for these 52 acres of land. In the last year we have designed a layout for the property with buildings, studios, classrooms, and cabins that stretch out across these beautiful rolling hills. To fulfill this ultimate goal we would need over 2 million dollars, so $150,00 is just a baby step, but it still feels like a giant leap!  Any money that we raise above $150,000 will go into the many dreams we have for expanding the dream God has given us.

How you can be involved

We need your help.

Here’s how you can be be involved:

  1. You can make a pledge and claim one of our amazing perks.
  2. Help spread the word.  This is a community effort and we would love the support of your local community or church to reach our goal.
Your support will help this generation encounter Jesus, and equip them to live healthy and thriving lives.  Thank you so much for considering giving to this dream. We could not do what we do without your help.

For more information about the 18 Inch Journey, check out www.18inchjourney.com.
www.jonathanhelser.com
www.aplacefortheheart.org
www.cagelessbirds.com

story:
We Are Black Alphabet

Black Alphabet is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization formed in Chicago, Illinois. Our premier program is the Black Alphabet Film Festival (BAFF), a film festival  designed and dedicated to showcasing works by and about the Black LGBTQ/SGL community. Our  mission is to empower our community by promoting, nurturing and celebrating the stories of Black LGBTQ-identified people through the art of film.

Black Alphabet Film Festival is returning for its 3rd year and expanding to a 4-day event!

Since the festival’s inaugural year, BAFF has featured 20 films and shorts with 1 international film. With growing interest and attendance, BAFF is excited to not only expand the number of feature and short films and increase audience size, but also the number of days the festival will be hosted in the city of Chicago this year. 

    Why We Need Your Support

    This year,  BAFF plans to expand our 2015 festival to a four day festival beginning on Thursday, July 23 and ending on Sunday, July 26, 2015. To achieve this goal, we will need to raise a minimum of $5,000 to help us implement this plan. With your help we hope to reach it and perhaps surpass it. 

    The 2015 festival will open at The Reva and David Logan Center for the Arts on July 23 and 24 on the south side on the University of Chicago campus in Chicago's historic Hyde Park neighborhood. We then move to Center on Halsted in the Lakeview neighborhood for a third year in a row with two full days of screenings on July 25 and 26. 

    If you have attended or have volunteered at either of BAFF's previous two festival outings, you know that we strive to serve our community by bringing great programming in premiere venues across the city. With your support we can continue to grow and reach our goal of bringing expanded entertainment value to your summer.

    Funds raised from this campaign will assist the organization in paying for the following:

    • Printing Costs (Programs, Tickets and VIP Passes)
    • Venue, Equipment, Screening and Staffing Costs
    • Honorariums/Travel/Hotel Costs for our Guest Filmmakers
    • Entertainment & Catering
    • Marketing & Advertising for the Festival
    • Incentives for IndieGoGo Campaign 

    Other Ways to Get Involved

    Any support that you can provide for the Black Alphabet Film Festival is greatly appreciated! If you or anyone you know would like to volunteer, please sign up at http://blackalphabet.org/volunteer/. 

    You can also help by spreading the word and telling your friends, families and film enthusiasts about the Black Alphabet Film Festival. Ensure that you use the Indiegogo share tools to inform people of the festival via social media.

    To keep up with the latest about Black Alphabet and the film festival, feel free to visit and/or post on our Facebook (http://facebook.com/blackalphabetCHICAGO) Twitter (http://twitter.com/BlackAlphabet #BAFF2015) and Instagram (http://instagram.com/Black__Alphabet) pages. You can also join our mailing list by visiting our newly revamped website at www.blackalphabet.org and learn more about the organization. The more you share the more opportunities we have to continue to tell the stories of Black LGBTQ people everywhere!

    Thank you in advance for all of your support!

story:
The Rahway International Film Festival was first held in June of 2013 in an effort to create a warm and welcoming home for independent filmmakers and fans of film in the Tri-State Area. We annually showcase short films, and now feature films in competition and music videos throughout the day while offering networking and workshop opportunities to those interested in the film industry.

What makes us unique?

Our Mission:
Our mission is to provide an opportunity for artists worldwide to showcase works that educate, and inspire equality, empathy and awareness through film.

Our Vision:
We believe that film can reach the mind and soul in ways nothing else can. For this reason, we present films that strive to promote equality, champion the oppressed and promote open-mindedness.

In keeping with equality, we seek to present an equal ratio of films created by male and female filmmakers from around the world.

Rahway International Film Festival is returning for its third year and expanding to a 3-day event!

We do our best to select intriguing, thoughtful, and entertaining films.  We want you to be riveted-- like these folks!


We offer seminars and talk backs from extremely talented filmmakers.  They are both informative and enjoyable!  

     

Our Networking Events have proven to be quite lucrative over the past few years.  You can meet filmmakers, writers, actors, and more - all while enjoying a delicious catered meal and a cash bar!


We've Got Some Pretty Cool Supporters too!



This year we would like to do all of the above plus MORE over the course of 3 days!

That means MORE films (including both FEATURES & SHORTS), more workshops, more seminars, more filmmaker Q&As, and much more!

There will be plenty to see in Downtown Rahway on the weekend of August 28-30, 2015!  We hope to see you there!

Learn More about RIFF from Festival Founder, 

Gina Marie Rodriguez 

and Della Crews of NJ News12




There are a lot of expenses that come with a project of this size and that's why we need your support!  We want to give you the BEST possible festival that we can and we would like you to be a part of that!

By donating, you become a part of the experience.  We appreciate each and every one of you more than we can express.  We hope that you accept these gifts as a small token of our gratitude.  This project is a labor of love and we do it for you, lovers of film and art.  

You mean more to us than our gifts can ever express!

Here are a few of our expenses so that you know exactly where your donation will go:

  • Award Prizes for our Filmmakers
  • Printing Costs (Programs, Tickets and VIP Passes)
  • Event Rentals & Decorations
  • Compensation/Travel/Accomodation Costs for our Guest Speakers
  • Entertainment & Catering
  • Marketing & Advertising for the Festival
  • IndieGoGo Incentives (and Fees)



As listed to the side of our page, check out what gifts we have in store for you!

$5 USD = A Very Special Thank You!

A very special thank you in our program and on our website!


$10 USD = Social Media Shout Out!
A shout out on our Twitter and Facebook pages!

Plus, everything listed above!

$25 USD = Personalized Video Shout Out! 
Festival Director, Gina Marie Rodriguez, will post a personalized Thank You Vid for you on our Twitter and Facebook pages! 
Plus, everything listed above! 

$50 USD = Your Own RIFF T-Shirt!
A "Keep Calm and Watch a Movie/ Or Make One" RIFF T-Shirt! As seen in our Gallery photos.
Plus, everything listed above! 

$75 USD = A Musical Dedication!
The lovely and talented Kim Boyko (Check her out on YouTube at www.youtube.com/SingingWithKim) will let you select a song for her to perform in one of her upcoming videos. Want a shout-out? Want to dedicate a song to someone else? Or, if you don't have a song in mind- ask her to write one just for you!
Plus, everything listed above!

$125 USD = 1 Day VIP Package!
The 1 day VIP package includes a RIFF T-Shirt, a RIFF Mug, One Beverage Voucher from the Hamilton Stage Snack Bar (Alcoholic or Non) and an All Day/All Access Pass to all film screenings, seminars, and talk-backs over the course of 1 day.
*You must inform RIFF of the date of your choice in advance of the festival.  (You may wait until the Festival line-up is announced.)  If you do not inform RIFF in advance, we cannot guarantee you a pass.

$175 = Photo Sesh for You!
The wonderfully talented Asha Bryant is offering headshots (Acting & Corporate), and couples/family/individual portraits. Digital images will be made available through a private gallery on her website (www.ashabryantphoto.com), and will include basic color corrections and adjustments. Enhanced retouching (blemish removal & skin smoothing) is available for an additional fee. Photos will be shot on location within a 5 mile radius of Linden, NJ.
*If purchasing this reward, you must be comfortable having your image featured on Asha's website and/or social media pages.

$225 USD = 2 Day VIP Package!

The 2 day VIP package includes a RIFF T-Shirt, a RIFF Mug, Two Beverage Vouchers from the Hamilton Stage Snack Bar (Alcoholic or Non) and an All Day/All Access Pass to all film screenings, seminars, and talk-backs over the course of 2 days.

*You must inform RIFF of the dates of your choice in advance of the festival.  (You may wait until the Festival line-up is announced.)  If you do not inform RIFF in advance, we cannot guarantee you a pass.


$325 USD = 3 Day VIP Package!

The 3 day VIP package includes a RIFF T-Shirt, a RIFF Mug, Three Beverage Vouchers from the Hamilton Stage Snack Bar (Alcoholic or Non) and an All Day/All Access Pass to all film screenings, seminars, and talk-backs over the course of 3 days.

*You must confirm your attendance in advance of the festival.  (You may wait until the Festival line-up is announced.)  If you do not inform RIFF in advance, we cannot guarantee you a pass.


$525 = Gold VIP 3 Package (for two)!

The Gold VIP 3 package includes two RIFF T-Shirts, two RIFF Mugs, Three Beverage Vouchers (per person) from the Hamilton Stage Snack Bar (Alcoholic or Non) and two All Day/All Access Passes to all film screenings, seminars, and talk-backs over the course of 3 days.

*You must confirm your attendance in advance of the festival.  (You may wait until the Festival line-up is announced.)  If you do not inform RIFF in advance, we cannot guarantee you a pass.


$1,000 = Platinum VIP 3 Package (for two)!

The Gold VIP 3 package includes two RIFF T-Shirts, two RIFF Mugs, Three Beverage Vouchers (per person) from the Hamilton Stage Snack Bar (Alcoholic or Non) and two All Day/All Access Passes to all film screenings, seminars, and talk-backs over the course of 3 days.

This package will also include a lovely Dinner for Two at Luciano's Ristorante in Rahway, NJ (a value of $200).

*You must confirm your attendance in advance of the festival.  (You may wait until the Festival line-up is announced.)  If you do not inform RIFF in advance, we cannot guarantee you a pass.



What is the impact, you ask? You will have helped create an event meant to give hope and happiness to others like yourself.

Sometimes, we all need an escape from reality.  And so we dive into art.


The RIFF Team thanks you for your support! Please help us by sharing this campaign with everyone you know!
story_txt:
The Rahway International Film Festival was first held in June of 2013 in an effort to create a warm and welcoming home for independent filmmakers and fans of film in the Tri-State Area. We annually showcase short films, and now feature films in competition and music videos throughout the day while offering networking and workshop opportunities to those interested in the film industry.
What makes us unique?
Our Mission:Our mission is to provide an opportunity for artists worldwide to showcase works that educate, and inspire equality, empathy and awareness through film.Our Vision:We believe that film can reach the mind and soul in ways nothing else can. For this reason, we present films that strive to promote equality, champion the oppressed and promote open-mindedness.In keeping with equality, we seek to present an equal ratio of films created by male and female filmmakers from around the world.
Rahway International Film Festival is returning for its third year and expanding to a 3-day event!
We do our best to select intriguing, thoughtful, and entertaining films.  We want you to be riveted-- like these folks!We offer seminars and talk backs from extremely talented filmmakers.  They are both informative and enjoyable!

story:
Short Summary

I am Yan Birch, an Actor originally from Sweden and I have worked in the US for many years in Film, TV and Commercials.
I am developing a TV Series based on ME, my true life back story before becoming an actor. I believe this Series will bring new heights to the world of entertainment with excitement, drama, compassion, laughter and a lot of heart. I am launching this campaign to involve my fans and friends to enable us to put this project on speed track and get the Pilot written by the best writer from the very beginning of its inception. Together with my partners, I have been working on this Project for almost 3 years and believe the time is "now" to get this going. This Project has a voice, its a a message of 'PEACE" along the parallels of every day life.  I feel passionate to share this and get it out into the world, as it is very important to me. 

Because we are already calling in every favor we can, we are only looking for a small amount from you, our contributors,  to get involved with the initial cost of the written material and the further development of the Project. Your contributions that we achieve with this campaign will therefore have an enormous magnitude of meaning and give us the right possibilities to move forward. I am very excited to involve my fans and friends in this process as it will keep you in "the loop" from the beginning via FaceBook and Twitter and this will give more meaning to my Project as a whole.

What We Need 

At this time we are asking for $2,306.00 

The funds will be used for:

  • Advance down payment to have the Pilot written based on the true back story and our years of development.
  • The initial Trademark/s being filed on behalf of the Project.
  • All filings for the copyrights of the written Pilot.

What You Get

We have some great perks for everyone contributing to this campaign!

  • Contributing $101.00 or more -  Signed and dated Script Cover page Collectible and Lunch in Los Angeles with Yan Birch and his main team  - 5 available
  • Contributing $100.00 -  Signed and dated Script Cover page Collectible - 10 available
  • Contributing $25.00 - Signed 8 x 10 Collectible - 50 available
  • Contributing $10.00 - A hand written thank you note - 100 available
  • Contributing $1.00 - An Acknowledgement and a Thank you on the FB page and the Website of the Project
  • If we don't reach our entire goal,  we will use whatever money we raise towards what we launched the campaign for.  Anything will help us get closer to where we want to be with this Project and we are excited to involve fans and friends in the process even if we don't reach 100% of our goal.   As they say, "IT TAKES A VILLAGE".

The Impact

  • This Project is deeply personal to me so I am very humbled and excited to move closer to sharing it with the world. These contributions will get us so much closer to making this happen.

Challenges

As with any entertainment Project we could get stuck on the way to making it happen even if we reach our goals with this Campaign. I do believe because of my many years in the industry on an international level and with the many contacts and friends I picked up on the way, that we have a very good plan in place to be able to overcome most if not all possible obstacles and be successful in reaching our final goal  and be able to bring this Project to the masses.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cant contribute at this time, please help us by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.
